name: Plane Game
description: This game is hard to get any details on... It was commercially produced and is in the Smithsonian Udvar-Hazy Aviation Museum extension at Dulles Airport. Given its age and craftsmanship, I have placed the age at 1925. The airplanes actually similar the Spirit of St Louis, but the game bears no resemblance to trying to cross the Atlantic. You use magnets to "fling" an airplane against another magnet on the "wall" at the far side. In the 4 photos (to be uploaded) are the board and shots of the suspended magnet used in flying the airplanes.

name: Camp
description:
The game takes place in the jungle where up to four teams try to fulfill the same research instructions. The player who fulfills this order first is the winner.

The game consists of one gameboard, 12 pawns, 16 cards and one rulebook with the following three languages: German/French/Italian.
Ages 8 and up

name: Alpha Bet
description:
Alpha Bet is the game of poker put to words. It incorporates all the strategy and luck of poker with the skill and verbal agility of scrabble. A game for wordsmiths of all ages.

OBJECT: To obtain the highest number of points by combining the cards in your hand into a single word. The word must use two or more cards.

THE DECK: The game consists of a 102 card deck (two of which are wild cards). It contains cards from A to Z. Each card has a point value, except wild cards. (Most games do not use the wild cards but it is an option if you wish to play with wild cards).

MANNER OF PLAY: Alpha Bet may be played in any style of poker, Texas Hold-em, five card draw, seven card stud, etc.

name: Quadfootball
description:
A fun & tactical game for all the family, involving up to four 5-a-side teams playing on the same field against each other at the same time.

Very rare numbered limited edition game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Spindow
description:
From the Publisher:

Spindow is our Spinning Wheel Strategy game. Whatever the size of your group, 2 to 4 players, this is a great game to play. Wins come quickly and play becomes strategic as winning color combinations are removed from the game board.

You spin to win. As simple as Checkers yet as intriguing as Chess, this creative design allows players of all ages to spin the color wheel and try to get a winning combination of 5 across or down.

Spindow looks so good you won't want to put it away.

Players: 2 or 4
Ages 8 - 108

name: La giostra dei draghi
description: Played on a hexagonal board. Each player controls 5 mighty dragons represented by dice, aiming to capture the opponents' ones and remain the last player on the board.

name: Game of Butterflies
description: This wooden box game has a hinged lid which opens upright to reveal die-cut clowns which holds butterfly nets of wire and cheesecloth. Object of game is similar to Tiddledy Winks, you try and put tokens into these nets.

name: The Red Ryder Target Game
description: The game comes with a die-cut board which folds back and is placed on the box insert. The game comes with four red balls that fit into a metal spring-type catapult that shoots balls into some tee-pees and target holes which have different point allocations.

name: No Time For Sergeants
description: This spin and move game is based on the 1964 ABC TV series which starred S. Jackson (Andy Griffin was the original star in the movies) as Will Stockdale. The game comes with a spinner, Goof Cards, Service Ribbons, Cone shaped markers used for the playing pieces. The object of the game is to simply get from the outside row to the inner part of the board. Goof spaces can send you back squares. You have pass/fail squares where your character needs to pass the Army physical in order to move forward.

name: Hopalong Cassidy Lasso Game
description: The game box contains an 8x12" painted Masonite board with 3 metal pegs attached. A 7.5" tall plastic figure in the shape of Hoppy and his horse Topper is designed with a hole in the bottom to fit on the center peg. Game also comes with two 4" tall wood pegs and three rope lassos. Object of the game is to lasso Hoppy with rings, so the game is somewhat similar to ring-toss.
categories: Action / Dexterity, American West, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Man From U.N.C.L.E.: The Thrush Ray-Gun Affair
description: Second " Man from UNCLE" game from IDEAL (1966). The board comes with four "U.N.C.L.E." markers, 4 barns that serve as "THRUSH" hideouts, movers, crayons and decoder cards. Centerpiece of game is large "THRUSH Ray-Gun" which when wound at top, turret revolves.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Coast Guard in Action Shooting Gallery Game
description: Tin/cardboard 29" long shooting gallery. Cardboard box folds up into position. Cardboard targets, hinged to collapse when hit by toy bullets. Mechanical gun is designed like machine gun and pivots from side to side. As machine gun crank is turned, the connecting string mechanism turns the target carousel. Hitting targets score points. Most points after 10 turns wins.

name: Captain Action Card Game
description: Game comes with 33 playing cards plus 3 instruction cards. Cards feature various characters, including: Captain Action, Captain America, Buck Rogers, Spider-Man, Flash Gordon and The Phantom.
publishers: Captain Action Enterprises LLC, Kool Pops, Small Monsters Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Mafiopoly
description:
CARDS FOR POPULAR BOARD GAME
ADD THESE CARDS & GET LUCKY!

Mafiopoly is not a stand-alone game, but a deck of cards and set of optional rules to be added to Parker Brothers' Monopoly board game. Players are given the option of playing as a Mafia player (Mafioso) or a regular player (Citizen). Citizens play by the normal Monopoly rules while Mafiosi draw from the Mafia Card deck every time they pass Go. Mafiosi also have other special rules, such as the ability to grift $50 from the bank every time any player passes Go. These advantages are somewhat balanced by the innate dangers of the profession: the Mafia Cards may cause a player to fall under investigation by a Federal Grand Jury or fall victim to as assassination attempt. One of the other Mafioso players may even put out a hit on you!

There is an interesting optional rule that allows any Mafiosi to cheat, as long as they don't get caught. If they get caught, they must pay 10% of their holdings to the bank and 10% to the player who blew the whistle.

Expands:

Monopoly
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Mafia, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Victory Over Communism
description: Players are given cards containing questions and answers about communism. Every correct answer gets a player a Slave Country card, which frees that country from Communism. Every wrong answer brings the players one year closer to 1973, the year the rules quote as when the Communists will meet their goal of world domination.

name: That Girl
description:
Based on the TV series.
Contents:
Game Board
4 Plastic Bases
4 Player-Figures
34 Games Cards
16 Work Cards
4 Star Boards
1 Die
20 Star Point Segments
Instructions are printed on the inside the box top.

name: Gänse und Blümchen
description:
With Geese and Daisies, Johann Rüttinger provides three games using one set of components, and encourages the players to dream up their own variants.

Geese uses a pre-defined layout of the paths, and is driven by an elementary roll-and-move mechanism. Certain spaces allow a player to go again, while others make the player miss a turn. Reach the goal by an exact roll.

Single-file is a single-pawn-per-player Pachisi variant, using a different pre-defined board layout.

The "title game", Geese and Daisies, uses only the goose tiles and daisy tiles, each type in its own stack. The player rolls the die; if its value matches the number of geese and/or daisies, the player takes the tile(s). The player who gets the most tiles this way wins.

Although the three games suggested are merely pastimes, with no choices for the players, the rules finish up by offering ideas for other games you might wish to invent, using the components.

Selecta Spielzeug 3544

Ages 5 and up

name: Horse-Racing Tycoon
description:
Horse-Racing Tycoon is a boardgame with a horse-racing and betting theme. Players bet on 4 horses and then race them round the track using cards that determine their movement. Made in Hong Kong by a company called 'Playgo', a curious feature is the deck of cards which look remarkably similar to Uno cards, though the play is nothing like Uno at all. Another feature is that the game proclaims proudly (on the box) that it comes with free Playgo money notes.

Advice that appears on the box:
"Be careful, you can gain or lose a fortune in one bet! Never neglect other players' luck!"
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Point to Point Movement

name: MotoCross Madness
description:
The player to first cross the finish line wins. In Advanced play, the driver with the most points after 5 races is the champion.

Roll the die and move a vehicle along the course. Cards that are drawn on the Jump squares penalize or advance the play. Likewise certain squares on the track advance or hinder the race, such as the pit stop which temporarily takes vehicles out of play. Several modifications are suggested in the instructions.

Contents:

Game Board
2 Dice
Deck of Jump Cards
4 Playing Pieces
Rules

name: Bull in the China Shop
description: Wind the top and drop it in the china shop. Each pin that is knocked over scores points toward winning the game.

name: The Math Game
description: This is a collection of several games to teach various concepts in math to kids beginning at age 6 (1st grade). It includes a VHS video tape and comes in a big plastic folding box. It begins with addition and subtraction concepts and then goes to simple multiplication and division (including remainders).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Greyhound Race
description: From a description from Alvins Vintage Board Games. This game from a British Manufacturer consists of a small square 12 X 12 board with a little box containing 2 flat tin greyhounds and a rabbit.

name: Halloween Lies
description:
From the publisher's web site:

It's award night and Tom Speed's latest film, The Vampire Detective, has just swept the board and garnered five Skellies - for Best Picture, Best Actor, Best Actress, Best Director and Best Screenplay. Sadly, Tom Speed's award for Best Actor was accepted posthumously by his wife, Zara Vicars, as Tom was killed in a driving accident late last night.

Despite this note of sadness, celebrations are in full swing at the The Vampire Detective post-award party. Deals are being cut for future productions and everyone is having a good time enjoying the atmosphere and mingling with Hollywood's movers and shakers.

Is there anything suspicious about Tom Speed's death? Who will win next year's Skellies? Find out at Halloween Lies.

Halloween Lies lasts for about four hours and is suited to an evening. It is often played over a meal -- a finger buffet if possible to allow guests to circulate and talk in private.

Home Page: http://www.freeformgames.com/game_details.php?31

name: Under the Big Top
description:
From the publisher's web site:

It's 1952 and Bo Bennett's Big Top Bonanza has reached Sarasota, Florida for their final show. With a successful nine month tour behind them, the performers and staff of the Bonanza are making plans for a restful and rewarding off-season.

As the curtain falls on the final Big Top performance, a select few gather in JoJo Bones' Exotic Emporium of Enigmatica (part of the Bonanza). To celebrate the successful tour, JoJo will host a night of revelry, food, drink and, this year, what JoJo has promised to be "startling revelations." Tragically, however, JoJo was killed last night. His body was found early this morning in the lions' cage, mauled by lions Gladys and Mountjoy. Since JoJo's body reeked of alcohol, preliminary reports are that he wandered into the cage in a drunken stupor.

But, the show must go on and the post-season party will continue - and so the selected performers and staff of Bo Bennett's Big Top Bonanza assemble to remember JoJo and celebrate the successful season. This may be their last chance to seal their fates for the future...

Under the Big Top lasts for about four hours and is suited to an evening. It is often played over a meal -- a finger buffet if possible to allow guests to circulate and talk in private.

Home Page: http://www.freeformgames.com/game_details.php?22

name: The Great Mosque Game
description:
A fun way to learn about mosques!

To help children learn, in an enjoyable way, about the basics of mosque architecture and layout, this unique questions and answers game provides a wealth of interesting information on all the world's most important mosques. Special emphasis is laid on the Kabah and Islam's most sacred cities of Makkah, Madinah, and Jerusalem. By answering the questions on these subjects, the player will also acquire a knowledge of such Islamic practices as salah, hajj, etc.

Each of the four categories in this game has 100 questions with multiple-choice answers. An attractive feature is the illustrations accompanying many of the questions, which make it easy for children to find the correct answers.

The major appeal of the game is that it offers wholesome entertainment along with the opportunity to imbibe Islamic teachings in a simple, natural and fun-filled way.

Teaches about :

Sacred Mosques in Islam
Famous mosques around the world
Mosque architecture
The teachings of Islam about the mosque (masjid), salah (daily prayer), and Hajj (sacred pilgrimage)

More info here...
http://onlineislamicstore.com/a4425.html

name: Hadith Challenge Game
description:
This product is a unique game based on the Hadith (sayings, traditions) of the Holy Prophet Muhammed (pbuh). The idea behind the game is to provide children with both a fun and educational tool. All questions are taken directly from the Hadith, and have been creatively worked into the play, which kids will enjoy answering. It can be played at school or at home, with friends and family members. Begin the journey and find out what fun it is to learn from the sayings of the Prophet!

More info here
http://onlineislamicstore.com/a4746.html

name: Bolletjes (Veilig Verkeerspel)
description: Simple promotional pocket game for Bolletje biscuits. The game had to be cut from the biscuit box.

name: Six Million Dollar Man
description:
This unpublished prototype board game was originally in Sid Sackson's game collection before it came into my possession.

The game shows some similarities to Parker Brothers' Six Million Dollar Man game and may be a very early version of the game. The mechanics are more complex than the average children's roll-and-move game.

Each player is dealt a hand of four cards at the start of the game and draw one card at the start of each turn. There are several different types of cards in the deck:

- Bionics Cards (Cards for Steve Austin's Bionic Eye, Bionic Arm, and Bionic Leg abilities)
- "Wild" Bionics Cards (May be used as any type of Bionics)
- Move Opponent
- Set Obstacle
- Remove Obstacle

Some of the spaces on the board are marked with one or more bionics symbols that represent cards the player must use to get past that particular challenge. For example, you may need to use a Bionic Eye card to spot an enemy airplane or use one Bionic Arm and two Bionic Leg cards in order to swim across a treacherous river. A player landing on one of these spaces must discard the needed cards before being able to move again.

The obstacles are balanced by the paths that the player can take across the board. The shortest path from start to finish is densely populated with some heavy challenge spaces (requiring up to four cards to get past). By contrast, the longer routes have a smaller density of challenge spaces, usually with one to two card challenges.

Interestingly, the players move by the difference of a roll of two dice. Roll two dice and subtract the lower number from the higher to determine how far you move. This means that rolling doubles means you get zero; you don't move.

The rules I have are incomplete. They do not explain how to use the Move Opponent, Set Obstacle, or Remove Obstacle cards.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Strongholds: Axe & Shield
description:
Strongholds: Axe & Shield is the third releases set in the world of Terris. In this game, along with its sister product Stronghold: Ancient Rivals players get to try their hand at empire building, starting with their own castle. Each player tries to become the first one to complete their castle while preventing other players from doing the same. Winning players must not only manage their castle construction, but successfully attack and defend with their troops as well.

Strongholds: Axe & Shield and Strongholds: Ancient Rivals are each sold separately. Each package contains all the materials needed for a 2 player game. They can be combined or played separately. You can purchase multiple copies of either game to support more players. Future starters and expansions will be sold in a non-collectable format, allowing players to create the types of games that suit them.

In Strongholds: Axe & Shield the rapidly expanding empire of the Dotur seek to secure their northern boarders against the Dwarven raiders of Thulea.

Contents

• 60 game tiles
• 2 player sheets
• 1 die
• 1 Full-Color rulebook

name: Strongholds: Ancient Rivals
description:
Strongholds: Ancient Rivals is the third released set in the world of Terris. In this game, and it's sister product Strongholds: Axe & Shield, players get to try their hand at empire building, starting with their own castle. Each player tries to become the first one to complete their castle while preventing other players from doing the same. Winning players must not only manage their castle construction, but successfully attack and defend with their troops as well.

Strongholds: Axe & Shield and Strongholds: Ancient Rivals are each sold separately. Each package contains all the materials needed for a 2 player game. They can be combined or played separately. You can purchase multiple copies of either game to support more players. Future starters and expansions will be sold in a non-collectible format, allowing players to create the types of games that suit them.

Strongholds: Ancient Rivals pits the mighty Roma Empire against their ancient Fey rivals from Frikara, the Tyrians and their Thulean mercenaries.

Contents

• 60 game tiles
• 2 player sheets
• 1 die
• 1 Full-Color rulebook

name: Mansuba: Challenge of the Pharaohs
description:
All the world is move and counter-move. A Pharaoh who wishes to rule his people wisely learns this early in his schooling. To see and anticipate the interactions of the figures on the Mansuba board is the beginning of understanding. To master those figures is the beginning of wisdom.

Mansuba: Challenge of the Pharaohs is a game of movement and trumping. Each player tries to be the first to get all six of their totem figures safely across the board. Totem figures move by roll of the dice-sticks using simple movement and jumping. You control all the same pieces as the other players, but how and when you move them is the key to victory.

Visit us at www.RedJuggernaut.com for fiction, news, information, answers to questions, and more!
Contents
1 playing board
36 Mansuba totem figures
6 each of Falcon, Woman, Crocodile, Ibis, Jackal, and Cat
6 Dice Sticks
1 Rules booklet

Players
2-6

Ages
10+

Time
30-90 minutes

Product Number RDJ20000
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Rahala
description:
Rahala (Explorers) is a quiz board-game for players age of 15 and up and covers the history of the Arab World from the 20th Century B.C. until the end of the 20th Century A.D. It is divided into six eras with the spirit of each historic era is captured thematically through its questions and graphical representation. Players use: cards to ask each other History and Open Questions, playing pieces to move through a time travel journey along paths of squares in labyrinth around the Black Hole, and era tokens to mark the completion of travel over a certain era. The objective is to amass Points of Knowledge.

The game divides this history into six eras, and the spirit of each historic era is captured thematically through its questions and graphical representation. Players use cards to ask each other History and Open Questions, and then use playing pieces to journey along paths of squares in a labyrinth. Era tokens mark the completion of travel over a certain era. The objective is to amass Points of Knowledge. The player with the most points wins.

Through its History Questions, Rahala aims to highlight the multifaceted makeup of the Arab civilization. The questions comprise a mix of topics presented in a playful manner while revealing the widely spread geographic boundaries of the Arab World along with its people, religions, minorities, scientific discoveries,cultural milieus, and interaction with other civilizations. Open Questions allow for discussions among the players over highly challenging topics.
mechanics: Questions and Answers, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Gotham Pro League Basketball
description: This game featured sturdy steel construction and had 10 players who could run, block and rebound. The players were controlled by a series of levers similar to table top hockey games.

name: King Kong Game
description:
Here comes King Kong to smash up your town! Made by Ideal Games in 1963 this King Kong Game is almost exactly like the Godzilla Game made by Ideal in the same year.

the objective is to avoid Kong while making your way to the Empire State Building.

Hard to find and sought after by collectors.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Murder of a Millionaire
description:
Your 'traditional' murder-mystery, but run in not-so-traditional way.

Invite your guests to the will reading of the late Rick Rochester, a man worth millions. Watch as they compete to see who can win the inheritance by searching out his killer, an individual that is destined to strike again at the party. Did the butler do it? Or is it the blackmailing sister who seems to be spending a fortune she hasn’t yet inherited? There is always the jealous ex-wife who was left 20 years ago and may still have vengeance in her heart. Or could it be the gold-digging son-in-law that wants not only the millionaire's daughter, but his fortune as well. It is up to you and your guests to see if the murderer will be found guilty or go free...
mechanics: Acting, Role Playing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: Murder at the Deadwood Saloon
description:
From the publisher's website:

Giddy up all you Cowboys & Cowgirls & get on down to the Deadwood Saloon.

Have your guests celebrate the end of the Deadwood Poker Tournament with a party that will leave them breathless (well, at least one of them). With everyone from bandits to bankers, and southern belles to saloon girls celebrating together, the result is sure to be deadly. Can your guests figure out the killer before the culprit gets away? There is but one night and one chance to put some justice back in the budding frontier town.


A Host Guide— A complete how-to of throwing your party which includes directions on preparing the invitations, assigning characters and preparing for the party.
A Schedule of the Night— A step-by-step breakdown of how the night will go.
An Introduction— to be read to the guests upon arrival.
Designed Invitations— that you can customize with the details of your party.
A Copy of the Deadwood Gazette— including background information on Deadwood and the guest list.
Character Sheets— full descriptions of the characters, including costuming and acting tips.
Character Objective Sheets —this includes objectives for each character to try to achieve at each stage of the game in order to uncover evidence and find the murderer.
Name Tags
Fake Money— to be distributed to guests and used in the party for scheming and bribery.
Evidence — more clues that will be presented towards the end of the night. This evidence will help your guests solve the mystery and find the murderer.
“Who Dunnit” Cards— to allow your guests to guess the murderer, along with vote for the most animated character and best outfit.
A Solution— a detailed description of who the murderer is, why the murder happened and the clues that led to the outcome.
Award Certificates— to be awarded to the best costume, the most theatrical, the player with the most money at the end of the night and to each of the guests that solve the murder.
Recipes and Decoration ideas—See pictures and a listing of all that is offered in this section on our party extras page.


THREE SEPARATE VERSIONS FORMATTED FOR UP TO 80 GUESTS!
7-13 GUESTS --- 14-20 GUESTS --- 20-80 GUESTS

Home Page: http://www.nightofmystery.com/Murder_at_The_Deadwood_Saloon....
categories: American West, Murder/Mystery, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Role Playing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: James D. Murder High School Reunion
description:
From the publisher's website:

It's a Totally Eighties Class Reunion as you reunite with The Class of '85!

It's been 20 years since you and your guests left the hallowed halls of James D. Murder High. That's 20 years for grudges to be held and jealousy and hatred to fester. This will be the reunion to remember as you bring together all of your classmates to see what everyone's become. From the prom queen turned beauty queen to the math team captain who's now worth millions. The drama queen gone Hollywood to the valedictorian who STILL won't let anyone top her. There's not a soul that will miss this reunion... Just one soul who won't live to tell about it!

name: Till Death Do Us Part
description:
From the publisher's website:

A Night of Love, Marriage and MURDER!

You are a guest at the Giovanni-Simpson Wedding Reception where you will celebrate the marriage of the daughter of a mob boss to the unlikely son of a insurance salesman. It is an evening of family, friends, food and fun that quickly gets turned into a night of murder & mayhem. As family secrets get aired, motives revealed, a murder will occur and a killer sought out. Will it be the jealous ex-boyfriend? The overlooked little sister? The gold-digging in-laws? Or possibly the estranged uncle who drank away his family fortune? This gives a new meaning to the term wedding crasher.

The package includes:


A Host Guide— A complete how-to of throwing your party which includes directions on preparing the invitations, assigning characters and preparing for the party.
A Schedule of the Night— A step-by-step breakdown of how the night will go.

name: Killing for the Crown
description:
From the publisher's website:

Backstabbing, Bribery and Blackmail Among Beauties.

After a week of competition at the Miss America Pageant (or Miss Teen America Pageant), these women are ready to compete! With the Miss America crown on the line, everyone seems desperate to gain the competitive edge on their rivals... and for one guest that means murder! At a pageant that is known to be plagued with scandal, why should this year be any different?

The package includes:


A Host Guide— A complete how-to of throwing your party which includes directions on preparing the invitations, assigning characters and preparing for the party.
A Schedule of the Night— A step-by-step breakdown of how the night will go.
An Introduction— to be read to the guests upon arrival.
Designed Invitations— that you can customize with the details of your party.
The Pageant Press— to be sent with the invitations, it includes background information on the happenings in and around the pageant and the guests coming to the pre-pageant party.
Character Sheets— full descriptions of the characters, including costuming and acting tips.

name: Biddy Basketball
description: Logan's Biddy Basketball Game (number 305) was an all metal construction game with a double scoreboard. The game came with 2 balls, 2 flippers and a large 25" by 40" court made of a vinyl like material. The game featured a standing basket with a net. Object of the game was to use the flippers to shoot balls into your basket.

name: The Best Quiz Night in the World
description:
A 'quiz night' is a team trivia game, often played in British pubs on a certain night of the week. The Best Quiz Night in the World is a boxed game used to set up quiz nights, either in pubs/bars or scaled to parties or larger gatherings. According to the box, the game can be played with "1 to 1000" players.

The box includes a question disc, a sand timer, Joker and "sin bin" tokens, instruction book, and four pads and pencils.

Both US and UK versions of the game were published.

name: Louise Mandrell's Country Music Trivia Game
description: Basic roll-and-move trivia game with a country music theme (and endorsed by Louise Mandrell). Players answer questions about country music or otherwise follow the instructions of the spaces they land on.

name: Raumapeli
description:
This is the Rauma version of the Kaupunkipelit (City Games) series. The town of Rauma, on the west coast of Finland at the Bay of Bothnia, is a historical maritime town and seaport now known mainly for it's paper and pulp industry, close south to the town of Pori (also featured in the series) - and in many instances a rival to it!

Kaupunkipelit is a series of games, each of which is basically a light version of Monopoly localized to a city/region of Finland. The games promote local companies, councils, educational institutes etc. and were designed as a fund raising effort for local sports clubs.

The main differences between these games and Monopoly are:

-Instead of a "street" each square on the board represents a local business.
-There are no hotels or houses, but each square has two title deeds instead of just one, allowing two players to jointly own any location on the board.
-The majority of the event cards are trivia questions about the locality the game is set in.
-While the effects of the first two corner squares (Go and Jail in Monopoly) remain the same for every edition (Go and Stock Market Crash), the effect of the other two corners varies from edition to edition and is the only real difference between them (except for the trivia content, of course). They are typically also local businesses but without title deeds and thus no rent either, but some special effect instead, such as pass a turn or get an extra throw.

name: Shoot Out
description:
PICK YOUR PERFECT F.A. PREMIER LEAGUE DREAM TEAM!

Shoot Out gives you the chance to manage your very own team of F.A. Premier League Stars. Your decisions as manager will make the difference between winning and losing.

--From Rules Sheet

The goal of Shoot Out is to select a team of footballers whose values out-score your opponent's. Players secretly select 3 lines of players (Goalkeeper + Defenders/Midfielders/Strikers), each with a value of 1 to 4. The total of each line is calculated, with bonuses given to players of the same team sharing the same line, special abilities, or simply playing in their proper position. Strikers totals are compared to opposing Defenders totals, and Midfielders are compared to one another. The side that wins 2 out of the 3 point comparisons is the winner. This game is collectible, with player cards available in booster packs. Single cards are available for purchase from the game manufacturer.

A version of this game, featuring the Dutch Eredivisie (titled All Stars), also exists.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Math, Sports

name: Symbolix
description:
The Symbolix, a gang of computer viruses, disguised as Smileys, are taking over the Web. Create the antivirus and save the Internet!
A Scientix is there to assist you, but he's easily influenced and may turn against you. Be alert and adapt your strategy.
Whatever happens, Zorg and Zorga, a couple of former hackers, will always be there to help you in your quest.

Contents:

66 tiles
6 cards
1 board
6 colors


Home Page: http://www.symbolix.fr/

name: Bootlegger
description:
Bootlegger is a bridge-like partnership trick-taking game with a few twists on the familiar theme. The deck consists of four suits with six wild "Bootlegger" cards. The latter may be played to any trick and cause the lowest (rather than highest) card to take the trick.

Instead of the traditional bid/pass, a player may "Inkle," which is a non-bid signal to partner that one can support a certain suit. A "Nullo" is a No Trump bid to take no tricks.

Teams score points (40 to 520, depending on the suit and number of tricks bid) for making their bid, or lose points if they fail. Play is to 500 points.

name: Merry-Go-Round
description: A spin and move game for 2 to 4 players Ages 5 and up. The goal is to be the first to get to the circus, but the race is complicated by the spinning plastic hill in the center. When you land on a space that allows you to turn the hill, you might have the opportunity to send your opponent off in a different direction, or you might help him get to the circus faster.

name: L'exposition doit continuer!
description: A game for four players, each player takes on the role of an actor or actress, and their goal is to stay alive. All the other players are attempting to kill you in order to get into the spot light, and steal the show!
categories: Card Game, Humor, Miniatures, Print & Play

name: Man Versus Nature (And some Guns)
description: An expandable hex and counter wargame where terrain plays a huge factor in the actions and reactions of the units.
categories: Dice, Fantasy, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Economic Gears
description: Economic gears is a game based in a fantasy world which is used to teach and learn about economic functions in society. During each turn players are allowed to place new tiles to grow the allowed economic area of the game. Furthermore each player takes part in the economic success of the new nation by building up a transportation empire to move the newly discovered goods.
categories: Civilization, Economic, Exploration, Fantasy, Farming, Negotiation, Print & Play, Transportation
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Simulation, Stock Holding, Tile Placement, Trading

name: Last one Left
description: In an alternate Europe six nations compete to gain the upper hand in economic and military power. Using a territory movement system, and an in depth economic guide players attempt to compete with the other six players while finishing the goals given to them. (Game also includes an expansion which adds North America into the mix!)
categories: Civilization, Economic, Exploration, Fantasy, Political, Print & Play, Wargame

name: MIP #17: The Lost Fantasy Game
description: A fantasy based wargame in which two nations go to war. One comes from the desert with fast horsemen, while the other is entangled in a civil war while attempting to fight off the enemy.
categories: Fantasy, Medieval, Political, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Battle of Vimeiro
description: A game about the Battle of Vimeiro. Included are the counters and maps you will need to play the game. Overall this is an abstract look at the battle fought between the British and French in Portugal.

name: Space Squads
description: A small and light game about elite units who forcefully retake space ships from pirates. Game is on a level of individual combat.
categories: Dice, Fighting, Pirates, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Johnny and the Toe-Sap Fungus
description:
Long ago on a small island lived a tribe with a problem. For as long as they could remember each member of the tribe had been infected with the dreaded toe-sap fungus. With every step taken, a small droplet of toe-sap would ooze from each toe. This, of course, was a constant source of shame to the tribe members.

Then one day a young man named Johnny discovered two important facts that would change the island forever -- the toe-sap was actually quite delicious and each tribe member produced a different flavor. Johnny was hailed as a hero and soon toe-sap became the island's number one export.

Tribe members spent long days gathering toe-sap, however it soon became apparent that the tribal leaders could influence the toe-sap market, making some varieties more valuable.

As members of the tribe, players take turns collecting varieties of toe-sap. They can also offer cows to the tiny sea-going Cownivores in order to collect toe-sap more quickly. At the end of the game, the players influence the tribal leaders using shells and their remaining cows to dictate the price of each variety of toe-sap.

name: Poldi's Fussball Spiel
description: A soccer game that uses dice to move the ball up and down the field as well as to determine whether a goal is scored.

name: Sport Dice: Tennis
description:
Simple dice game simulating a tennis match.
The serving player uses the white die and the receiving player uses the green die. Players take turns rolling their die until a point is scored either way.

Two kinds of matches can be played: either play for the best of six games, or each player tries to score as many points as possible in a fixed time (using the timer).

Other games in this series - Golf, Soccer and Cricket

name: The Rottnest Island Game
description:
This is an educational game, endorsed by the Rottnest Island Authority and (heavily) sponsored by Agfa Film. It's a standard Roll and Move game with a single path and a start and end. The first half of the path is by boat from the mainland to the island, the second half is by bike on the island itself. The main theme, not surprising given the sponsorship, is photographing wildlife.

As usual with these sorts of games, various points along the path cause things to happen, mostly drawing a card of some sort. You win by getting a photograph of a quokka and getting to the end of the path. There are a group of six quokka photo squares, such that you can't possibly miss it on the way through.

The main educational content of the game is a small brochure with (tourist) information about the island.

name: Hold The Line: The Mexican-American War Expansion Set
description: An expansion for Hold the Line. Scenarios will be playable in 30-90 minutes. The game will cover the battles of the Mexican-American war that developed so many of the great (and some not so) commanders of the American Civil War. More information will be forthcoming as it develops on this title.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Djungle
description:
The Djungle deck has 11 cards with funny animals on them in 4 different colours, giving a total of 44 cards.

The players collect points during 4 rounds, but each round uses different rules:

- 1st round: after a card is drawn, a player must try to imitate that animal's voice to collect points
- 2nd round: the rules are adapted from "Pit", but played with this deck of cards
- 3rd round: the rules are taken from "Hearts"
- 4th round: the rules are taken from "Uno"

The player with the most points after 4 rounds is the winner.

name: Maya & Miguel Piñata Party Card Game
description:
It's Piñata Party time!

Join Maya & Miguel for this fast-paced card game. Uno, dos, tres! play your cards quickly and in sequence until all of them are used, or until someone shouts, "La Piñata!" Ages 6 and up

Skills: Reading Required
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Tip
description:
Tip simulates the well known Soccer-Toto sweepstakes. Instead of 12 real soccer games, 12 rounds of Tip card game are played.

There are 96 cards in total:
- 28 x "1" (7 cards in red, yellow, blue and green)
- 28 x "X" (7 cards in red, yellow, blue and green)
- 28 x "2" (7 cards in red, yellow, blue and green)
- 7 x "V", black/dark yellow coloured
- 4 x "Combi", each with 3 of the 4 colours above
- 1 x "Trick" with all 4 colors

Each player plays is dealt 10 cards and then secretly writes down his tip (1, x or 2). During play, each player tries to collect a winning hand, which consists of 1 set of 4 and 2 sets of 3 cards.

Points can be won for having the winning hand as well as for having marked the correct tip.

At the end of the 12 rounds, the total number of correct tips are summarized and a last payout of points takes place.
The player with the most points is the winner of the game.

name: City Game: El Juego de las 20 Ciudades Olímpicas
description:
City Game, is a game similar to Trivial Pursuit where players must to choose the correct answer among three in the race to conquer the cities of the world that celebrated the Olympic Games in the past, the fist is Athens in 1896 the last is Atlanta in 1996

The questions are based in typical things of each city,and players roll a die and move along the world to complete all cities. First player to complete all win the game.

The game is in Spanish and the components are:
- 1 big game board of the world
- 1000 cards question-answers
- 10 counters
- 3 dices, one of numbers and two specials with a letter to correspond a part of an area of the world
- 1 rulebook

name: Britain's Brainiest
description:
A game based on a TV quiz show that challenges your perceptions of stereotypes !

Over 2,200 questions across 52 categories. Questions & teasers to occupy the most active of minds & challenge the cleverest of clogs. Whether with your family or with friends, play at home & experience the excitement & challenge of the TV show.

Will you be revealed as the Brainiest ?

name: We Dunit, New Black History
description:
Listed in American Games #4157. 1965, Ethnic, Card Game.

We Dunit was offered in a 7UP soda promotion in the 1960s-1970s. Description from a 1971 magazine ad:

"We Dunit, a new game from 7UP, The Uncola, makes black history challenging fun. This exciting new game of mental exercise was designed for people who'll enjoy friendly competition that's more than just something to do. We Dunit is a fascinating card game played somewhat like charades. So if you can act and have a quick mind, then We Dunit is the game for you... and there are four other games that can be played with the We Dunit game. ... You only need two to play or you can add as many players as you like."
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Educational, Party Game

name: All American Handicap
description:
Listed in American Games #4157a. Circa 1950s, Sports, Horse Racing, Record Game.

The '"All American Handicap"' is a new and sensational horse race game. Its ever changing results will match the thrills of an actual day at the races.

Place All American Handicap record on a phonograph and adjust automatic stop. Then place odds indicator on top of record.

Any player may start the race by setting down the reproducing head on the outside of the record.

Participants may play any of the five horses to either WIN, PLACE, or SHOW. Upon the results of the race, the Banker places his result tokens on the WIN, PLACE, and SHOW horse. Refer to odds indicator for prices. The word FREE designates return of tokens.

To ensure the life of the record, and also to derive the most pleasure out of the game, we suggest you alternate sides of the record. For best results, play record between 75 and 80 RPM.

--from the game instructions

name: WABC-TV's Media Careers
description:
Listed in American Games #4162. 1977, Advertising, Comics, Board Game.

The object of the game is to win by becoming Senior VP Media first. Career points are acquired to reach the goal. Each of the number of job levels has 6 points. The job levels are Rookie Buyer, Assistant Buyer, Buyer, Buyer Supervisor, Assoc Media Director, V.P. Media director and lastly the goal Senior VP Media.

The equipemnt is a board with 4 pawns for the players, 10 decks of cards, 2 dice, a "The Boss" sign, and four black pegs with a horseshoe shaped scoring track in the box bottom. Nine of the decks of cards are for the demographics categories, the tenth is for the "Challenge the Boss" deck. You can only challenge the boss when on a buy square. The board has an outside track for player movement.

Players get 2 experience points for passing "Start." They can gain or lose experince points when they "buy" demographic results on the board's nine different demographic categories based on age and sex. You can get "fired" and sent to the "Unemployemnt Office" sqaure on the board. You remain there until you get rehired by roll of 9 to 12 on the dice. You can become the boss by getting promoted. There are sqaures with special instructions for "Take a long lunch", "Leave briefcase in cab", and "Work Overtime."

name: Pennant Drive
description:
Listed in American Games #4165. 1980, Sports, Baseball, Board Game.

Baseball games simulation.

name: 3 Point Landing
description:
Listed in American Games, #4172. 1940s, Travel, Air, Board game.

Three Point Landing -- Race your planes through all their destinations -- Here’s a thrilling game Full of sensations

Three Point Landing consists of a play board illustrated with a map of the United States and part of Canada, 24 destination cards, a spinner and wooden figures representing airplanes, (in the deluxe edition the map on the play board also includes Central and South America, and 36 instead of 24 destination cards.

Advance Games Corp, N.Y.C.
No.242 1942 Made in USA

Directions for Playing
Distribute the destination cards equally among all the players. Each player is also given a figure which represents his aeroplane. The object of “THREE POINT LANDING” is to cover all cities listed on your destination cards and then return to the starting place, namely “LaGuardia Field” New York City, before your opponents. Whoever returns first is the winner, before beginning study your route cards, and the map to determine the shortest round trip route, and arrange your cards accordingly. The players spin the dial in turn, and moves along the desired route, advancing the same amount of spaces as the spin. He must land on every city listed on the cards even though he spins a greater number. (Example: if he is three spaces from one of his cities and spins a six he still only advances three spaces to the city and then waits his next turn.) If a stop is made at a space with a “FORCED LANDING” or a “MOTOR REPAIRING” picture - ---in red clolor---the player must return to the last numbered town, it is necessary to spin the exact number of spaces to LaGuardia Field, New York City in order to land there at the finish. (Example: if there are three spaces left to the field, a three must be spun in order to land there.) The cities on the map have numbers that correspond to the numbers on the destination cards, so that small children will have no difficulty in identifying the position of the cities on the map.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Bengalee: The Game of the East
description:
Listed in American Games #4172a. Circa 1940s, Adventure, Board Game.

Each player places their four pawns in the corner square of the same color as their pawns. Each player takes their turn of spinning the arrow indicator on the dial. The player who spins the highest number starts the game. The others follow clockwise.

To release each pawn from their home field, players in turn must spin a "+" numeral on dial, and advance their pawn according to the number indicated on the dial. For example, if "+5" is spun, they may advance their pawn 5 points. Pawns in home fields cannot be put into play if a "-" numeral is spun, but a pawn on the playing field can be advanced or set back the number of spaces the arrow indicates. Only one pawn can be moved at a time.

In order to reach home base, the exact "+" numeral must be dialed, and when added to the numeral on the playing field on which a pawn in play is standing, the total must add up to exactly 40.

All four pawns can occupy the same position on any numeral on the chart. In addition, there are rewards and penalties that appear on the playing board.

The player who succeeds in getting all of their four pawns to their home base first is the winner!
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Happy Horse
description:
Listed in American Games #4172b. Circa 1940s, Animal, Board Game.

Simple game with extremely bright and colorful box. The game consists of spinning a top and the top then goes into different areas of the game board and points are awarded depending on it's final resting place.

name: Airderby
description:
Listed in American Games, #4174. 1950, Travel, Air, Board game.

Submit a better description and contact Admin Skelebone for a GeekGold reward.

name: Mighty Mouse Spin Targets Game
description:
Listed in American Games, #4176. 1958, Cartoon, Action Game.

Submit a better description and contact Admin Skelebone for a GeekGold reward.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Political Influence, An American Tradition
description:
Listed in American Games, #4177. 1994, Political, Board Game.

Submit a better description and contact Admin Skelebone for a GeekGold reward.

name: Questionable Integrity
description:
Listed in American Games, #4178. 1992, Q&A, Board Game.

Submit a better description and contact Admin Skelebone for a GeekGold reward.

name: All About Cumberland, Maryland
description:
Listed in American Games #4180. 1981, Cities & Town, Board Game.

Presumably, like the other All about... games, an -opoly clone with information centered on Cumberland, Maryland.

name: Big Chief
description: Listed in American Games, #4183. Circa 1950s, Western, Board Game. Object of game: the object of the game is to move along the game board. In some cases this requires doing it 2 or three times while trying to acquire 5 feather cards. At the beginning of the game the first 8 spaces have actual Indian sign languages and you have to learn those signs to proceed along with the game. Whoever takes 5 large feather cards wins by becoming BIG CHIEF. This game looks as if it was re-done with somewhat similar if not easier rules in the mid 1960's under the name Little Chief

name: Emmett Kelly's Circus Game
description:
From the Box:

"It's fun to see the Circus. It's more fun to be a part of the Circus. This game of mine takes you into circus life. You can follow the track around the 3 rungs with the Clowns and the Ringmaster. You can build the various circus acts - the animal acts, the trapeze acts, the tumblers, the jugglers and others. There's a prize for each act you complete and whoever gets the most prizes, wins. Let's play!"

This game uses a simplistic card drawing and set collection method to move players around the board. Movement around the board seems to serve no purpose other than to kill time, as all the game mechanic is from drawing cards and placing cards on the game board to make sets. Points are accumulated when sets are completed, or when indicated by the type of card drawn at the beginning of the player's turn.

OBJECT
The object of the game is to win the most Emmett Kelly Prize Disks. A Prize is won when a player

Plays a Circus Act Card that completes and Act.
Draws an Emmett Kelly Prize Card
Stops on an Emmett Kelly space in the game board track.



SETUP
Place the Emmett Kelly Prize Disks in a pile to one side.

Mix up the action cards and place them face down in a pile near the game board

All players select a colored Playing Piece and place it on the matching Ringmaster space on the board. the player that chose Green goes first and then play proceeds to the left

Each turn starts by drawing an Action Card from the face down pile.

ACTION CARDS - WHAT THEY MEAN
Circus Act Cards. Each Circus Act card has a picture matching a part of an Act in the Circus, menagerie or Side Show. When Drawn, the player looks on the board for part of an Act it matches and places the card on it. The player also moves the playing piece the number of spaces shown on the card. moves are always in a clockwise direction.
Whenever a player draws and plays an Act Card that completes an Act, he takes one Emmett Kelly Prize Disk.

Emmett Kelly Cards. When drawn, the player moves ahead to the next Emmett Kelly space on the game board track and takes one Emmett Kelly Prize Disk.

Blue Clown Cards. When drawn, the player moves his playing piece the number of spaces shown on the card.

Red Clown Cards. When drawn, the player moves his playing piece the number of spaces shown in the card. Also if any player (whether the one drawing the Red Clown Card or not) has more Prizes than the others, that player returns one Prize to the Prize pile. If two or more players are tied for most Prizes, none is given up.

Ringmaster Cards. When drawn, the player moves to the next Ringmaster space and takes another turn.

Clown Dog Card. When drawn, the player moves to the next Clown Dog space and loses his next turn.

The Circus Act Cards are played on the board. All the other Action Cards are piled face up to one side after they are drawn and used.

WINNING
When all the Acts on the game board have been completed, by covering them with matching cards, the player with the most Emmett Kelly Prizes is the winner.

name: Pot O'Gold
description:
As per the box lid, Pot O'Gold is the "Fortune Telling Game for 2-4 players, young or old".

This is a spin-and-move game similar to The Game of Life. Players spin and move 1 to 6 spaces, following the game track where they will encounter a variety of Lucky and Unlucky events, including finding their "Future Husband or Wife", along the way.

The goal is to reach the Finish Line and "Win A Pile Of Lucky Pieces".

name: Pro Locker Basketball
description:
Listed in American Games, #4192. 1960, Sports, Basketball, Board game.

Submit a better description and contact Admin Skelebone for a GeekGold reward.

name: Round Up
description:
The board is a rectangle with a colored square in each corner, representing the corral for each player. 20 "cattle" pieces are placed in the middle of the board. The cattle are affixed to colored bases that match one player's corral. Each player has corresponding pieces: 1 bull (worth 10 points), 3 cows (worth 5 points) and 1 maverick calf (worth 2 points).

The players take turns using a lasso made of a length of string to lasso one of their cattle. A player gets three tries to successfully capture one of the cattle before their turn ends. Once a piece is successfully lassoed by the player, the player must drag the piece using the lasso to the appropriate place on the board.

Bulls and cows must be pulled through the gate into the player's corral. Once in the corral, the pieces are scored and removed from the board.

Maverick calves are first taken to the Branding Pen and left for a turn, before it can be lassoed again and taken to the corral.

The board has obstacles (like cacti) which must be avoided while dragging the cattle, or the player's turn ends. If a player's lassoed cattle tips over while dragging, the turn ends.

The player may "rustle" another player's cattle. If a player has already captured one type of cattle, the player may try to rustle another player's cattle of the same type. If the cattle tips over while dragging the piece to the corral, the rustler must return the tipped piece and an extra of the same type of piece from their own corral which they had previously successfully lassoed.

The player with the highest score at the end of the game wins.

Listed in American Games, #4193. 1946, Western, Board game.

name: Spaceship
description:
Spaceship is a spin and move space exploration game published by All Fair Games about 1948 (estimated on knowledge of the Jet age in 1944 -45 (i.e V2 Rocket) and appearance of flying saucers in 1947). Retro graphics adorn the board with characters like the Saturn Saucerman, Mars Batman and Giant Robot Space Master. Players travel from Terra (Earth)via Saturn and Luna (the moon) to the Zero Gravity Space Station. From there players continue via Mars or Venus to Jupiter. The pathway that players travel along is called "Spaceways". The Spaceways are under the control of the Interplanet Patrol System of United Planets. Each spaceship has a Cosmic Space-o-gram receiving set and when a player lands on a space marked "Take Space-o-gram", the player takes a Space-o-gram Card and follows the instructions.
All ships must stop at the "Zero Gravity Space Station" and when leaving if a player spins an even number they go to Jupiter via Venus, and an odd number via Mars to Jupiter. Players cannot stop on the Asteroids as the nears Jupiter but spin a larger enough number to carry across the Asteroids.
The First to reach Jupiter wins. Listed in[American Games] #4195.

name: Space Mouse
description:
A deck of 36 cards (1-9 in four suits) with images of Space Mouse and his associates from Dell/Gold Key Comics. Includes rules for three children's card games: "Pick Up Tricks," "Go Fish," and "The Game of Concentration."

Space Mouse was introduced in the theatrical short "The Secret Weapon" (1960) and later appeared on "The Woody Woodpecker Show" (as advertised on the game box). However, he had a longer comics career, eventually integrating into the Woody Woodpecker comic.

Listed in American Games, #4194. 1964, Space, Animal, Card game.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Space Exploration

name: Spot-A-Plate
description:
Listed in American Games, #4196. Circa 1950s, Miscellaneous, Board game.

This game comes with a playing board consisting of a map of the 48 states, 48 different liscense plates, one from each state, 4 car pieces and a die. Object of the game is to roll the die and try to pick up as many plates as you can. Player who gets the most plates wins the game

name: Woody Woodpecker
description:
The Woody Woodpecker Card game consists of 40 cards, 10 each of 4 suits (Baseball, Football, Baseball Glove, Football Helmet). There are instructions included for multiple card games including Rummy, Have Fun with Stop and Top (War), and Pick Up Tricks (Trick taking game where you pick up cards if you cannot play the suit played.)

Listed in American Games, #4204. 1968, Cartoon, Card game.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Highway Traffic Game
description:
Listed in American Games, #4206a. 1957, Travel, Board game.

Submit a better description and contact Admin Skelebone for a GeekGold reward.

name: Ords: The Odyssey Into the 21st Century
description:
Ords, The Odyssey into the 21st Century is a space-based game in which players attempt to destroy their enemies' ships and conquer their star systems, thus becoming Emperor of the Galaxy and an ORDS citizen.

You begin with a random selection of star systems, a star base, a collection ships, and a few random cards (including weapons) to get you started. A roll-and-move mechanism allows you to travel through the galaxy between the six quadrants. You may attack opponents in the quadrant where your flagship is located in order to take star systems from them. In addition, the space you may land on may give you a benefit (or penalty.) You may also purchase star systems in your quadrant, as well as weapons — offensive and defensive — ships, and other items.

You obtain prizes (rewards) by obtaining three or more star systems in a single quadrant. The first player to obtain a pre-determined number of systems in one quadrant wins.

name: Chap Acquitted
description:
Listed in American Games, #4210. 1979, Social Concern, Board game.

A 'game' certainly published with a steep agenda. This game references Senator Ted Kennedy's incident in July 1969 where he drove off a bridge on Chappaquiddick Island, into a pond. While Kennedy managed to swim to safety, his passenger, Mary Jo Kopechne drowned. Kennedy left the scene of the accident and was later given a suspended sentence of 2 months in jail.

Senator Kennedy (in reference to this incident) has sometimes been referred to as a 'Chap Acquitted'.

This 'game' appears to challenge the acquittal and cast an unfavorable shadow on Ted Kennedy. The box cover refers to it as a 'Bridge game of sorts' and included a 273 page book entitled - Teddy Bare, the real story of Chappaquiddick.

name: Astro Word Game
description:
This is a travel letter/word game that was given to members of the American Airlines Sky Club in 1971 as a form of advertising. It appears this was designed to be played to pass the time during long flights. Each packet contains a blue slider sheet with 10 square holes with corresponding top/bottom slits, plus 1 cardboard strip listing 24 categories, and 10 strips each containing all the letters of the alphabet (A-Z). The strips are designed to slide through the top & bottom slits, so that only 1 letter (or category) is visible through the square hole.

The first player holds the slider sheet horizontally and selects a category. They slide the category strip vertically into the slider sheet until the chosen category is visible. Then, they mentally choose a word for the other players to guess. They slide 2 letter strips vertically into the slider, so that only the first and last letters are visible. The other players in clockwise order call out letters they believe will fit this word. Letters called that do NOT appear in the word score 1 point against the caller. Correct letters are positioned in the proper slots. When any player guesses the original word correctly, he wins 1 point and becomes the next word/category selector. The game ends when 1 player wins 10 points.

Listed in American Games, #4213. 1971, Travel, Advertising, Ad game for Airline, Board game.

name: Popularity Lottery
description:
Listed in American Games, #4217. Circa 1990s, Gambling, Board game.

Submit a better description and contact Admin Skelebone for a GeekGold reward.

name: Maloney's Pub
description:
Collect the most drink chips while traveling through the Pub.

Contents:
• game board
• shamrock cards
• drink chips
• play money
• tokens and die

Listed in American Games, #4219a. 1978, Drinking, Board game.

name: Rocket Patrol Magnet Target Game
description:
Listed in American Games, #4228. Circa 1950s, Space, Action game.

Not so much a board game as a toy. This is no more than magnetic darts.

name: Radaronics
description:
Listed in American Games, #4226. 1946, Military, Board game.

Submit a better description and contact Admin Skelebone for a GeekGold reward.

Military radar game, "Radaronics, The Magic Game With Radar Vision, Featured And Approved By The Quiz Kids, ARC, American Radar Corporation, No. 47, 1946". This games includes inner map insert with spinning mechanism, battery operated light bulb, bottom piece attached to box base with rod for spinner to rotate on, another map insert, 2 dice, plastic markers and 4 hard plastic (bakelite bake lite?) ship boat playing pieces.

name: Treasure Hunt
description:
Listed in American Games, #4201. Circa 1950s, Adventure, Board game.

Submit a better description and contact Admin Skelebone for a GeekGold reward.

name: Let My People Go!
description: Passover board game - Journey with the people of Israel as they emerge a free nation from slavery.

name: 19th Green
description:
From the box:

"A family golf game that lets you warm up for the Masters"

Up to four players compete in a round of golf using a map of a golf course, a die, and 4 pawns. At each hole, players take turns rolling the die to make their shot. The result of the die roll is checked against provide tables for each of the holes and conditions of play. A table will indicate whether the shot is made and/or the lie of the ball. Each roll of the die is equal to one stroke.

Game contents:
1 golf course map on stiff paper
1 green die
4 generic plastic pawns (red, blue, yellow, green)
3 pages of shot tables on normal paper
5 pages of score sheets on normal paper

Interesting facts:
The "Directions for Play" are printed directly on the outside of the box bottom.

name: The Game of Ocean
description: The Game of OCEAN [Oceanography, Circulation, Ecology, Animals, Navigation]. This interactive question-answer game provides an opportunity for participants to review facts and develop the vocabulary and concepts Science Olympiad participants may encounter in the Oceanography.

name: League Leader Rugby
description:
This boardgame has all the familiar aspects of rugby including rules, terminology, tactics, and of course, excitement.

Players play their games against the board. A single game is played by traveling from the kick-off square to the final whistle square. Tries/conversions are scored during each game.

Essentially, the board creates realistic results that players record on a league table. Each player has their own league table for recording results. When each players league table has been completed, the player with the most league points wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: CAGE's Open Invitation Golf Classic
description:
Open Invitation Golf Classic is a golf game which uses a unique card drawing system for moving. Each card contains for lines of variable length that each cross to edges of the card. These are used to determine where the ball is thrown. Each line represents a different stroke: the drive, the chip, the sandtrap, and the putt.

The board has 9 holes but is intended to be played as a 9 or 18 hole course.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: The Ultimate Football Quiz Kit
description:
Part of the Ultimate Quiz Kits series.
The ultimate football quiz – over 2,000 questions for every level, from beginner to buff.

Contains everything required for a fun quiz at home, at work or in the pub.

The CD-ROM allows you to print off questions to suit your own friends and family.

Box size: 340mm x 250mm x 50mm
Book size: 297mm x 210mm
124 pp quiz book
CD-Rom
Wipe-clean score boards
Answer pad and pens
Score chart

name: The Ultimate Movie Quiz Kit
description:
From the publisher:
Part of the Ultimate Quiz Kits series.
The ultimate movie quiz – over 2,000 questions for every level, from beginner to buff.

Contains everything required for a fun quiz at home, at work or in the pub.

The CD-ROM allows you to print off questions to suit your own friends and family.

Box size: 340mm x 250mm x 50mm
Book size: 297mm x 210mm
124 pp quiz book
CD-Rom
Wipe-clean score boards
Answer pad and pens
Score chart

name: The Ultimate Rock and Pop Quiz Kit
description:
From the publisher:

Part of the Ultimate Quiz Kits series.
The ultimate rock and pop quiz—over 2,000 questions for every level, from beginner to buff.

Contains everything required for a fun quiz at home, at work or in the pub. The CD-ROM allows you to print off questions to suit your own friends and family.

This title contains: 6 pens, question and answer CD-ROM, joker cards, score boards, answers pad, score chart, quiz cards

Box size: 340mm x 250mm x 50mm
Book size: 297mm x 210mm
124 pp quiz book
CD-Rom
Wipe-clean score boards
Answer pad and pens
Score chart

name: Time Factor
description:
From the Box
Tic..Tic..Tic make your move before the time runs out. Flip the frame and challenge your opponent to try for 3 in a row ...Tic...Tic...Tic With every move the pattern changes, so it pays to think ahead.

Played on a 3 by 3 matrix with 3 counter of each 5 colours.

name: Darkness and Glory
description:
Darkness and Glory is a strategy card game of the underground world of the drow, also known as the dark elves.

Players represent the leaders of the great houses, large, extended families of dark elves bound by blood and ambition. It is the goal of each house to rise in power by gaining the favor of the evil deity they worship.

In Darkness and Glory, players compete for this favor in different crises by playing cards that represent military units, nobles and magical spells.

The game sets up and plays quickly, putting players directly into the action. Fate cards provide color and immerse the player into the chaotic society of the drow. No dice or random elements are in the game, allowing players to focus on the strategy and card play.

Components include:

five-page rulebook
45 soldier cards
32 noble cards
27 spell cards
24 fate cards


Available from Brothers-in-Arms Games at biagamesonline.tripod.com - check out the site and check out the game.

name: Phoenix Horizons
description:
The Event changed everything...

A once unending universe has been reduced to a few fringe systems known as the Outerlands. The tyrannical rule of the Galactic Federation has been erased and new nations have risen to stake their claim to the vacant throne. Limited planetary resources have forced rival fleets to engage in interstellar war. Massive star fleets lead by cunning commanders and dedicated crews fill the void with fire, plasma, and a never ending hail of bullets. All eyes are on you to lead your chosen fleet to victory and rise from the ashes of the Event.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Die Belagerung von Laxia
description: Rare Game about the Siege of the City Laxia

name: Quiz & Lode
description:
The game is a trivia set, in Italian, for kids in elementary school and junior high. Six sets are available, from 1st to 6th grade.
Each set includes 1150 questions and answers divided in 7 main arguments:

. comics and cartoons
. Italian and English
. nature and hobbies
. riddles and enigmas
. math and information technology
. space and time
. sport

The questions are presented in groups of ten printed on nice strip cards packaged in a handy system.

name: ¿Quién está ahi?
description: Are the grandparents on the second floor? Is someone in the kitchen? Be the first in finding out where the other player’s family is and win the game.

name: Runes
description:
Jard gathered the mystical rune stones into his hand and threw them out into the air before him. As the stones flew into the mist filled night they stopped their flight and hung before the young wizard, spinning about each other in a magical dance. With the Runes now ready, Jord called the spell to mind and began to chant the rites of summoning. With a blast of multi-colored light and a puff of foul smelling smoke, a green furred wolf leaped out of the magical doorway the rune stones had opened. Standing nearly as tall as the short mage, the wolf growled and then bowed its head in obedience to its master.

Turning, Jord commanded the great wolf to leap at his foe, a minor conjurer who had challenged Jord to a duel. Jord only hoped that the wolf he had just summoned would be enough to finish the other mage off, as that was the last of Jord’s runes stones and so the end of his own magic.

This is Runes, a game of magical battle, spell casting and summoning. Can you out fight your foe, using the mystical rune stones and your chosen field of magic. A new and innovative game system, the Rune’s game system is fully expandable and compatible with other Runes games. So why wait, go out and find some adventure and play Runes.

The first set of this exciting game covers the magic of Sorcery and the elemental power of Water.

Do you dare step into the mystical worlds of Runes…

name: Zhevezh Gauntlet
description:
Zhevezh Gauntlet - A Dragonroar Adventure
Its the only supplement, for the fantasy miniatures combat system and RPG "Dragonroar". It includes maps, scenario description, an introductory audio tape, various character sheets.
It uses an introductory level system which emphasizes combat with various monsters. Hit points are shown as marked-off circles on a body diagram sheet.

name: Monster Bash 2: Franks and Ghouls
description:
The Frank crushed the skull of the ghoul with an easy grip of he’s massive hand. Still as one died, five more appeared and rushed the mighty monster. With a howl of delight they began to rip at the Frank’s flesh with chipped teeth and dirty claws. One ghoul the Frank could handle, but five was a bit too much. With a mighty crash the ghouls brought the huge monster down to his knees, each feeding on his flesh as he screamed in rage.

This is Monster Bash, the newest game from Bad Baby Productions. Take on the role of a savage monster from classic horror tales, build gangs of these monsters and battle your foes as each tries to take control of the city’s dark, horror filled underworld. Gangs of monster confront each other in deadly brawls as each tries to devour the fear filled humans that flee through the night.

Monster Bash is a fully expandable system, with each set offering two new types of monstrous gang, new Battle Tiles to fight upon and new, exciting special abilities and rules. So gather a few friends, sit down and have a ghoulish night filled with monstrous fun.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Print & Play

name: The Con Game
description:
This is a "simulation" of fan experiences at an average science fiction convention. The rules and event cards are full of "old school" fannish in-jokes. After registering at the hotel and convention, you wander through four boards with the various function rooms of a convention hotel. Players gather Pleasure, Glory, Survival, and Embarrassment points by landing on any of 10 event spaces. You draw and read an event card and add the listed points to your score card.
The game ends when a) everyone gets tired of playing any longer, b) a pre-set time limit is reached, c) the Dorsai (see above) arrive, or d) Global Thermonuclear War breaks out. Event, Glory and Survival points are added and Embarrassment points subtracted. High score wins.
The game comes with ten sheets of event cards, 4 map boards, one sheet of cut and fold figures, a sheet of "Personal Convention Program Card & Tally Sheets, a "Fan Guest of Honor" Button, an 8-sided die and a rules pamphlet. All components are hand drawn or written. and have to be cut out for use. Blank event cards are also provided so you can add your own stories.
categories: Humor, Maze, Real-time, Science Fiction, Trivia
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation, Singing

name: Monster Bash: Bloods and Lupines
description:
The vampire screamed in agony as the werewolf ripped at his chest, dead blood flying everywhere. The vampire though, was a tough foe and with a puff of smoke, turned into mist and floated away, only to return to its true form several steps beyond. With a sly grin the blood drinker raised its clawed hand and out of the sewer drain swarmed a vast carpet of rats. The moving rug of vermin swarmed the savage were-creature and soon it fell to the ground, howls of agony rising from the mound of filthy rats as they devoured the were-beast.

This is Monster Bash, the newest game from Bad Baby Productions. Take on the role of a savage monster from classic horror tales, build gangs of these monsters and battle your foes as each tries to take control of the city’s dark, horror filled underworld. Gangs of monsters confront each other in deadly brawls as each tries to devour the fear filled humans that flee through the night.

Monster Bash is a fully expandable system, with each set offering two new types of monstrous gang, new Battle Tiles to fight upon and new, exciting special abilities and rules. So gather a few friends, sit down and have a ghoulish night filled with monstrous fun.

This first set covers the monstrous gangs of the vampires and werewolves. Everything you need to play is included and when combined with other sets, you can create a horror filled game of nightmarish fun.

Integrates with:

Monster Bash 2: Franks and Ghouls

name: They Think It's All Over
description: The board game based on the classic T.V. game show. Players divide into two teams. Each team member gets their chance to play such well-known rounds as the "Name Game", "Expert Summary" and "Sporting Moments". The aim is to collect eight cards which spell out "IT IS NOW!".

name: Highway
description: Learn about highway laws with this interactive board game that has an actual moving road!
mechanics: Area Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Chinggis Khan: almidras Allah (the flail of God)
description:
Chinggis Khan: almidras Allah is a solitaire game that covers the Mongol campaigns against the Khwarizmians in 1220 and 1221. This game was published in the first issue of battle-market magazine dated Spring 2007.

It contains 1 A4-sized map, 30 1/2" counters, and four pages of rules. An accompanying article is included in the same magazine.

Each turn represents 1 month and each counter represents 10,000 cavalry, 3000 engineers, or one leader. Sieges are a main focus of the game.

Two scenarios are included, historical and alternate. The alternative scenario challenges you to improve on Chinggis Khan's historical performance.

name: Hanba'al: Ambush at the Trebbia
description:
This rendition of Hannibal's ambush of the combined Roman Consular armies at the confluence of the Trebbia and Po rivers was published in the first issue of battle-market magazine dated Spring 2007.

It contains 2 A4-sized maps, 60 1/2" counters, and six pages of rules. An accompanying article is included in the same magazine.

Length of gameplay is an estimate.

name: Zed's Party
description: ZED'S PARTY is an amazingly inventive and unusual game. HAVE YOU BEEN INVITED? Mime, Song, Dance and Drama make this an interactive and highly fun game. For any number of people from 4 up to 24, the game includes balloons, question cards and a full colour playing board. The inventor/designer of this game is Zed Rodgers, the actor/writer from London, UK. The game only had one production run despite it being described by some as the best and most versatile board game in the world. One of the directors of Zed'n'Co Games Ltd, went bankrupt from his other business and could not put money in for the second run, so a second director pulled out leaving Zed with no finances for a second run.

name: Cold Feet
description:
Cold Feet is chock-full of great and hilarious moments as Adam, Rachel, Pete, Jenny, Karen and David all battle to make the best of their careers, families and friendships. Now you can join in their struggle for happiness by playing the game.

Based on the hit UK TV drama.

name: All About Pueblo
description: All About Pueblo is a game where players roll and move around town fulfilling lists of items available at the buildings where the sponsors of the game are located. It is a typical advertising/marketing game for the city in 1981, and contains item lists, money, standees, and a nice 6-piece interlocking board.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Call It: the Family Home Football Game
description:
Comes in a tube. From the 'front' of the tube:

"Play along with your favorite NFL, WFL, or college game. Ages 8 to Adult."

And from the 'back':

"Match your football strategy and wits in an exciting new sports game that challenges players to compete against one another LIVE - on your television set!

"CALL IT is played simultaneously with your favorite college, NFL, or WFL football game. Any Football Game, from Monday Night Football to the Orange Bowl, the Superbowl, Rose Bowl, or even a video tape of previously played games can be used to play CALL IT.
