It's nonstop, fun-filled family excitement right in the comfort of your living room.

"It's 2nd down and 5 yards on your own 35. Do you think your team will run it or pass it! You decide! Over 400 combinations available. Will they be sacked?... Fumble... Incomplete Pass?

"Choose wisely and win big. Choose poorly and you'll sit it out on the bench. You'll never know who's right until it happens on your television.

"Win or lose, you make the call. CALL IT! The final word in interactive football games."

GAME CONTAINS
13" x 17" Game Board
Play Money
Tokens & Rules

For more information or to order call 916 387-1925

name: Fame Academy
description:
From the back of the box:

Can you handle instant STARDOM?
Enter the Fame Academy and show that you have the flair and determination to succeed and everyone else is eliminated.

Will you be the first student to take centre stage and embrace fame?

Based on the BBC UK TV show of the same name.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Party Game

name: Socially Speaking
description:
Socially Speaking is a boardgame designed for educational context.

In the Socially Speaking board game, students practice effective social interactions like greeting, turn-taking, eye contact, listening, compliments, emotions, telephoning others, showing an interest in what others are saying, sitting appropriately, asking and answering questions, using your voice effectively, developing and maintaining friendships, and communicating in a variety of situations (school, friend, restaurant, etc.).

Socially Speaking Game includes: Gameboard (16" x 111/2"), 100 question cards, 6 playing pieces, 24 colored rings, a die, and an instructional booklet. Improve your students' social skills while targeting self-esteem, listening skills, receptive and expressive language, and problem-solving. Question cards address social skills in the home, at school, and in the community. Socially Speaking cards allow students to discuss social situations, emotions, and appropriate behaviors.
publishers: School Specialty Publishing, Super Duper Publications

name: Samurai Game
description:
Simple roll-and-move race game in Daiso's range of small portable games. This game is made in China for sale in Daiso's 100-yen shop chain.
Each player braves the perils of the Tenshu castle, including getting by the castle watchman, fighting duels with Samurai, taking the secret path and avoiding the trap and the ninja's throwing knife. The first player to reach the top of the castle and confront the king successfully wins.

name: Children of the Sun: Battles of Marshal Antonio Jose de Sucre
description:
Children of the Sun is a wargame covering two battles of Marshal Antonio José de Sucre, which were significant events in South American history.

1) Ayacucho, 1824
Tired of running, Sucre's 5,000+ army meets the 9,000+ army of the Spanish Viceroy on ground of the Viceroy's choosing.

2) Pichincha, 1822
Sucre's army flanks a strong Spanish position by moving across the slopes of a volcano towards Quito.

This game is the first of a projected series titled "Patriots & Royalists". Each scenario is a grand tactical game with units representing battalions of infantry, squadrons or regiments of cavalry and a battery for artillery. Each strength point in the game represents 50-70 men and each game turn representing 20 minutes of time.

Components:
Two, 17" x 22" maps, one for each battle, as well as over 260 double sided counters, rules book, a Player Handbook, and various game play aids and charts.
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), Skirmish Line Games

name: Battlez
description:
(From manufacturer)
"Playerz compete in head-to-head Battlez combining strategy, chance, and skillz to knock out their opponents."

"Battlez is driven by action involving three primary dice, and combines clever planning with high intensity game play. The cards involve different dice combinations that score or reduce your opponent's score if you are lucky. This is simple to learn, but playing to win is different for each game, and each opponent and each dice throw."

name: Trumping
description:
The Trumping card game consists of 64 cards, where half of the cards are marked with a +(plus) and the other half with a *(star).

Both halves have 8 cards in each of the 4 usual playing card suits, but instead of numbers from 1-8, they have binary numbers: 1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32, 64 and 128.

To determine, who takes the trick, each played card is added to (if a plus card is played) or multiplied with (if a star card is played) the first played card. The card reaching the highest total wins the trick.

name: Salus
description:
Salus is the Latin word for "well-being". The game consists of 26 pairs of cards, giving a total of 52 cards. Each pair shows an everyday scene which could cause an accident. One card of the pairs shows the wrong behavior in red, the other marks the corrected situation in blue.

Each player is dealt 7 cards and tries to collect as many pairs as possible. The player who ends the game by emptying his hand first gets a bonus and all card remaining in the hands of the other players give minus points. Winner is the player with the most points.

Each round, a player can choose to take a card from the stock or from the discard pile if he has a matching pair to one of the cards in the pile. But in case he chooses the latter, he must take all cards lying on top of the matching card. This small rule gives a real twist to that else wise simple card game.

name: Fasthanded Vince
description:
Fasthanded Vince is played with a deck of 60 cards. There are 5 suits of 12 cards, numbered from 1-12 and showing an additional geometrical sign (triangle, square, diamond, circle).

Object of the game is to get rid of his cards first. You can play a card on the discard pile, if either the suit, the number or the geometrical sign is equal to the top card on the pile.

If you can't play a card, you must take a card from the stock, but the number of cards in the hand is limited to 3 or 4 depending if you play a 2- or 3-player game.

name: Stars In Their Eyes
description: Based on the popular TV series of the same name, this game enables players both to enact favorite star performers and also try to guess the identity of famous mystery performers. Points are awarded for performances as judged by the other players, and also for correctly naming mystery performers. The fewer the clues that have to be given to identify the performer, the higher the score achieved.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing

name: Peanut Gallery
description: Peanut Gallery -- the new fast-paced talking game. Pull a trivia card and quickly convince your friends of your answer and you can win!

name: Reminiscing: The Sports Edition
description:
How much do you remember about famous sporting moments?
Just like the original "Reminiscing" Master Game Edition that 1000's have enjoyed for over a decade, this special sports edition will not only challenge your lifetime memories of watching sports, but will also stimulate you to share thoughts and feelings from your own personal past.

This "Reminiscing" will take you on a nostalgic journey through the great sporting moments of the 1940's to today.

name: The Nurturing Game
description:
[From the Publisher:] The Nurturing Game teaches adults and children to express their feelings, to become aware of themselves and others, to use their personal power in positive ways, to praise, to use gentle touch, and to get along with others.
Animals, the earth, and the elements have been portrayed on the game board as symbolic of a world where despite size, color, and capabilities, everyone and everything is accepted.
The goal of the nurturing game is to begin along the two tracks that lead children and adults to a world of hugs, togetherness and rainbows. Along the way, players will get a chance to express their feelings, increase their self awareness, learn to use their personal power in positive ways, practice using gentle touch, and offer words of praise to themselves and others. The game ends when everyone meets at the rainbow.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Jetan-Sarang
description:
Jetan-Sarang is a chess-like game, played on a 12x12 board. The designer was inspired by the Martian tales by Edgar Rice Burroughs, but Sarang differs from the Jetan game described in ERB's Chessmen of Mars.

Rules and photographs of the game used to be found on the designer's website:

http://www.sprattart.com/cgi-bin/details.pl?idno=410

name: KHJ Disc Jockey Derby Game
description:
The game board folds out from a double LP put out by 93 / KHJ, a radio station. The name of the album is "Sound of the Sixties". Instructions are printed on the inside of the record sleeve.

It's a basic roll and move game, utilizing a spinner, along with "Blooper" and "Ad Lib" cards that are drawn after landing on certain spaces of the board. The theme centers around the particular DJs of that era and station, and each player chooses their favorite DJ token to represent them while moving around the board. The goal is to become Disc Jockey of the Year.

The game is set in California, with locations like Malibu and Disneyland, and the spaces allude to various radio station activities, such as "Commercial Break", "On the Air", and "You Get Beatles Exclusive".

name: Independence Day The Game
description: Board game based on the 20th Century Fox film "Independence Day"
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Bank "o" la
description:
Bank “O” La is a clever game that teaches children to count—and save—money. Each player begins the game with dimes, nickels, and a quarter, for a total of $1.00. Players select their piggy bank, place their money in their pocket space on the board, and roll the die to begin moving clockwise around the bright, colorful game board.

As you move around the board, you take turns purchasing items from the vending machine, taking money from someone else’s pocket, putting money in someone’s pocket, or placing money in your piggy bank. Money changes hands many times from either the vending machine or another player, forcing players to keep a good account of their funds.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Slahal
description:
Slahal (pronounced sle -`hal) is an indigenous very old, Pacific Coast Indian Gambling Game. The game is also called the "bone game", "stick game" or "hand game" and is still played today by many in the Northwest. It is played, either as a two player game or as a team game. It originally used small pieces of animal bone as game pieces but now many kinds of substances have replaced those bones. Pieces of antler having both a rounded side and a flat side were used while a grouping of separate sticks serve as the score keeping method. Each team begins with a set number of scoring sticks. The two game pieces (acting almost like dice) are picked up by a player and secretly arranged on a flat surface. This is done to the accompaniment of Native Music. The object of the game is to correctly guess where certain game bones are located in the opponents hand. During the playing of the music the pieces are arranged in different patterns, either both flat pieces down, both round pieces down or 1 going each way so that there are 4 possible combinations that can be accomplished. The opponent or the leader of the opposing team will motion to the other leader that they are ready to guess the direction of the unmarked bones. He uses a set of hand signals to make his guess. Each time he guesses incorrectly, he must throw one of his score keeping sticks to the opposing team. The team that eventually wins all of the opponents score keeping sticks wins the match

Nothing in this description was intentionally taken from the Elliott Avedon Museum & Archive of Games, a public funded Museum in Canada who would not give permission for the Museum's description of the game to be used. This compilation is taken from numerous other sources found.

This game was re-created by Bill Kuhnely in 1981.

name: Terrytoons Pop-Outs
description:
This is a children's game for those Ages 3 - 6.

This variation of the game Bingo involves picture puzzles of cartoon characters Dinky Duck, Goose and Gander, Heckle and Jeckle, and Mighty Mouse.

name: Combat Moonbase
description:
Combat Moonbase is a set of rules for tactical spaceship combat using 1/400 miniatures. Rules are provided (in Attack Wargaming's inimitable style) for lasers, missiles, plasma torpedoes, ECM, chaff, and landing and taking off from planets.

Information is provided for three types of ships, two from the Eastern Coalition and Western Alliance (who are fighting over the titular moonbase) and one from the alien Thook.

name: Kick the Can
description:
The game's arch-shaped track is designed to look like a pinball game. There are only 21 game track spaces. The game uses a die instead of a spinner and has a metal piece with a spring that helps determine extra scoring by shooting the die along the inside of the arch boundary. Where the die lands determines the extra scoring. The movement track has places with sayings such as "stubs toe -- go back 3 spaces," "steps on cat -- go back 2 spaces," "trips on shoe lace -- go back 3 spaces," and "sees bully -- go back 4 spaces."

The game uses a different artistic style for the inside game and the box exterior.

name: Presidential Election Game: Goldwater For President
description:
from notes from Tony and Theresa Game Wardens

This single, large piece of cardboard comprises the entirety of the Presidential Election Game: Goldwater For President (Kom-Pak, 1964).

One unusual feature of this game is that all pieces are furnished as cutout parts, including the six-sided die. Another noteworthy feature is the small Barry Goldwater circle, which presumably was intended to fill the empty circle on the board reserved for the 36th President. This game is marked, "Approved by the Republican Nat'l Committee."

name: Da Li Shui Shou
description:
Da Li Shui Shou literally means 'strong sailor' but the graphics used in the game clearly show the strong sailor to be none other than Popeye, the cartoon character.
The players have a choice of being Popeye, Olive or Bluto and the object of the game is to get all your pieces from the start to the finish. Along the way, there are spaces with various instructions to follow.
This curious Chinese roll-and-move game comes on a key chain. The tiny box holds the 12 pieces (four for each player), a little teetotum and a small folded paper board.

name: Ricochet Rabbit & Droop-A-Long Coyote Game
description:
This children's game was based upon a cartoon segment of Hanna-Barbera's The Magilla Gorilla Show where Ricochet Rabbit worked as a Western sheriff in Hoop n' Holler along with his deputy Droop-A-Long Coyote. The game includes
a game board with a cloverleaf-shaped track, a movement spinner, and mad man cards.

name: Reward
description:
Who killed Gloria Don? The game and the story begins with the discovery of the body and ends with the question: Who was the murderer? Each player acts as Chief of the Homicide Squad and as each new fact is unearthed he/she must choose the next step to take in his/her investigation. In doing so he may win money from his fellow investigators or he may lose to them, sometimes Heavily.

The game comes with paper money, some of which is distributed to the players, and a sheet which tells the background of the crime. The background is either read to ones self or read out loud to the entire group. Then the first page of the crime case is read. On the reverse of each case players will find 10 possible courses of action that he/she as investigator may take. After carefully considering all the given facts and without consulting any other player each investigator checks the two courses of action that he/she feels should now be taken.

After all players have decided on their particular course of actions a blue sheet is read which gives both benefits and penalties to each player depending on what decisions they have made. If both of the choices that an investigator makes are good the player will collect money from the kitty, if both are bad ones the player will pay into the kitty, if one is good and one is bad there will be a net plus/minus total which will create a small gain or loss.

Now the next page of the crime is read and the another set of 10 possible actions will be given from which each player can choose two courses of action. This continues until final evidence is presented and each player will be asked "Who Killed Gloria Don? Being correct pays off, being wrong costs you money. At the end of the game all players who have more money than what they started with sort of win with the player with the most money being the overall winner of the game. Many cases were available !

name: "Trek" The Road Map Game
description:
From the box: TREK appeals to the wanderlust inherent in most Americans -- to "hit the road" and find out what lies over the hill or around the next bend; to see how the other fellow lives; and to just get away from it all.

To start the play, the players agree first on the TREK. It will usually start from the home town. It can end anywhere. If you live in the north, you may want to go to Florida and back. If you live in the east, you may want to go to the west coast and back. The maps provided cover the entire United States on a scale so large that all but the smallest towns are shown. They are the latest and most accurate maps that Rand McNally can provide.

Each may follow a different route or all may follow the same route, but success may depend on who selects the shortest and fastest route.

The first player spins the arrow on the spinning board at least on complete revolution and proceeds as directed, sticking his pin/auto into the map to mark his position.

Delays, accidents, and detours affect only the player involved. Other players proceed according to their own directions as indicated by the luck of the spin.

Really, directions are hardly necessary. The game is so like a real TREK that once you get into the spirit of the thing and use the imagination, you will meet the emergencies as they arise.
mechanics: Line Drawing, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Humornyms
description:
Pick a card and choose the subject that seems funniest to you. Can you come up with a funny thing to say about the subject? an original joke my win you three points. Having trouble? Simply turn the card over and a joke is prepared for you. Can you read it like a pro and produce laughter from the audience? A successful reading can earn you two points.

Included are blue cards with over 300 original jokes and premises of all types, 180 counting chips, instructions, a 32-page book - "How to Produce Laughter" by David Challenge, and one plastic banana.

THIS GAME CONTAINS COMEDY FOR GROWN-UPS
Although the included jokes meet the decency standards of late-night network TV, parental guidance is suggested for younger players.

name: Challenge BINGO
description: You have never played a bingo game like this before. To play, roll the bingo dice and cover the space shown on the dice if you answer a trivia question correctly. But, if your answer is incorrect, you must re-roll the dice and uncover the space shown. The question can always be passed to the next player without penalty, but then your opponent may get the answer right and score a bingo before you do. Whoever scores bingo first, wins the game.

name: Conspiracyland
description: This game based upon the Kennedy assassination is based on the game Candyland. The four characters include Johnny, Jackie, Oswald, and Ruby. The board game artwork is by Roy Tompkins. It is stated that the average playing time is only 6 seconds!

name: Flower Table
description:
Flower Table is a game in the Wooden Balance Game series by Daiso, the Japanese 100-yen shop chain. These games may be cheap but they do have nice production values and are made of wood.

The game consists of a flower-like board that is balanced precariously on a stand in the shape of a truncated pyramid. The board is divided into petal-like segments, each with a blue, red or yellow spot. There are several little cubes and a die with a blue, red or yellow spot on its sides. Each player rolls the die and has to place a cube on a petal segment with the corresponding coloured spot. The player who causes the flower table to topple loses.

name: Angela Cartwright Buttons 'n Bows Game
description:
This game is based upon a young Angela Cartwright from the television show "Make Room For Daddy" which was later known as "The Danny Thomas Show." Angela Cartwright is also famous for appearing in the television show "Lost in Space" and the film "The Sound of Music."

The game box has a photo of her on the cover from around the age 7 or 8. The game comes with four game markers and four Angela picture cards, a spinner, and lots of vinyl buttons and bows used as game pieces.

"Who will be the first to pick and match Angela's Magic Buttons 'N Bows?"

name: Tak Tics
description:
Game number 5370 from Eberhard Faber, this game
"Combin(es) the skill of both chess and checkers with a new and tantalizing element of chance."
The board is an elongated checkerboard of two distinct colouring patterns, with several zones added in the centre and some out-of-bounds zones. Each player is provided with 10 pawns, which have movement rules similar to bishops in chess. An element of chance is introduced through dice rolling as well.

The box title is TAK TICS, while the Rule Book is labeled TAC TIKS

name: Battle Recall Card Game
description: Trivia game. Players score by correctly answering questions concerning American Revolutionary War, American Civil War, World War I, World War II, Korean War and Vietnam War.
categories: American Civil War, American Revolutionary War, Card Game, Korean War, Modern Warfare, Trivia, World War I, World War II

name: Jimbo's 99
description:
"Jimbo's 99" is published in 1976 and therefore a predecessor of "O'NO 99" (BGG game 7803), because the rules are exactly identical:

You must avoid passing 99 points or you loose the round and thus 1 of your 3 tokens. The last player with remaining tokens wins the game.
Different from O'NO 99 is the deck of 52 cards. In Jimbo's 99 there are 4 suits (compared to 3 in O'NO 99) and only 16 special cards (compared to 30).

The special cards here are:
- 4 x "Reverse"
- 4 x "Hold"
- 4 x "Minus 10"
- 4 x "99"

That means that the "Ten" and "Double Play" cards were added later.

name: The Black Community Game
description:
This game teaches children about cooperation, the proper value of money, and how the Black Community works. For adults, the game provides better strategies to help the Black Community. The winner is the player that does the most for the Community. This is determined by the player with the most chips. The white chips represent economic power. The red chips represent political power. The black chips represent power in the Black Community, and the blue chips represent 10 black chips.

A player may cash in his chips at any time with blue chips worth $100 each and the other worth $10 each. A player may borrow money or chips from another player, but a player may not borrow money from the bank. A player may also trade or sell chips.

A player may move to the Suburbs or Inner City, but that player will need two players to help him move or pay part of the player's salary.
The rules state that if everybody cooperates, then everybody will prosper.

One version of the box cover states that up to 7 player can play this game and that the game is appropriate for those Ages 8 and up.

Internet information states that the game was created around 1973. The game was developed in 1973 when Malik Ali was working with high school students in Buffalo in an after-school program. He wanted to teach them how the black community works in a quick and entertaining way.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Notruf 112: Die Feuerwehr
description: A simple roll-and-move game that tells the story of the German fire brigade using event cards.

name: King Leonardo and His Subjects Game
description: A very simple card game for Ages 5 - 12 with a copyright on the box - Leonardo Production Inc 1960 - for an animated television show of the times. The show focused on Leonardo, a lion, who was the inept yet well-meaning king of the fictional African nation of Bongo Congo, and his incompetent brother Itchy's attempts to overthrow Leonardo and rule the kingdom himself along with his friend (and leader) Biggie Rat, a gangster with an Edward G. Robinson-type accent

name: Bomb the Navy
description:
This game uses marbles to Bomb the Navy.

The game originally came with unpunched cardboard ships with little cardboard stands, marbles, and a set of instructions.

Players roll the glass marbles to try to knock of the ships. However, it appears that some versions use projectile pellets and rubber bands with a wooden cannon instead of marbles. The number of ships also appears to vary with some editions.

The winner is the player who shoots down as many ships as possible within three shot attempts.

Most sources place the initial publishing date as 1940, but this may be only an approximate date.

name: Captain Quantum vs. The Ugly Druggies
description:
This anti-drug program game for children between the ages of 8 to adolescence was "designed" by the creators of the popular television cartoon show "Ren and Stimpy."

This game was never sold in stores and was only distributed to schools. It was sponsored by the Coca-Cola company.

The game was designed to be played with an adult leader as an educator and non-player "mission navigator" who was to explain the game and encourage a discussion among the "sun troopers."

Some of the game contents include a set of instructions, a game board, six-sided dice, colorful spaceship markers, stickers, and 200 various cards.

name: I.Q.:  Dr. Hagen's New True or False Game
description: This game was used as an advertising game. The game had booklets which contained more than five hundred true/false questions rated according to difficulty, as well as ads for the sponsor's products (Aqua Velva After Shave). The game also included a small spinner and a game board which traced your progress from "greenhorn" to "genius" (or, if you fared poorly, to "idiot"). There were at least three different booklets of questions produced.

name: My First Card-Game: Colours
description:
This game is really 'Quartets' using ordinary household items in distinct colours and is intended to introduce children to card games.

Players try to collect sets of four items of the same colour, by asking other players for items. The player who forms the most sets of four wins.

name: Picnic Treasure Hunt
description: For 2 to 4 players Ages 6 - 12. Game comes with 24 destination cards, 4 player pawns, one die, and one spinner.

name: Bamsegrisen flyttar in
description: This games purpose is to decorate a room. It is based on a memory concept.

name: Miss Spider's Board Game
description:
Miss Spider's Board Game is a simple matching game based on the characters from David Kirk's "Miss Spider" children's books.

The rules includes instructions for three different matching games. In all games, a set of 25 colored discs are placed on the board. The backs of the discs show either guests and items Miss Spider needs for her tea party, a picture of Miss Spider herself, simple instructions, or nothing at all. There are also four strips showing four guests or items needed for the party.

The first game is a cooperative matching game in which all players try to match all the items on all four strips.

The second game is a simple "concentration-style" memory game where players take turns trying to match a pair of pictures on the bottom of the disc.

In the third game, players each take one of the four strips and attempt to be the first to find all four items displayed on their strip.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Memory, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: Spider-Man 3 3D Skyscraper Game
description:
Spider-Man 3 3D Skyscraper Game is a modular roll-and-move game given away in packs of Ovaltine 3-in-1 (a powdered chocolate flavoured malt drink). Each pack had 20 sachets and came with one module of the game. There are four different modules, each module consisting of a booklet of thick cardboard pages, which are to be cut up and assembled into skyscrapers and structures. The modules can be played individually or put together to form one big city - New York (structures include the Statue of Liberty and the Chrysler building).
The game is for two players, and one can choose to be either spidey or black spidey. The object of the game is to race around the city and the first player to reach the 'Winner' space wins. The path winds through the city and up and down the sides of the skyscrapers - the pieces can fit into slots in the walls. There are also spaces that allow a player to draw a card and follow instructions like, "Drink Ovaltine, get more power, Jump two steps forward", or, "Strong wind, all players go back four steps". A feature is that the die for the game is also included in each module - but you have to cut it out and assemble it yourself.
The text for the rules and on the cards are in Thai and English and the manufacturer of the drink is Thai. Besides Thailand, the packs were distributed in Singapore, Malaysia and Brunei.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: Radio Luxembourg Chartbusters Road Show
description: This is an action game based around a board which can be played in teams. There is a tape of music and sometimes you have to dance to this. The idea is to win silver and gold and platinum discs - which you do by moving around the board and obeying instructions on cards.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: ¡Vaya cacao!
description:
¡Vaya cacao! is a card game for 4 players that reproduces the work conditions in the cacao production cooperatives in Côte d'Ivoire.

Each player takes the role of a cooperative. The player's goal consists in sufficiently increasing the amount of cacao tons produced as well as raising the cacao's selling price to a number that makes a profit. The ultimate goal of the game is to get the 20 families who are part of the cooperative out of poverty.

To achieve this, the players need to earn a minimum of 42 million of CFA during the game.

name: Mosquito
description:
From the box:

"Guide the spinning 'mosquito' through the hazards to score points. 'Sting' the hunter - TO MAKE HIS HAT FLY OFF."

Players manoeuver a spinning plastic top around a 13" x 15" three dimensional moulded plastic board. The board contains six numbered structures which must be negotiated in order. A seventh structure, the face of a moustached 19th century hunter has a tongue which, when activated by the top, causes his hat to pop off.

Players score ten points per structure successfully negotiated. Bonus points are awarded for correctly triggering the hunter's tongue.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Spider's Maze
description:
From the box:

"A surprise action game of balance.
weave through the web ... KNOCKOUT the SPIDER!"

Players attempt to cause a large black plastic spider to spring from the center of a plastic web-maze by guiding marbles along the strands of the web. The marbles trigger a rubber band which holds the spider in place.

name: Bucket of Fun
description:
From the box:

"EXCITING ACTION - INDOORS OR OUT!
magic bucket pops out a shower of balls -
players scramble to retrieve them."

A plastic bucket about 8" high & 8" in diameter with a spring-loaded platform is filled with plastic colored balls. A knob is turned, releasing a timer which, in due course, activates the platform.

The plastic balls are propelled in all directions. Players attempt to be the first to retrieve all balls of their chosen color one-at-a-time and place them in their correspondingly colored plastic container tube.

Game gets very hectic.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Humor, Racing, Real-time
mechanics: Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Old Scratch
description:
Old Scratch

"Tommorows safety thru todays fun". 1959 board game by Decor Note Co. of St. Paul Minnesota, Educational Games Division #200. The box comes with 2 Driver training games in the same box. Let's Drive and Old Scratch (see separate entry for Let's Drive). This colorful 2 sided game board measures 20 1/2" x 15 3/4" The instructions are on each side of the gameboard for that particular game. There are 15 white cards and 11 yellow cards, each side of a card is for one of the games. The game includes tiny plastic model cars. Object of the game is to successfully complete the course. Old Scratch is described as a game of chance. Rolling particular combinations of numbers with the dice results in benefits to the "drivers"

name: Watergate Impeachment
description: Another of the many games created regarding Richard Nixon and the Watergate Scandal. This game advertised itself as "two games for the price of one" and "twice the fun, half the price"

name: Meet the Prophets
description:
How well do you know your LDS prophets?

This game includes four sets of rules for play. All of them center around matching and knowing the order of the LDS prophets. The cards include facts about the prophets, pictures, order of succession and signatures.

Note: This 1982 version only covers the prophets through Spencer W. Kimball.

name: Coast to Coast
description: This is what the box called a Radar Action Game. The object of the game is to drive your Motorcycle cross-country by Remote Control and was made by the Ewing Mfg and Sales Co of Pasadena, California. The game has a board and a working remote control with steering stick, a set of instructions, a Coast to Coast Finish line, 4 motorcycles and 8 plastic tunnels.

name: Doghouse Game
description: From Kenworthy Educational out of Buffalo New York. Box claims that this is an interesting course in Phonics taught as a game and that it is equally effective when used singularly and in groups.

name: Big Ten Football Game
description:
Rules for this game were extrapolated from the AGPC Online rules archives;

Big Ten Football

Dice driven football game from the late 1920's produced by the Sanwah Keen Game Co., 625 East Market Street, Stockton, California.

Game is played over a 20 minute time-frame divided into 10 minute halves. Game has board with results listed depending on if a pass or run is called by the Offensive player. Different codes show Penalties, Fumbles, Interceptions etc.

One unusual feature of the game is a connotation at the bottom of the rule book which states that; "The Big Ten game board provides an excellent medium for following football games as they are broadcasted play by play over the radio. When used for this purpose the dice are of course discarded. By following the broadcasted game in this manner an accurate picture of every situation is presented to the audience at all times."

name: Red Riding Hood
description: Game box describes the game as a wonderful game to delight youngsters. Simple children's game where you spin a spinner and then move along a path. At different spots on the path there are squares that require you to pick up a card. Those cards either help or hurt you in your attempt to move through the board. The game features a magic remote control magnetic wolf that moves around the board attempting to impede your progress.

name: Funnel Web: The Deadly Game of Escape
description: Try to escape the deadly clutches of the funnel web spider. Pit your d12 rolling skills against its sticky web. Includes "fascinating facts" on Australian animals like the kangaroo, koala and funnel web spider. Game comes with 4 variations.

name: Nuit Blanche
description:
Nuit Blanche is a simulation of the French national sport called Boule. Many active French players call it also Pétanque.
The aim of the game is to get your quite heavy metal balls as close to the smaller, wooden and colored 'jack'. The winner is the player whose ball is closest to the jack. The Team achieving first 13 points wins the match.

In this boardgame adaption you roll out the flexible map and soon opposing and own balls group themselves around the goal ball "jack" and the players stand before the decision, depending upon game situation, whether to aim or to shoot.

To determine if your action was successful or not you will use a two-pieced plastic ball with a pointer and two scales. In a dexterity depending action you shake that ball trying to get that pointer pointing at the right position. At first you won't succeed very well but with more experience you will find that this process is not only luck but also controllable.

name: Beetle Bailey's Hilarious New Army Game
description: Simple Spin and Move game from the Beetle Bailey Cartoon Strip. Featuring Beetle and the Sarge and Killer and Zero. Different spaces on the board either help or hinder your progress.

name: Vertical Gaming System
description:
JDB Games' Vertical Gaming System are a series of 3D Tic-Tac-Toe games that help prepare students to understand and enjoy the fantastic Time Vectors.

3x3x3 Tic Tac Toe: Play until a student can always win if (s)he goes first.
4x4x4 Tic Tac Toe: Like Qubic, the first player can always win, but the solution isn't readily apparent.
5x5x5 Tic Tac Toe: An even further expansion, it's also possible to play for four-in-a row on this matrix.

Remember, these systems are stepping stones to Time Vectors--a wonderful, educational game for improving visual-spatial awareness.

name: Carrefours
description: The board represents a track that can be followed with a car (the pawns represent cars). Each player receivers his car and 250.000 francs at the start of the game. In each round the players roll the dice and advance their car. During the game the players can enter in sports events (they pass them on their track and they include a ski event, horseback riding, tennis, sailing or golf). These events cost 50.000 francs to enter but can earn the player points. The players can also encounter bad luck during their journey (flat tire, accident, they can even end up in hospital). In the end the player who completes the track first with the most points wins the game. This game was created in 1955 by the same designer as 1000 Bornes.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Footgoal
description: The players try to make a path with cards that are marked with lines. The lines should connect to the goal of the opponents. The players can also try to interrupt the paths of their opponents.

name: Calculus
description: Learn the term dividing whilst playing. Every player starts with a math task, the result determines which track has to be followed on the board. Three degrees of difficulty allow younger and older children to play this game.

name: Tom & Lucy
description: A passionate game full of vital information. For adults and young people Ages 12 and up. How can we arm ourselves against AIDS ? Do mosquitoes transmit AIDS ? What is the immune system, the blind period ? Why is vaccine research so difficult ? You can find the answers to these and to many other questions in Tom & Lucy, the great educational game about AIDS. The objective : to be first to eliminate AIDS from 2 zones in the world.

name: Lucky Sixes
description:
The Felix Sex (Lucky Sixes) was a popular game played in the Roman Empire. Numerous boards, dices and pieces have been found and there are even some descriptions of the game in Latin documents. The Felix Sex appears to be the same as the Duodecima Scripta (The game of Twelve Points), probably the ancestor of the Backgammon and certainly very similar to the Ancient Greek board games.
The oldest boards have three rows of twelve playing squares, divided down the middle by a gap. Usually Romans had a fondness to divide the boards with letters instead of squares, with popular content and sometimes with rude comments.

name: Whist-O
description:
This Bingo variant incorporates elements of the card game Whist. At the start of the game, a standard playing card deck is dealt out evenly into stacks in front of all of the players. Each player is given a board showing all of the values in all of the suits. Every turn, starting with the dealer, players ante into the pot and turn up the top cards of their stacks. The player with the highest-ranked card wins the trick and gets to put a chip on their board in the corresponding space. Losers all have to put chips into the pot. The first player to get five consecutive values in a single suit (a vertical row) or four suits in a single value (a horizontal row) calls Whist-O and wins the pot.

The game includes 12 boards and a bag of red plastic chips, but playing cards are not provided.

name: HI-RO
description:
extrapolated From Games Archives rules for the game; HI-RO is a fast and exciting game. Any number of players may play by having a tray of blocks (dice). The object of the game is to turn your blocks until all 5 of them have the same number appearing along the row of sides facing you. The first person to accomplish this calls out "Hi RO" and receives a score determined by the size of the numbers that he/she lines up.

The 5 blocks are set up to that all blanks appear at the top then the tray is passed around the table. The first player moves the center block 3 spaces. That in turn will reveal a number on the top block. That number determines the number of spaces that the next player must turn and so on. Each player must turn the center block with his first play. After that he may move any of his blocks in an attempt to line up 5 faces numbered alike. The top side of each block last turned controls the move of the next player but you try to score the sides facing you.

name: Reg'lar Fellers Card Game
description: From Kidd's: Card Game based on the Gene Byrnes Famous Cartoon from the mid 1920's. Also known as the "Peppy Game"

name: I.Q. Games: United States Geography
description:
How well do you know your US Geography?

In this game, one player reads from a list of numbered clues on the back of a card while others try to guess the correct answer. You score five points for guessing after one clue and it declines to one point if all five clues are read. The last clue is a picture of the state in question and various visual clues. Players continue taking turns until all cards have been read. Score is kept on included scorekeeper. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

name: TrigO
description:
TrigO™ is a creative board game that teaches the rudimentary concepts of trigonometry. The game has six levels of play ranging from beginner to advanced.

Each player receives 6 playing pieces of the same color, one for each of the trigonometric functions. There can be 2 to 6 players.
Players will learn the names of the six major trigonometric functions: SIN, COS, TAN, COT, SEC, CSC. Advanced rules provide you with concepts of the four quadrants and the signs for each function in each quadrant.
Players will learn the ratios of the sides of a right triangle for the six major trigonometric functions. The triangular playing pieces are specially designed to show the direction of rotation for your playing piece around each triangular path.

The simple rules for the novice is called the "Beginners Game" In this game you will learn the names of the six functions and what constitutes a triangle.
In the "Direction Game" a player will find that there is a clockwise and counterclockwise direction of movement.
The "Function Game" requires you to start your playing piece such that it moves onto the numerator for the trigonometric ratio of your playing piece and then onto the denomator for that playing piece.
In the "Many Triangles Game" a player will make use of smaller right triangles to shorten the distance of travel.
In the "Quadrant Game" the player will find that there are four quadrants on the playing board with a specific sign for each trigonometric function as represented by the playing pieces.
In the "Function Sign Game" the player will need to observe the sign for each playing piece for the quadrant it is in.

name: The Salt Birds of Akarah
description:
The Salt Birds of Akarah has elements of both a pickup-and-deliver game and a combat game. Players control a number of birds, each trying to pick up salt crystals, and bring them back to their home base. Along the way, you can freeze and opponent's birds with arctic crystals, zap them with laser beams, and contend with them in an "exciting fruit challenge." The latter uses a guessing game mechanic, where the object is to successfully discard disks that are marked with bad habits, such as "greedy," "obnoxious," "reckless," and "untrustworthy."

The Salt Birds of Akarah has been awarded US Patent number 4927155.

The inventive game may be played by from two to four players, each one of which has a home base game piece and a plurality of salt birds. At the beginning of the game, the home bases and a plurality of other game pieces are placed on the game board in a prescribed manner including a plurality of salt tablets. Each player has a plurality of bird game pieces for movement on the board. Each player has a plurality of discs describing various bad habits. The object of the game for each player is to obtain a predetermined number of salt tablets by moving their bird game pieces and landing on the spaces having salt tablets, then returning the obtained salt tablets to their home bases while getting rid of their bad habit discs.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: Gridfun
description: From the rules: "Gridfun is a football game, employing three dials with spinners, one for kicking, one for running and one for forward passing."

name: Vanguard: Men At Arms
description:
Vanguard: Men At Arms is a set of miniatures wargame rules aimed at gaming small scale skirmish actions between the 12th and 15th Century.

Players can control a dozen or more soldiers in fast and bloody clashes with their opponent as they try to raid, ravage and wreak havoc in enemy territory.

Each figure on the table represents 2-5 men, with a ground scale of 5 yards to the inch. Therefore a game between two forces of twenty men on a 6' x 4' table will represent about 70 soldiers per side fighting across an area about a quarter of a mile across.

name: Lilla Anna och Långa farbrorns tårtspel
description:
Roll the die and move. If you end at a blue square take a blue card. If you end at a red square, take a red one and make an imitation of the animal shown. Then take a blue card.

When you have two identical blue cards you may trade them against a "cake card". The first player with four "cake cards" is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Memorico
description:
From Publishers Website:

Using three pack of Memo-Rico cards, players can engage in up to four captivating and educational games, designed to help youngsters know their multiplications like the backs of their hands! In groups or alone, learning has never been so fun and easy!

Suggested Ages & Up

name: SpeelBank
description:
Players are director of a bank and will invest in products, develop and bring them to the market.

At the beginning of the game everyone receives a card which states which products are to be purchased. With some starting money and one first random product, every turn dice are rolled and paws moved. The board shows all available products, and whenever the player lands on a product space he can either buy it, or must pay the current owner.
Besides product cards there are positive and negative cards which must be drawn when landing on the subsequent space.
The winner is the one who first succeeds to collect the products on his card.

This game was released in 1997 at the 100th anniversary of the Rabobank in The Netherlands. All cards and components are Dutch.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Dymonds
description: An abstract games played with chess pieces on a rotated chess board. There are two kind of pieces, Kings and Jacks. The object of the game is either to capture the opponent King or to reach the opponent "King Triangle" i.e. the opponent's home base.

name: Baseball
description:
This version of baseball was produced in 1941 by Milton Bradley. It is a physical dexterity game that uses a thick cardboard bat about 3.4" long, with a wood semi-circle glued to the underside about 1/3 in from the handle, and with a small hole near the tip of the bat. There are 8 small glass balls, 4 white and 4 black. The cardboard playing field is inset into the box bottom, and is punched with a variety of holes.

The rules on the side of the box say that when batting, a player puts the bat about 2" from the home-plate corner of the box, mounts a ball of his color on the hole in the bat, and then brings down his finger with a sharp blow to the bat handle. This launches the ball up and onto the playing field. Falling into one of four large oblong holes around the pitcher's mound is a strike. Dropping into the round hole near each fielder is an out. Dropping into any of the numbered holes is a safe hit of that many bases. There is a home run hole in deep center field. If a launched ball fails to fall into any of the holes, it is a ball. Three strikes cause an out, while four balls of course generate a walk. Successful hits are marked by putting balls into holes on the appropriate bases before batting again.

The game can be found listed in "Baseball Games from Antique Baseball to Modern Baseball Sims".

name: Quest of Efil
description:
Quest of Efil is played on three boards, each at a different scale. One board shows a world map, one is for arranging a group of dungeon-like mazes, and the third is for tactical battles. Players take on a role, each described on a character card. These include a hero, a wizard, a master thief, a dwarf king, a cyborg, and a ninja.

Players complete a series of quests, each of which has the aim of collecting an item to be used in defeating the final enemy. Quest of Efil has been awarded US Patent number 5476264.

name: Afvalwijzer
description: In Dutch game Afvalwijzer the players have to cope with 6 types of garbage. This could be a bag of chips, an empty package of cigarettes, ... In the centre lies the board with on it twice every location. By using die, the players walk around the board, whenever they get at a location where they can dump their garbage-cards, they can do so. He who manages to get rid of his garbage at the right location before his opponents, wins the game.

name: Maisy's hide and seek adventure game
description:
Help Maisy find her favorite things and then take her to some of her favorite places!

Maisy's Hide and Seek Adventure game is perfect for young children ready to play their fist board game! The simple, easy to follow instructions enables players to practice these important skills:

Color matching - players roll the color die and move to the space that matches the color rolled.

Memory - if they land on a space that pictures an object, they must try to find the chip that contains the matching object. In order to be successful, the player needs to remember where certain objects are hidden!

Taking turns - a child's first game experience teaches cooperation and consideration for others.

Following in sequence - to be successful, the players need to follow their given path and get Maisy to her favorite place.

Cooperating, winning and losing graciously - an important lesson to learn early in life!

There are 3 versions of play that vary in degree of difficulty.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: The G.S.T.
description:
G.S.T. The Game!! Have Fun!!

Brian's Biggest Blooper

You hated it!!!
You paid a committee to study it!!!
Now play it!!

3 strikes you're out
3 stripes you're in
Government pays
One Million for painting

Your chance to laugh at the government.

Take the role of one (or more) of 10 different occupations and travel around the board following the instructions in the square you land on. Draw cards, read them out loud, and follow those instructions. You can change occupations in the middle of the game by landing on the Reincarnation square.

A simple game and *very* Canadian-centric.

name: Kullerkäfer
description: A guessing a verbalizing children's game where the goal is to collect the most beetles.

name: Golden Curls
description: This is a dice rolling game which tries to simulate the game of Curling, with simple rules for 2 individual players or 2 teams of players Ages 9 and up. Draws, blank ends, hit and roll, takeouts, peels, steals and more but best of all there’s absolutely no sweeping to do!

name: He Scores Ice Hockey Game
description: This game combines all the thrills of real hockey and is played on a board representing the ice surface. Players are shown in both Red and Blue. The game has two dice and a puck which is moved through squares in the direction and by the distance of what was rolled on the dice. Game appears to feature pictures of both the Montreal Canadians and the Toronto Maple Leafs.

name: All Star Hockey Game
description: Old Hockey Game. Not much information is available for this game. Board (rink) is marked off in squares and the pawns used to represent players move from square to square depending on a die roll.
publishers: Canada Games Company Lmt., The Canada Games Company, Ltd.

name: Double Game: The City of Shadows
description:
The "Double Game" series of books uses a combat and inventory system familiar to many "fighting fantasy" style books. But this one allows two players to play simultaneously (each using a different book of the pair). The books use cross-reference tables to allow the players to interact with each other (cooperating or otherwise) at certain points.

One player player plays Coreus, the Prince. The other plays the Bardik, the Thief.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Hustler's The Great American Baseball Game
description: A solidly made tin Baseball Game that has a large roller at the top and a very nice graphic representation of a ball field. That roller has a slot at the top of the game that shows results of the at bat depending on what is happening on the field. In other words with runners on 1st and 3rd the results might show a Sacrifice Fly while with nobody on base the results might be a Single.
publishers: Frantz Manufacturing Company, Hustler Toy Corporation  (Hustler Game Company)

name: Denn wir fahren gegen Engelland
description: Boardgame with 6 lead figs 3 U-boots 3 planes, rules in German. Title of the game includes the antiquated spelling "Engelland"
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: QUAD: Galactic Chess
description:
A chess variant from 2 or 4 players.
Played on a concentric board which allows for "orbiting" movements in addition to the traditional ones.
The aim of the game is to reach the center of the board with the Federation Ship (i.e. the King).

Pieces are named Starfighters, Invaders, Voyagers, Rockets and Shuttles.

Contents
1 board
64 playing pieces;
- 4 Federation ships
- 4 Star Fighters
- 8 Invaders
- 8 Voyagers
- 8 rockets
- 32 shuttles
1 rules booklet

name: The President
description:
THE PRESIDENT GAME
Super Fun - Super Fashion
When you are not playing it - wear it - it's hot!
(65 % polyester, 35% cotton)

Unfold the game and find the playing surface on the back of a fabulous oversized t-shirt (one size only).

Become the Ultimate Power!
Become THE PRESIDENT!

Players must work their way up 7 levels to finally become THE PRESIDENT but beware of the pitfalls and temptations along the way. Don't get caught committing fraud or end up in a sex scandal. Watch out for assassins!

Chose a running mate or go it alone.
Good luck candidates - you are going to need it.
It's not easy being THE PRESIDENT.
Everyone wants the shirt off your back!!

name: Creature Feature
description:
Players choose a card representing their monster's body. Each such monster's body can then hold a variable number of heads, limbs and tails (i.e. the blob cannot have a head but can have up to 8 limbs and tails). Each body also provides a special power different from other monsters. Players bid for different cards of body parts, each provides additional powers for your monster.

Players start with 12 dice to allocate among their monster's body parts. The dice indicate the amount of power available to each body part and how much damage it can take.

On each player's turn they can choose to attack with one of their body parts (i.e. laser beams from the head, pincer claw limbs, etc.) rolling the dice from that body part. The player targets an enemy monster's body part, hits cause damage that remove dice from that body part. When a body part runs out of dice it is destroyed. When a monster loses all of its dice it is destroyed. Different powers allow players to reallocate dice and recover dice.

name: Cranium Grab & Go Turbo Tic Tac Toe
description: A version of tic tac toe from Cranium. Their rules allow for many variations on the traditional gameplay, such as dice roles, and flipping and swapping pieces. Part of the Cranium Grab & Go series.

name: Pizza Fraction Fun Jr.
description: A creative way to "deliver" an understanding of fractions! Seven games offer different levels for learning the values of: 1/2, 1/3, 1/4, 1/5, 1/6, 1/8, 1/10 and 1/12. Children practice identifying fractions, matching fraction equivalents and adding and subtracting fractions. Game includes 11 double-sided pizzas (one side is labeled with the fraction) with 59 individual slices, three double-sided spinners and game guide.

name: Animals on the Loose!
description: Help beginning-level ELLs build confidence with this appealing animal-themed phonics game. Pictures encourage home language connection as students learn to decode English words. Game questions focus on word beginnings and endings, letter-sound correspondence, rhyming/word families, letter recognition and spelling. The first player to spell his or her word wins. Game includes 209 cards, die, 4 animal game pieces and Activity Guide. Ages 5 - 7
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Word Game

name: Endless Monsters Upon Japan!
description:
From the website:

" In Endless Monsters Upon Japan! you direct an unstoppable stream of monsters from your home city towards either Tokyo or Hiroshima. One player seeks to reduce the major cities of northern Japan to rubble; the other is against southern Japan.

The monsters are very active, and cause little trouble if allowed to run from city to city. But if delayed at a city they stomp about in frustration and cause great damage. True to the ideals of collectible monster games, the monsters enjoy fighting each other and grow in size with each victory. Moreover, the theme of collectible monster games also led the mad scientists to create three colors of monsters, each of which has an advantage against another.

The game is easy to learn and quick to play. Two playing boards are included: a chart makes learning the game simpler, while a map of Japan is prettier to use. There are numerous strategies, some of which will be discovered quickly by an adult player and others of which are more subtle."

name: Wizards of the Vicious Circle
description:
From the website:

"Wizards of the Vicious Circle is a two-player game as clever and original as any you will see. Strategy goes beyond moving pieces as players try to out-guess which three of five creatures the opponent will initially deploy, and where. The other two creatures become reinforcements later in the game. The vicious circle (how each of the five pieces can capture only one of the opponent's) interacts with board terrain and initial deployments to make each game uniquely interesting and intriguing."

name: Walls and Stairways
description:
From the website:

"An underground magical labyrinth has several stairway exits, each climbing up to the surface and ending beside a city. The players represent these cities. The goal is to have heroes/heroines exit the labyrinth to your city -- and the more treasure such heroes/heroines carry the better!"

name: Alien Checkers
description:
From the website:

"Alien Checkers is a versatile game. Besides using cards during the game, players select one of nine special cards to secretly find out which planet they are representing: each planet has a different secret victory condition. Children can enjoy how the game is silly and (compared to plain checkers) gives them a better chance of winning when playing their parents. Adults who wish to analyze the game more carefully will notice new flavors of strategy as the cards and secret goals work together."

name: Chessboard Heroism
description:
From the website:

"In Chessboard Heroism you are a hero or heroine, trying to do heroic things before wars break out and your career options are reduced to boring military service. You long to solve real quests: saving people who need rescuing, finding lost magical items, fighting wild monsters, etc. But time is running out! Cards detailing quests cover a chessboard's squares. Solve the quests faster than your opponents while cooperatively maintaining the political stalemate or the game ends! And watch out for the randomly wandering dragon!"

name: Markets and Mercenaries
description:
From the publisher:

" Markets and Mercenaries is a simple and quick board game that combines the interesting features of many more primitive "build a colony" computer and board games (resources, buildings, market economics, special events) while excluding features that tend to slow such a game down (exploration, territorial expansion, conquest). The game uses a Monopoly-like path around the board's outer edge allow random events in a way that carefully prohibits luck from overriding strategy.

Players use wise resource management and strategic construction of new buildings to expand their colony. Resources are not only traded among players but bought and sold with the Empire in a market with varying (and manipulatable) prices. The colonies also build up military strength to use at the conclusion of the game when the colonies jointly declare independence and the Empire responds with an invading army. "
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Escape From Amarth Bara
description: For one thousand years, the home of the evil sorcerer Ardune, Amarth Bara, has been deserted until recently. Now monsters started to emerge and attack the kingdom. It only seems that Ardune has risen once more. Only 6 of the bravest knights have been summoned to investigate. All 6 entered the doors, but they never returned. All was fuzzy in their minds as they woke to find themselves lost in an endless dungeon. Now they must fight their way out and Escape from Amarth Bara
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Monster Liner
description:
A luxury liner hits an iceberg and begins to sink. Unfortunately, some of the world's great monsters that had been captured and placed in this boat as part of the liner's entertainment - a giant ape, a vampire, a fish-man, a wolf-man, a mummy and a man-monster - roam free now that their cages have been broken. It's up to the stalwart heroes who captured these creatures the first time, to take them down permanently. And they have to do it amongst, fleeing passengers, unsuspecting maidens and frantic crew. Oh, and before this ship sinks.

This game was the winner of a "Monster-Themed Design Contest" that Z-Man Games held on the Board Game Designer's Forum.

name: Fun at the Zoo Game
description:
Fun at the Zoo is a children's game. From the side of the box:

Players choose the colored marker they wish to play and place it at the ZOO entrance. To determine playing turns, players spin the spinner one time and the player with the highest number begins first, and the other players follow in turn to the left. Shuffle the Suspense Cards and place face down in the center of the playing board.

Players spin the spinner and move forward the amount of spaces indicated on the spinner dial. At "Your Zoo" you may "Feed" some of your Zoo friends and some you may not. Upon landing on a space marked for one of your Zoo Friends, player draws one of the Suspense Cards. If the players marker is on a space marked "You May Feed" and the Suspense Card states to "Feed", player may go ahead 2 spaces. If the turned over card says "Do Not Feed" player must go back 2 spaces. By the same token, if the player marker is on a "Do Not Feed" space and the card turned over says "Do Not Feed" player may go ahead 2 spaces, but if the card says to "Feed" player must go back 2 spaces. Replace the suspense card face down under the pile after use. The first player to arrive back to the entrance wins the game!
publishers: Built-Rite, T M Promotions Pty Ltd Australia, Tee Pee Toys, Jessup Paper Box Co., Warren Paper Products Co.

name: 'Round the World Joe
description: This game consists of words and phrases that are used to fill in the blanks of Joe's traveling narrative. This game measures 5 3/4" x 4 1/4" x 1".

name: Verne Gagne Wrestling
description: Verne Gagne Wrestling is one of 6 games that were included in a grouping of games from the Gardner Company. All games came in the same box under the title of Big 6 Sports Games. This is a simple spin and find the results game. Also included in the box with this game was; Mickey Mantle's Big League Baseball, All Star Football, Gardner's Championship Golf, All Star Basketball and Gardner's Stock Car Race .

name: All Star Football
description: All Star Football is one of 6 games that were included in a grouping of games from the Gardner Company. All games came in the same box under the title of Big 6 Sports Games. This is a simple spin and find the results game. Also included in the box with this game was; Mickey Mantle's Big League Baseball, All Star Basketball, Gardner's Stock Car Race , Gardner's Championship Golf, and Verne Gagne Wrestling.

name: All Star Basketball
description:
All Star Basketball is one of 6 games that were included in a grouping of games from the Gardner Company. All games came in the same box under the title of Big 6 Sports Games. This is a simple spin and find the results game. Also included in the box with this game was; Mickey Mantle's Big League Baseball , Gardner's Stock Car Race , Gardner's Championship Golf, Verne Gagne Wrestling, and All Star Football

The object of the game is to score the highest number of baskets and free throws. To setup, you shuffle the Referee's cards and place in a pile, face down. Players determine which side of the board will be HOME and which is VISTORS. Play begins with a jump ball in the center circle. Players spin until both arrows point to the same team (innermost circle) to determine the Offensive player. The ball will move in the direction of their target basket. Offense player spins again and places the ball in the color position on the Court matching the color indicated by the arrow. Players both spin reading the numbers on the outer edge of the spinners. Ball movement will occur based on the numbers spun by both Offense and Defense. The possible outcomes are: the ball moves in the direction of the error on the board, ball is intercepted, ball is stolen, or a basket is made. If Defense ever spins a 4, the Offense picks up a Referee card and follows it instructions. Player is allowed 3 spins for a free throw shot.

Players determine length of time by agreement on time limit or number of points.

name: Gardner's Stock Car Race
description:
Gardner's Stock Car Race is one of 6 games that were included in a grouping of games from the Gardner Company. All games came in the same box under the title of Big 6 Sports Games. This is a simple spin and find the results game. Also included in the box with this game was; All Star Football, Mickey Mantle's Big League Baseball, Verne Gagne Wrestling, Gardner's Championship Golf, and All Star Basketball.

Players spin to determine lane order. The player in lane #1 spins and moves that many spaces forward on the track, followed by the car in lane #2, and so on. To change lanes, the car moves sideways (not diagonally) on the track. If a player spins or lands on a "Draw Card" space, they draw a card from the "PIT" deck and follows the directions. To overtake another car, players must drive around the car ahead unless their spin lands them directly on the same space. In this case, the overtaken car moves back one space and the passing car takes their position. Use the score pad to track the number of laps. After 6 laps, the game ends and the winner is the first car to pass the finish line.

name: Gardner's Championship Golf
description:
Gardner's Championship Golf was one of 6 games that were included in a package of games called Big 6 Sport Games. This is a simple spin and find the results game. Also included in the box were Verne Gagne Wrestling, All Star Football, Mickey Mantle's Big League Baseball, All Star Basketball, Gardner's Stock Car Race .

Players take turns teeing off by spinning the spinner and rolling the color die. The inner circle on the spinner indicates the zone the board and the color die indicates the colored space in that zone where the ball lands. After all players have teed off, the player furthest from the hole plays first. Players reference the Shot Chart corresponding to their zone/color to determine where their ball lands next. A combination of Zone VI, Red, means the ball landed in the hole. If you receive this combination on the tee off, you earned a "hole-in-one".

When all players have landed on the green, the Putting Green, Zone VI chart is used to determine the number of putts to hole out. Individual scores are tracked on the score pad (each move counts as one "stroke"). Play 9 or 18 holes of golf. The player with the fewest total strokes across all holes is the winner.

name: Tom & Jerry Game
description: This is a spin and move game. Object of the game is to begin in the mouse hole of your color and then by spinning the correct colors leave your hole, find your sweet - whether its cake pie sugar cookies - land on that treat and then get back into your hole in the floor first.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Terry Tell Time
description:
Game for very young children that helps them tell time. Features a colorful playing board divided into 4 color sections, 24 Terry Tell Time Activity Cards (4 each of 6 different scenes), and 1 Clock N' Color Spinner.

Based on the TV show "The Adventures of Terry Tell Time", featuring Carol Reed and the Bunin Puppets. Captain Terry (seen on the game box) and his sister Tina Tell Time (both from Switzerland) were the puppets that helped children learn to tell time. The 1950's kids show also featured cartoons, music and more.

name: The Merry Bell Game
description: A friendly little game for 2, 3 or 4 young children. The object of The Merry Bell Game is to be the first to move from Start to Finish, following the colorful dots on the gameboard. Players ring their bells when they spin their color and when they land on a picture space.

name: Gruff Goats
description:
From the website:

" In Goats Gruff you are a fairy in charge of guiding your goats (big, medium, and little) to the Island of Good Grass. There are four bridges from the Outside Land to the Island. Two trolls move among these four bridges. Play cards to take and use the magic wands: if you have the proper magic wand you can move a certain-sized goat or a troll. Also, if you have just the right combinations of cards you can stir the dragon, who will swoop down to eat one of your rival's goats. Who will be the first to help three goats get to the Island?

This is a children's game because strategy can be neglected for straightforward play and the way in which players compete for the magic wands is childishly simple (I'm taking it... No you're not... Yes I am... No you're not...). Adults would probably enjoy this game as much as children only when tired or inebriated. For a more mature, intellectual, similar game based on the same game mechanic please see my Walls and Stairways. "

Available at http://davidvs.net/boardgames/

name: An Artifact for Dr. Storn?
description:
From the website:

"An Artifact for Dr. Storn? blends diplomacy and board-movement in an original way, creating an interstellar treasure hunt that appeals to both a childlike desire to collect nifty artifacts and a mature desire for strategy. Players are agents sent by different planetary governments to collect famous artifacts. Since some artifacts cannot be picked up unless you are carrying others, players constantly trade and steal artifacts. How should you balance trading for mutual benefit with hindering your opponents' progress? How can you time your interplanetary travel so you are carrying or steal the artifacts you need the moment you return to your home world? Should you abandon your main quest and search for the mysterious Book of Knowledge, that if correctly handled will allow a second player to claim victory?"

name: Thought Eaters
description:
From the website:

"Thought Eaters is a quick, cute maze game. Each player is attempting to navigate a path to the center of the board. If all goes well this path involves seven turns. Players draw and play two "turn right" or "turn left" tiles each turn to represent their animal's own planning. Each turn players also can move one tile anywhere on the board. If your plan is good enough your animal moves along its path of tiles. You will need strategy and diplomacy to reach the goal first."

name: Stars Our Decimation, Ground Zero
description:
THE STARS Our DECIMATION is the name for a series of interrelated science fiction wargames built around the actions mechanic. TSOD games all feature hand-built rules, hex grid regulated movement, a unique actions system, and versatile unit design rules.

Ground Zero is a tactical ground combat game, best suited to running company-level combats. Rules are based strongly on another game in the series - Voidstriker

name: What Do You Know About The Government
description:
This is a 'Facts worth knowing' Game

What Do You Know About The Government from Milton Bradley copyrighted in 1939.

Game comes with 100 Questions and answers about the U. S. Government.

name: "Seven by one Stroke"
description:
The brave little Taylor from the fairy Tales, has made a jam Bread for his hungry stomach. Going only a short while away dozens of Flies attacking his Bread and want to eat the entire Bread... Who is faster? Did the Flies can eat the entire Bread before the Brave little Taylor is Return and hits "Seven by on Stroke" or not...

2 to 4 Players from 4 Years up are recommended to play this small Game. Rolling one Dice and setting one Fly to one of the 9 Parts of the Bread which has the same number of Points on it (Side of one dice similar to the rolled Dice). If enough flies, from your Color sitting on one Part, you earn the Piece and take it beside of you. Than take a card and hopefully it isn't the third flycatcher. If this is happens the Games End and the Taylor takes the Flycatcher and hits maybe "Seven by one Stroke". The player with the highest number of Pieces (for older Children add the number of Points) is the winner. Alternatively the players must reach a number of Points/Pieces to win or the Taylor has won the Game....

The Rules can be downloaded for personal Purposes and for Free via the Internet and this site.

German Description:
"Sieben auf einen Streich" ist der deutsche Titel des schon 1998 publizierten Spieles der Firma: General Games Company.
Der englische Titel lautet "Seven by one Stroke".
Dieses Spiel hat nichts mit dem Spiel der Firma Clementoni zu tun!

Bei Sieben auf einen Streich, müssen die Spieler (ab 5 Jahre) Ihre Fliegen, soviel von den neun Teilen eines Marmeladenbrotes aufessen wie möglich, bevor das tapfere Schneiderlein zurückkommt und "Sieben auf einen Streich" erwischt. Jeder spieler hat seine Fliegen und setzt je nach geworfenen Würfeln seine Fliegen auf die Teile des Brotes. Sind genügend eigene Fliegen auf einem Brotteil, dann nimmt der Spieler der Die nötige Anzahl erreicht hat das Teil an sich. Er zieht eine Karte vom Stapel. Ist es ein Haufen Fliegen mit Krümeln dann geht das Spiel weiter. Erwischt der Spieler ein Karte mit einer Fliegenklatsche kommt das Spielende ein Stück näher. Bei der dritten gezogenen Fliegenklatsche, nimmt der Spieler welche diese gezogen hat, die beiligende Fliegenklatsche und haut einmal kräftig auf die übriggebliebenen Spielteile. Dann ist das Spiel zu Ende. Wer die meisten Punkte hat is der Sieger.
Die Regeln können für den privaten Gebrauch frei aus dem Internet heruntergeladen werden und natürlich auch von dieser Site.

name: The Coping Skills Game
description: Another Child'sPlay game designed for therapy/teaching coping skills. Children roll a die and move around a track. When landing on different spaces, children are posited situations to which they must respond or a coping skills card. When a player responds to a card in a suitably acceptable way, he or she receives a victory point chip. Theoretically, at the end of the game, the player with the most chips wins. However, the game is focused more around helping children to develop nine positive coping skills than a winner.
mechanics: Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Helping, Sharing, and Caring Game
description:
From the rules

The therapeutic game has enjoyed widespread utilization throughout North America and abroad. The Helping, Sharing, and Caring Game is a derivative of the therapeutic instrument-- specifically designed for children, their siblings, their parents, and other adults with whom children may be involved. The cards that Dr. Gardner considered most directly relevant to the therapeutic situation have been replaced with cards that are of educational value, especially with regard to ethics and values that are important to impart to children. The cards also facilitate interpersonal communication.

name: Stop Relax & Think
description:
Players roll and move along a track. Players must satisfy the conditions of either stopping, relaxing (engaging in an activity that is thought of as relaxing), or thinking. When a player has successfully traversed the track, he or she wins.

From the creator:

STOP, RELAX, and THINK evolved out of my work with children at Fourth Street Project over the last four years. We work with a lot of impulsive children at Fourth Street on gaining greater skills in self-control. We have found that enhancing children's awareness of their feelings, teaching problem-solving skills and pairing that with relaxation training increases their ability to own their part in problems and to gain a greater internal locus of control.

name: Octo
description:
Octo is a member of the battleship family of paper and pencil games. Each player sets up a board in secret, and then takes turns asking the other player about the board.
