description: Players have 3 rolls to try and spell B-R-I-D-G-E using the 6 custom dice. If a player spells bridge they get 6 points, bridg scores 3 points and brid scores 1 point. All other combinations score nothing. The first player to 15 points wins.

name: Bild-a-gram
description: Players begin the game by selecting a word or short phrase as the target. Players then take turns spinning the spinner that determines what letters they may take or how many letters they lose. The first player to spell out the target word or phrase wins.

name: Salomo Junior
description:
Salomo Junior is an expansion to Salomo 3000 Bible trivia. Expansion adds 1050 easier questions for children and 700 questions for adults.

Expands:

Salomo 3000
categories: Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Religious, Trivia

name: Dune Buggy Rally
description:
Each player assumes the role of a dune buggy racer. Each player takes a racer and puts it on start. In turn, each player rolls a die (the rules says dice but only one die is provided), advances one’s own dune buggy that number of spaces, takes chance card and follows the cards instructions. Landing on certain spaces and the cards award victory points. The player with the most victory points after all have finished wins the game.

The most outstanding feature of the game is its oversized (22 ½” x 36”) gameboard. The game is one of a series of “Gold Cup Games.”

name: Horse Trail Ride
description:
Each player assumes the role of a horse rider. Each player takes a horse and puts it on start. In turn, each player rolls a die (the rules says dice but only one die is provided), advances one’s own horse that number of spaces, takes chance card and follows the cards instructions. Landing on certain spaces and the cards award victory points. The player with the most victory points after all have finished wins the game.

The most outstanding feature of the game is its oversized (22 ½” x 36”) gameboard. The game is one of a series of “Gold Cup Games.”

name: Not at All Trivial
description: This is a trivia game intended for play specifically by families, including children (and extended family). The "trivia" questions focus on facts about the family members themselves (such as things they did while growing up, things in the family home, family ancestors, etc.) While not overtly religious, the game was marketed to a Latter-Day Saint (Mormon) audience.

name: The Golden Plates Game
description: This is religious-themed family card game has a set of cards which can be used in three different types of games: "Rameumptom" is a set collecting game similar to old main, "Who Am I?" is a trivia type game, and "Golden Plates" is a matching game. The cards contain images and information about historical characters from the Book of Mormon, a book of scripture of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints (Mormons).

name: Fours
description:
A simple game, played with 5 dice and similar in mechanics to Yahtzee, in which players get 3 chances to roll the lowest score possible.

At the beginning of each player's turn, they roll all 5 dice. Then, they may set aside any number of those dice and roll the remaining dice a second time. They may again set aside any number of dice and re-roll the remaining dice for a third time. Dice you set aside previously may be re-rolled if you wish, and you may end your turn at any time if you are happy with your current roll.

Once the rolling is done, your score is the total of all dice, with a few special rules:

1. Fours are free, so you do not add those to the total.
2. If you have four dice showing the same number (except four), you subtract that many from the total. Five dice of that number does not count.
3. If you roll a straight (all five dice in order sequentially), you subtract 4 from your total.

The game can be played with any number of people, and plays over five rounds, or however many you wish. At the end of the five rounds, the person with the lowest total wins.

name: Trivia Britannica
description:
The object of Trivia Britannica is to get to London via the M25 motorway from wherever you started on the game board.

To reach London, you must have collected tokens from around the board. These are obtained by landing on token cities and answering a question from the category related to that city. On answering a question correctly, the active player can roll the dice and move again.

The standard game requires 3 tokens to get into London, the expert game requires 6.

Home Page: http://www.triviabritannica.com

name: General Manager: The Baseball Business Game
description:
General Manager - The Baseball Business Game produced in 1967 by the H & S Game Co, of Columbia, S.C.

The box is plain green cardboard, with the title in a yellow label sort of area that also touts the game as "educational & realistic," "for 2 to 4 players" and notes "New players may enter the game at any time."

The folded green playing board has a generally *Monopoly* sort of layout, with five franchises per side (named only by city) taking the place of *Monopoly* properties and the white "track" interrupted by "Breaks of the Game" squares, which also occupy each corner of the "track." Each of the four sides of the "track" has a semicircular "siding" featuring smaller squares for "trades" and minor-league purchases. There are cards for "player development" and lots of phony cash. (More information to follow)

Game listing comes from a compilation of games created by:

Yahoo Group ---- Baseball Games Group;antique baseball games to modern tabletop sims

More description of the game will be forthcoming from information received from members of the group.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Battle 3000: Come Defend Your Planet
description:
Collectible Card Game where you aim to dispose of your planet's nuclear waste on another planet, while preventing aliens dumping their waste on yours. Attacks are made by constructing an elaborate pattern of cards on the table and then announcing an attack based on the total attack scores of all played cards.

Published only in Australia and no longer available.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Environmental, Fighting, Science Fiction

name: Wiggul
description:
Wiggul your way through to capture or display!

Wiggul (also previously known as Squiggle) was conceived as an update for the game Kasam. It includes the escort capture style of Kasam but uses a hexagonal board. An additional aspect of the game is that winning can be by position (getting 5 pieces in a line).

name: Xephyr
description:
Xephyr is ideally designed for three players, but can be played with any number between 2 and 6. Balance and co-operation are the ways to win in Xephyr.

Xephyr uses a dice; the latter is unusual for Fleur Designs games but it doesn't mean the element of skill is missing. The whole game is based on your skill of balance; can you get your first piece to its goal whilst keeping your second under control? If you can't then you can lose badly.

name: Diversion
description: Diversion is a simple game in which your move dictates where your opponent can move. Do you go for speed or sending your opponent in circles?

name: Qiddle
description: Qiddle is a redesign of The Royal Game of Ur, with a design goal of adding meaning to the spaces while altering the layout of the spaces. It pits player against player against player against player. Two or four compete but there are limited safe spaces and your resources won't allow you to keep to safe havens.

name: Five
description: Five is derived from an ancient Indian game like Ludo. Unlike all other games from this source, Five can be played without dice; then it turns into a game of pure strategy.

name: Guide
description:
Guide is a game of tactics for two players and extends some of the gameplay of draughts (checkers). It is played with draughts pieces on a Laita board (irregular 4x5 diamond).

Instead of taking pieces from the board, as in draughts, captured pieces are stacked beneath the attacking piece and can be rescued later when their attacker in turn is captured.

name: Gold Rush
description:
Gold Rush is a game of alertness and fast reactions. The idea is to collect 5 identical cards and the grab a gold nugget.

This game comes with a board and specific places to put the gold nuggets. There are 62 cards with seven for each of the eight minerals (Gold, Diamond, Emerald, Silver, Platinum, Ruby, Copper and Iron). There are also six cards for Fool's Gold.

name: Odds And Evens
description:
Odds and Evens is a gas rationing board game that was created in 1979 at the height of the gasoline crisis.

Game components include 'Odds' and 'Evens' cards which aid you in moving around the board and collecting 'Ration Coupons', 'Gas Cards' and 'Credit Cards'.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Speedway: Big Bopper Game
description: Car racing game that features a carnival type "ring the bell" mechanism that determines car movement.

name: Gidget
description: Teenage girl's game based on the TV show "Gidget".

name: Gidget Fortune Teller game
description: Card game based on the TV show "Gidget".
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Leave it to Beaver: Rocket to the Moon
description:
Space themed roll and move game based on the TV show "Leave it to Beaver"
Object of Game is to be the first player to reach the moon. Players flip a rocket-shaped cone onto a board to find out how many spaces to move their marker. The path to the moon is full of perils and traps which players must avoid.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Space Exploration

name: Battle Animals Playing Card Game
description:
From the manufacturer:

Battle Animals is a game of strategy, much like chess, where each card has its own strengths and weaknesses. Learning how and when to use each card is the key to the game.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management

name: CrossOver
description: Similar to Blokus, players lay down colored tiles on a field. Tiles must connect "via a straight line drawn from any of the corners of their last tile, but the line must be in continuous contact with tiles of the same color to be valid."

name: The Productivity Management Game
description:
Produced in 1974 by the "Educational Products Inc. Division of Westinghouse Learning Corporation". The contribution of "Mark Coker, Productivity Management Consultant" to the development of the game is acknowledged.

"The Productivity Management Game presents real life simulations of situations and activities leading to the improvement of productivity in a variety of businesses and industries. Improved productivity contributes to profitability and lowered consumer costs.

Game Objective: to undertake three productivity improvement projects for an organization and to complete the projects on or ahead of schedule, with anticipated or greater savings for the organization." [preamble to the rules]
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Tru-Action Electric Track Meet
description: From the same company who made the famous Tru-Action Football game (The one with all of the men with plastic legs that when you turned on the power "ran" all over the place. This electric action game features 4 Sprinter racing figures. There are two different kinds of tracks on the field (board). One features the regular running events like the 100 yard dash, the 220, the 440 and the mile run. A separate track was used to run the low hurdles. The low hurdle track had bumps on it so that at least in theory the runners actually jumped over those low hurdles as they came down to the finish line.

name: Video Varmints
description: Players attempt to blow as many varmints into their opponent's goal as possible in this air powered game.

name: Yippee Rolling Game
description: Players take turns rolling small wooden balls down a sloped gameboard. The gameboard features holes of different point values. Players try to get their balls into the various holes to score points.

name: Big League Game of Baseball
description: Dice Baseball game using 3 D6 dice to determine the outcome of each pitch. The game board included 10 wooden pegs for recording base runners, outs, balls and strikes.

name: The Peculiar Game of My Wife and I
description:
From the National Museum of Play Online Collection:
"One of the most popular children's games of the late 19th century was called "Peter Coddles and his trip to New York," or some variation of that title. The games true origins have been lost but it is thought that it was first developed by McLoughlin Brothers in New York, though nearly every competitor produced one or more versions. Some, such as this version, bore completely different titles but followed the same method for play. It is a very simple word game best played with a large group of children, so it lent itself to social gatherings, parties, or holiday functions. The game consists of cards, usually small printed strips, with word groups printed, usually nouns. A leader reads the 'story' supplied with the game and when he/she encounters a blank, the first player to the left supplies the words from the card drawn. The play advances around the table, with nonsensical humor increasing with each blank in the story. Versions range from simple to deluxe--with quite complicated printed stories supplied. The game relates to other word games of its time such as Anagrams and to contemporary word games such as Boggle and Mad Libs."

name: Ridiculous Vanity
description:
Ridiculous Vanity is a miniatures rules set that simulates European politics and land warfare during the age of Louis XIV. It is really two games in one. The first is a campaign game where the players are national leaders engaging in politics and moving forces across a map of Europe divided into areas with differing economic and strategic value. The second is a set of miniatures rules for simulating battle from 1660 to 1715. The rules may be used exclusively of the campaign system and vice versa.

The rules do not require re-basing from other rules systems. The units are standardized with infantry battalions consisting of 12 castings, two cavalry squadrons are 4 castings each. The number of castings per stand varies with foot and cavalry types. Armies are organized into commands and orders are issued to commands and groups.

The book includes several campaign scenarios set for different periods beginning in 1660, 1680, 1690 and 1701. There is also one battle scenario for the Battle of Utrecht, 1676.

name: Building Boom
description: Players construct a vertical track using plastic pieces then marbles down the track.

name: Johnny Ringo Game
description: Roll and move game where players round up rustlers. Based on the CBS TV show "Johnny Ringo" staring Don Durant.
categories: American West, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Stoney Burke
description: Roll and move rodeo game based on the ABC TV show "Stoney Burke" staring Jack Lord.
categories: American West, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Game of Emigration
description: This game's theme is the Mormon emigration from Nauvoo to the Valley of the Great Salt Lake. The game includes a “pioneer odometer” spinner, game pieces (covered wagons and pioneers on foot), and 150 quiz cards. Game play takes the pioneers on the Mormon trek through Iowa, Winter Quarters, and past obstacles like buffalo stampedes, Indians, skunks, cliffs etc. The Game of Emigration was locally produced in Utah with limited production and distribution.

name: Know Your Gospel
description: Know Your Gospel is a LDS (Mormon) trivia game for families or small church groups with questions focusing on scripture, church doctrine, and church history.

name: Nephi's Knowledge
description: This is a religious (LDS/Mormon) trivia game using material from the Book of Mormon which was marketed for family or small church groups.

name: Mormon Sports Trivia
description: Mormon Sports Trivia is very similar to the game Trivial Pursuit, except all questions deal with LDS history, sports, and Mormon athletes. This game was published as a follow up to the success of LDS(Mormon)game "Jots and Tittles" and even uses a Jots and Tittles gameboard. There are six trivia categories: 1) Play on the Field, 2) Action on the Court, 3) Competition in the Arena, 4) Figures and Personalities, 5) Great Moments and Achievements, and 6) Miscellaneous.

name: Paleotopia
description:
Free, downloadable, educational board and card game designed for students, Grades 5 through 7, that teaches the fundamentals of paleontology -- digging in the field and researching about what you find.

From the website:

"You're a paleontologist, searching the world for pre-historic remnants and evidence of past life. As you move through the landscape you'll need to dig for discoveries (in the dig spaces) and research for information on what you dig up in your adventures (research spaces.) Your goal is to set out from the University in search of evidence of past life and return after you match 5 Dig Cards with their correct Research Card. Be the first to make it back to the University with your matches and you become the Paleontology Professor and game winner."

Game files (available as one pdf file and broken up into several pdf files) freely available on website.

Webpage also includes the game's design process and game variants.

Home Page: http://www.soozzone.com/paleotopia.htm
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Game of Terry and the Pirates
description: The Game of Terry and the Pirates was produced by the Whitman Co. in 1937. Special dice let Terry, Pat, Connie, Dale, Old Pops and the Bandits to try and move around the board in an attempt to collect the treasures. Playing pieces included 4 wooden markers for the characters and 4 wooden scoring markers. The playing board had different things that could happen to any of the players in the game. Players start in Shanghai and attempt to collect the treasure and leave the board.

name: Garroway's Game of Possession
description: Geography based boardgame where the players buy and sell US States.
categories: Economic, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Let's face it
description: A face building game where players use plastic pieces to create funny looking faces for the game characters.

name: Pinhead
description: Labeled "the hide and seek game" it's nothing more than a roll and move game.

name: Captain-General: Wargames Rules and Army Guides for Land Battles, 1660-1721
description:
These rules simulate land warfare in Europe during the period 1660-1721. One centimeter represents about 20 yards. Units represent infantry battalions, cavalry regiments and artillery batteries.

Units are made up of stands with variable number of figures and units are also made up of variable numbers of stands depending on unit type. Foot units are differentiated by tactical doctrine: platoon firing, shock, rank firing, skirmish, dragoons, etc. There are similar differences among the horse units.

The rules come complete with a very large set of army lists of various nations from the different period covered by the rules.

name: Blasto
description:
"The Game of Space Tag" This is a nuclear/space themed version of Battleship.

From the rules .....

Blasto is a battle between two space fleets. Regular Blasto is played by two players. Three may play, however, if two game boxes are used. See note under variations at the end. The object of the game is for each player to locate and destroy his opponents' fleet. The player who accomplishes this first is the winner. Occasionally there will be a tie game.

name: Stagecoach
description: Simple wild-west themed spin and move game. Game includes 12x12 cardboard game board, spinner & 5 wooden discs for pawns.

name: Laita
description: Laita is a game of tactics played on an irregular 4x5 diamond board. It can be played by two, three or four individual players, or by four players in a partnership game.

name: Four Square
description:
Four Square (4²) is a tactical game that can expand from one board to many, and where the playing area can wax and wane and twist and turn.

It is available as 2 or 4 boards, with the unique option of add-on boards. A total of 6 different boards are available.

name: Chiaroscuro
description:
Chiaroscuro is an advanced version of Fleur Designs' game "t'other" for 2, 3 or 4 players. Most of Fleur's games have simple rules - the interest is in the tactics - and although Chiaroscuro's rules are, like the others, short they are more complex and need the ultimate in concentration.

Your task is simple if you've placed your pieces well. But can you keep track of your opponents?

name: t'other
description: t'other is a simple strategy game and was designed with a modern Wars of the Roses in mind. It's not possible to explain without giving the full rules but those not from either side of the Pennines will be relieved to know that even southerners and foreigners will be capable of playing the game and no phrase book is required!

name: Sesame Street Preschool Games for Growing-Shapes
description:
From the box: "Each GAMES FOR GROWING game set contains a variety of game materials that are used in various combinations depending on the particular game played.
Games for Growing-Shapes has instructions for 8 possible games.
Game 1 Shape Pair Game, object is to collect the most pairs of shape cards before opponents.
Game 2 Remember-A-Shape Game, object is to collect most pairs of shapes by remembering where they are.
Game 3 Spin-A-Shape Game. object is to get rid of your cards by matching the spinner.
Game 4 Fish for Shapes Game, object is to collect the most pairs of shape cards by going "fishing."
Game 5 Shape Rummy, object is to get rid of your cards in your hand before any other players by grouping shapes into sets.
Game 6 The Funny Train Game, object is to complete a train of three of the same shapes or five different shapes.
Game 7 Sherlocks's Great Shape Mystery Game, object is to collect the most cards by matching mystery cards with cards in your hand.
Game 8 Mumford's Hiding Shapes Game, object is to Collect the most cards that make pictures by finding the hidden shapes in the picture.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle

name: Krikos
description: Krikos uses (circular) Byzantine Chess board, colours it as modern chess, uses modern chess pieces and moves and an additional set of new rules.

name: Hex Agon
description: Hex Agon is an abstract strategy game that can be played for different ways, including versions that allow for solitaire play and for up to six players to play. Mechanics involve racing of pieces, capturing of pieces, and placement strategy.

name: Crazy Horse
description: Simple roll and move game. Game came with a game board, 4 Blue Horse pegs, 4 Green Horse pegs, 4 Red Horse Pegs and 4 Yellow Horse pegs and a die for movement
publishers: Big Top Games, Inc., Sabas & Carney

name: Renaissance Warfare
description:
Renaissance Warfare was third in the SAGA series of rulebooks for period warfare. It is a set of miniatures rules simulating land warfare in Europe and Asia from 1494 to 1690. It may be used with any scale of figures. There are extensive rules for organization but players may use figures based in the standard DBx format with little problem.

The rules contain rich detail on warfare in this period of many unit types while still providing a playable game that will see a result in a few hours. There are 49 army lists that themselves provide a rich source of information and cover the important armies of Asia as well as those of Europe. There are also lists for relatively minor powers such as two lists for Ireland and one for the Knights of St. John.

name: Cossack Wars
description:
Cossack Wars is a set of miniatures rules designed to simulate small-scale warfare between cossacks of the 17th and 18th century. It is a skirmish-type wargame with individual figures representing single cossacks. They are given various personalized characteristics.

The rules are simple and perhaps somewhat reduced to produce quick play. The rule book also contains 13 prepared scenarios of various sizes of which the largest would require 180 figures (360 figures to also represent dismounted cossacks) and the smallest 30 (60).
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Cities! Busy Places, Friendly Faces
description: Cities! Busy Places, Friendly Faces is a game associated with the Kindermusik music education program, aimed at preschoolers. The game is actually a collection of several games, each with its own deck of cards and instructions. Most all of the games involve matching pictures on the cards with pictures on the board. In one game, "Busy City" for instance, one person selects a card, and then pantomimes the image or activity on the card for other players to guess.

name: Big Damn Range Wars
description: Basic Cowboys and Indians game from Crunchy Frog, part of the 'Big Damn' series of games. Includes cardboard cut-out figures, but can also be played with plastic Cowboy & Indian figures. Simple combat mechanic results in a quick, bloody battle; Basic game doesn't take terrain into effect so movement is based on an included 'ruler' which determines how far you can move. 5 pages of rules(including the optional rules), plus 5 scenarios.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Three Dimensional Movement, Variable Set-up

name: Sesame Street PreSchool Games for Growing: Going Places
description: This is an educational game that uses two different game boards for 2 different learning levels to teach children the concept of "going places," including methods of transportation and locations to travel to.

name: Sea Turtle Survival
description:
Free print-and-play game to teach children about the problems facing sea turtle survival.

Each player starts with 10 turtle tokens, and the game can end when any player increases his population to 50 tokens, or when after a set number of turns, the player who has the largest population. If a player runs out of turtle tokens, he is out of the game.

There are 4 variable conditions that help or hinder population growth. Each time a six is rolled on the dice, spin the spinner to see if these conditions (human interaction, climate, predators, and food availability) flip-flop from high to low or from low to high:

As players move around the board, cards may be drawn to collect or lose turtle tokens, change conditions, and gain tokens by answering trivia questions.

As players complete one life cycle and cross the start space, their turtle population increases based on the current population.

If players arrive at the same space at the same time, the turtles tussle producing more (baby) turtles for both players.

All components, except pawns and turtle tokens are available to download at the website: http://edweb.sdsu.edu/courses/edtec670/Cardboard/board/s/sea...

name: Odds And Evens
description:
Odds and Evens is a 2-player strategy game that can be played with components found in the average gamer collection.

The object of the game is to be the first player to move all of your pieces to the opponent's home row.

Players take turns rolling two six-sided dice and moving pawns on a standard checkerboard. A unique rule to the game completely eliminates any advantage earned of one player rolling better dice combinations.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Winery Game
description: From the Intro - The Winery Game is designed to be played by 2 to 6 players, each representing a different winery. The object is to generate the most profits before eight of the twelve markets are filled to capacity. This is done by buying grapes, bottling them into wine cases and selling the wine to the markets spaced around the board.

name: Octagram
description: Word game which uses 40 octagonal tiles with letters on them. Players draw and play a tile at a time to form words. In addition to forming words by adding to the existing layout, one or more lines of letters can be removed and replaced to form a word as well, although each word may only be scored once throughout the game. Can also be played as a solo challenge.

name: Wall Street
description: This is a solitaire-type game. The playing field is a row of twelve "gold" bars and the playing pieces are miniature bulls and bears. The game involves rolling a die to move and remove the playing pieces from the bars. This was produced as an executive-style game, as all of the pieces and the die are silver plated.

name: Educated Guess
description:
Educated Guess - Drawing game. Divide everybody up into two teams (there are rules for 3 players). Players alternate as the DRAWER and try to get their team to guess what they are drawing.

Both teams may guess every round. If the DRAWER's team guesses correctly then they move ahead one space. If the opposing team guesses then the DRAWER's team is blocked. There is no time limit for drawing/guessing. If nobody can guess correctly the DRAWER will choose a new 'Type Of' card to draw.

The board is made up of 5 Greek Letter - Pi, Delta, Theta, Sigma and Omega. Depending on which Greek Letter your pawn is on determines the 'Type Of' clue to be drawn.

The first team to the 'Omega' WIN space is the winner.

name: Dateline The History Game
description: Dateline The History Game is an educational historical trivia game. Players compete to provide the correct historical date of events, and then use number tiles to construct that date in a sort of crossword/scrabble type arrangement. The game's components are cards with the history questions on them and cardboard tiles with numbers on them.

name: Squarem
description: This game consists of a multi-colored checkerboard and four sets of cardboard counters. The objective of the game is to complete as many squares as possible. The basic way to do this is to fill in all four sides of a square with your counters and then place a fifth counter in the bed of the square so formed.

name: Houp-la
description: A children's game which uses the theme of a hoop toss at a carnival. This boxed game includes two rows of cardboard stand-ups featuring toys and items of the period and four rubber rings.

name: Sexdrive
description:
From the manufacturer:

Sex Drive is the rollicking adult game that challenges sexual know-how, show-how, and tell-how. Starting on the Outer Course, players answer questions or perform Body Shop tasks to show what they know about sex. The goal is to obtain your Sex Driver’s License, move to the Inner Course, and win by collecting certificates of knowledge from all 8 categories. Categories include women’s issues (Keeping A-Breast), men’s issues (Getting A-Head), sexual myths and fables (Trojan Horse Misconceptions), true or false statements (True or Phallus), and unusual or non-traditional practices (Pressed and Repressed). Players landing in the Body Shop will use hands-on skills to sculpt, draw, or act out their sexual knowledge. So grab a hot rod, hit the road and prove how much you know about Sex Drive!

name: March of Eagles
description: Tactical miniature wargames rules for the Napoleonic period.

name: Then Place My Parboiled Head Upon A Stake
description: An interesting set of tactical miniatures rules ralting to the Montrose Rebellion. Yes, the title is correct!

name: Lion of the North
description: An innovative tactical rule set based on the 30 Years War.

name: Wheel of Fortune Solitaire
description:
The object of the game is to get all the cards in their proper places according to the month on the Wheel Of Fortune. Each position will end up having three different cards, face up, that correspond to it. Interesting early Edu-Tainment game. Not related to Game Show --- this came out before it did.

Game components include : 2-piece puzzle-fit Gameboard, 42 Wheel of Fortune cards (3 ea. of the 12 months & 6 Wheel of Fortune) and instructions.

One player. Ages 6 - 12. Ed-U-Cards from 1966.

name: Be My Lover
description:
From the manufacturer:

To play, move your playing pieces along the game path picking cards. There are Intimacy Cards to direct you to either play an activity, ask your lover to play an activity, or have an activity completed together. In addition, there are Pleasure Cards that include sensuous pleasuring, intimate sharing and lots and lots of sex. A Spinner Game is included on the board to add random foreplay activities.

The game includes a game board, a deck of 55 Intimacy Cards with 157 different activities, a deck of 55 Pleasure Cards, 2 playing pieces, a spinner and instructions.

name: Apostlaspelet
description:
A family game that is based upon the New Testament. You travel around the Mediterranean Sea and visit all the famous cities from the Bible such as Corinth, Athens, Damascus, Jerusalem, etc. On your way, you answer Bible questions, survive uprisings, support the early church and convert unbelievers.
It is a basic roll-and-move game with some skill involved when answering questions.

name: Spin-A-Tale
description:
"Let your imagination run wild, as you spin a terrific tale..."

This game comes in a yellow plastic case, which holds the spinner and cards, and has clips built into the side for score-keeping.

Players take turns spinning the spinner, which will display a number (4,5,6, or 7) and a happy or sad face. That player must then take that number of cards (which display words such as "witch", "gorilla", "Something used in the bathroom", etc.) and has one minute ("No timer included") to tell either a "happy" or "sad" story using all of the words, to receive one point. First player to five wins.

name: North American Wild Flowers Card Game
description: Card game that comes with 50 3 X 5 cards that hopes to teach children about the wild flowers of North America. Instructions and descriptions are in English and French. Features artwork from Roger Tory Peterson, Walter A Weber and Al Kremi.

name: Pinky Lee's New TV Game Who Am I?
description: Based on the TV show that ran from 1954 to 1956, this is a children's game similar to charades that comes with 11 masks, a timer, crayons, and a wipe-off score card.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: The Watergate Caper
description: Another in the line of Watergate games that came out as the investigation was going on. The cover is stamped TOP SECRET.

name: The Game of Red Riding Hood
description: A roll-and-move children's game based on the Grimm's fairy tale Little Red Riding Hood. Comes with a cast iron Little Red Riding Hood. Came out around 1895.

name: Re-Discover Historical Washington, PA
description: A real-estate game unique to the Washington, Pennsylvania area. Similar to Monopoly. Produced by the local Rotary club as a fund raiser.

name: Jack and the Beanstalk Adventure Game
description: A spin and move game for 2 to 4 children. Each child plays as Jack, spinning and moving around the beanstalk board, collecting treasure cards. Includes 12 treasure cards, four jacks in different colors, one Giant piece, and spinner.

name: Plimil
description:
Game of strategy and memory, and suspense for two players, with unusual material.

The players create their block-pawns and their starting zone. They receive 12 block-pawns, 18 pawns of their color, 6 pawns of the opponent's color, and 12 neutral pawns. Players secretly insert combinations of 3 pawns in each block-pawn: 1 pawn of their visible color in the window; and 2 pawns of their choice. At the same time as the placement of the block-pawns on the board, the players build their starting zone by positioning the stems. The game begins with 12 blue block-pawns against 12 red block-pawns. The unfolding game will reveal neutral block-pawns, playable by the 2 players.

With each color a direction with displacement and catch is associated. The catch of an opponent's block-pawn consists in turning over it and replanting it on another stem. According to the internal combination of the block-pawn and the height of the stem, this action involves a modification of color, due to the translation of the pawns. No block-pawn is eliminated materially from the plate, it is transformed. As soon as a neutral block-pawn is present on the play, the players can turn the board a quarter of a turn, to counter their adversary, or to prepare their next blow: another vision of the play arises. The part is finished as soon as a color (Blue, Reed, Neutral) is represented more only by 7 block-pawns on the plate. The players count their respective block-pawns (Blue, Red). That which has some more gained: it is the rule of the 7.

Home Page: http://www.plimil.fr/

name: Scrapyard Wars
description:
From Boardgame News:

If the Scrapyard Wars title sounds familiar, that might be because it combines the names of Scrapheap Challenge—a British television show in which teams compete to build working machines out of scrap parts—and Junkyard Wars, the short-running U.S. program with the same set-up.

Now, instead of watching others transform junk into functioning junk, you get to assemble a few machines of your own—robots, to be precise, and preferably robots that will withstand some punishment. “Scrapyard Wars is a unique take on a combat arena style game in which players seek to build the best robots they can and then keep them alive long enough to get the most value out of their creation,” says designer Steve Sisk.

On a turn, a player can add a piece of scrap to his hand (either drawing randomly or exchanging a part in his hand for a face-up one), build a robot, add parts to a robot already in play (to earn more VPs), or retire a robot (to protect the VPs already earned by that bot). “Robots are worth VPs depending on the quality and mix of parts used to build them,” says Sisk. Robots hold up to four VP tiles worth 1-3 VPs each. “The longer the robots are around, the more VP they’ll earn—but the VPs for a robot may be lost if the robot is defeated or destroyed by another robot.”

During set-up, seven parts tiles are included for each player, and the game ends when a players takes the final tile. Adds Sisk, “With more players, there’s more risk of a more powerful robot being targeted by everyone else, so players must be careful when building. A very powerful robot will earn the most VPs, but will be more at risk of being destroyed. Players become more interested in trying to slip a less powerful robot under the radar of other players and build VPs slowly.”

name: Master Nexus
description:
Master Nexus is a connection of words, be it lexicon, geography, history, or famous people. Each player spells out words by placing pegs in holes under the corresponding letters. Each player in turn tries to form a word of one or more letters starting with the last letter used by the previous player. The first player scoring 150 points wins the game. No player should take more than one minute to form a word.

The game consists of a peg-board with 324 lettered holes in seemingly random order, and 324 pegs. The words are not connected as in Scrabble; the players simply fill up available letters on the board, and they cannot create words with, say, T if all Ts have been used. (Not counting the final letter of the last player's word.)

name: Jacob's Ladder
description: This is a children's religious (Christian) trivia game. The game includes a cassette tape which asks questions. Children then compete to answer correctly, with correct answers being rewarded with movement up their "ladder."

name: Sesame Street Preschool Games for Growing: Colors
description: This is an educational game that uses sets of cards to provide eight different card games for three learning levels aimed at teaching and reinforcing colors to children.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle

name: Super Veo Veo
description:
A boardgame version of "I Spy". One player secretly selects a card which represents one of the characters pictured on the game board.

One by one the remaining players must try to guess the first player's secret character. Players may only ask questions which may be answered "yes" or "no". Each question or incorrect guess at the secret costs a player one of his ten chips.

The player who correctly guesses the secret identity collects the card from the first player. The role of first player now passes to the next player to the left.

Once everyone has had a chance to be first player the game ends. The game can also be played two or more rounds, depending on how long a game is desired. The winner is the person who has the most cards.

name: Magic Tent Game with Mystery Treasure Hunt
description: It's a story, a game, and an adventure! Hank, Stella and Cody were camping one night in their grandfather's mysterious tent. When they woke up the next morning, they were in another part of the world! Can you solve the mystery of the Magic Tent and bring them home? Young adventurers climb into the full-size, indoor play tent and begin reading the story. The story contains hints to finding clues that parents have hidden around the house. The mystery and clues are provided in the Mystery Treasure Hunt, Vol. 1 Alaska, which is included with this set. After reading each hint, the kids climb out of the tent and race to find the hidden clue. When they have collected all the clues, they'll fit them together to reveal a secret message. It's an active and imaginative game for groups or individuals. The high-quality tent makes a colorful, sturdy play structure. It stands nearly 5 feet tall and 4 feet across, with stay-open tabs and mesh ventilation panels. Made from sturdy, flame-retardant, 70 denier nylon. Comes with 48" x 58" Nylon Tent, 15 Tent Poles, Mystery Treasure Hunt and Illustrated Instructions. For 1 or More Players, Ages 7 and up.
categories: Adventure, Educational, Exploration, Murder/Mystery, Party Game, Travel

name: The Magic Tent Expansion Pack: Mystery Treasure Hunt Vol. 2 – Australia
description: Designed for use with The Magic Tent, this second volume brings a brand new story and an all-new adventure full of mystery and imagination. Hank, Stella, and Cody camped out one night in their grandfather's mysterious old tent. When they awoke the next morning, they were in another part of the world. It's up to you to solve the mystery and help bring them home again! This time the adventure takes place in Australia. As kids read the story inside their own Magic Tent (not included), parents will hide clues around the house. During key points in the story, the kids will read a hint, climb out of the tent, and race to find the hidden clues. When they do, they'll put them together to reveal a secret message that helps them to solve the mystery! It's an exciting activity for groups or individual kids. It combines reading, imagination, problem-solving, active play - and it's just plain fun! This kit comes with a 58 page adventure book, 7 secret clues, and a smart card with instructions and additional information for parents. For use with The Magic Tent - sold separately. 1 or More Players, Ages 7 and up.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Murder/Mystery, Party Game

name: Jim Prentice Electric Basketball
description: Jim Prentice Electric Basketball from 1949. Each player has three terminal buttons. Players each select one or two buttons to push during a play. The combination of both players choosing one or two buttons results in a play or a shot depending on where on the court the play started from.

name: Le Signal
description:
Probably made during World War II since the cardboard is very flimsy, prints aren't centered and some cards have both straight angled and rounded corners.

This must be a Belgian version with text in both Flemish and
French languages. The spelling is quite old.

Goal of the game is to collect and play cards to drop a certain amount of bombs on the enemy. As an opponent cards can be played to harass and slow down the other player (pilot dead, bad weather,...)

name: The Spawn of Yog-Sothoth
description:
From the instructions:
Player #1 represents the investigators who have witnessed strange murders on the Miskatonic University Campus and now seek to find and destroy the cause of these murders before greater evil befalls Arkham. The evil is the spawn in human form, Wilbur Whately [sic]. To win, the investigator player must find and destroy him before or after he transforms into the spawn.
Player #2 represents the spawn and the cultists that worship and protect him. This player must eliminate all professor, police, reporter, and detective counters from play. At any point that he achieves this goal, player #2 wins the game. In the process of this, player #2 attempts to have Wilbur kill enough people to gain the energy he needs to transform into the spawn. Once Wilbur is the spawn, it will be much easier for him to attack and win.
Wilbur must transform into the spawn by the end of the last full moon phase on the turn track or his opportunity will pass until next year. Should he fail to transform into the spawn by the end of this phase, the game ends in a stalemate.

name: Jim Prentice Electric Fire Fighters
description: Another Electric game from Jim Prentice. This one is called JIM PRENTICE Electric Fire Fighters. I have little information about the game except that by pushing a trigger device you respond to the call for help fighting a fire.

name: Aeroplane Race: 'Round the World Fliers
description: This is a fairly basic spin and move game where players compete to be the first to complete an airplane race around the world. The large square metal board is a world map with a racing course plotted on it. The board has 2 spinners on it, which players use to control their airplane movement. Various other spaces/map coordinates have other bonus and hazard effects on the race.

name: Franklin's Treasure Hunt Game
description:
Franklin, Bear, Fox, and Snail are on their way home from school, and the teacher has given each an exciting challenge: Try to fill score cards with things they have found on the way home!

Players search for the treasure chips that match their score card. The winner is the player who is the first to find all the chips in his set. Versions are included for beginning and advanced players. No reading required.

Franklin’s Treasure Hunt Game is intended to help players to develop skills of visual discrimination, sorting and classifying, as well as important social skills: taking turns, following rules, sharing, and respecting others.

name: Quasselstrippe
description:
The title translates as tattletale or motormouth. A trivia party game for 2-8 people, it may have been first published February 1994 Spiel im Heft Spielzeit (Playtime Magazine). See designer's website http://www.burkhardt-spiele.de/Quasselstrippe.htm for a copy to print and play (in German). You will want to use die of different colors. It looks as though you roll the dice and have to name a plant, a politician, whatever to move forward and the name has to begin with the letter on the trail from start to finish.
Ages 8 and up

name: Das Lieblingsspiel von Adam Riese
description:
Das Lieblingsspiel Von Adam Riese (the Favorite Game of Adam Riese) is a simple self-published wooden abstract arithmetic game for two that plays in 5 to 10 minutes, and that comes in a pouch.

Each player (light and dark) plays on the same off-set grid of three rows up and three rows down. Each row has a start value of ten and four spaces to fill, except one space marked (+), resulting in fourteen spaces in all to fill. Each player has 10 stones to place: four square value stones (4, 3, 2, and 1), three round arithmetic symbol stones (the minus sign, the division sign, and the multiplication sign), and 3 tall round scoring markers (two in their own colour and one in their opponent's). Players take turns to place one stone of their own choice from their own supply onto the appropriate spaces. After all stones are placed, the scores are determined. Each player scores all the rows that are marked by the tall scoring stones of their color (one of which is placed by the opponent), and the score for each row is the outcome of the simple formula that players have created with the stones. Whoever gets the most points overall is the winner.

Adam Riese, in the title, refers to the great German mathematician Adam Ries, better known as Adam Riese (1492-1559), whose work contributed to the phasing out of the impractical Roman numerals in favour of the Arabic numerals that we currently use, and who made it his life's ambition to bring the basics of mathematics and algebra to all people. For that reason, he wrote his science books in German, rather than in Latin, the language of the scientific elite, and was one of the first to do so. The German phrase "nach Adam Riese" (according to Adam Riese) is still used as an expression in the German language to emphasize the obvious correctness of a result of simple arithmetic.

name: One The Board Game
description:
"An enlightening and non-competitive game for Christians from different backgrounds to explore and share their beliefs" (From box cover).

Players move their pieces, answer questions and vote on Christian discussion topics to gain game segments. Game continues until all have 6 segments; there are no winners or losers.

Published on behalf of the Churches in Great Britain and Ireland.

name: Die Bombe tickt!
description:
The Bomb is Ticking!: Your knowledge can save the city.
A self-published game created by Burkhardt and the senior class of Schubart-Realschule, Geislingen an der Steige, Germany. It centers abound the city of Geislingen as threatened by a bomb. Players need to know the answers to general and city-specific questions. With each wrong answer a figure advances forward to detonate the bomb. Conversely, if three questions are answered correctly, the players receive one of six puzzle pieces. When completed, the pieces combine to make a pair of scissors that can cut the fuse in time and thus save all the players and their city. This game may be the genesis of Burkhardt's DEUTSCHLAND - Finden Sie Minden (the map game for 3-5 players published by Kosmos).

name: Finger Dinger Man
description: Players take turns being either Finger Dinger Man or Super Slow Man.Depending on the card drawn, Finger Dinger Man is released down a ramp towards Super Slow Man. Buttons are pushed to fake out your opponent by both players. The winner gets a card. Object:To win the most Finger Dinger Man cards.

name: The Game of Categories, Answers and Fun
description: The object of the game is to fill in the spaces of the game sheet with answers that start with a designated letter and are associated with a specific category within the allotted time. This is very much like the game Scattergories that came a year before it.

name: I.Q. Games: United States History
description:
How well do you know your US History?

In this game, one player reads from a list of numbered clues on the back of a card while others try to guess the correct answer. You score five points for guessing after one clue and it declines to one point if all five clues are read. The last clue is a picture of the place, event or person in question. Players continue taking turns until all cards have been read. Score is kept on included scorekeeper. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

name: I.Q. Games: Wild Animals
description:
How well can you identify wild animals?

In this game, one player reads from a list of numbered clues on the back of a card while others try to guess the correct answer. You score five points for guessing after one clue and it declines to one point if all five clues are read. The last clue is a picture of the animal in question. Players continue taking turns until all cards have been read. Score is kept on included scorekeeper. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

name: Football Widows Game
description: This 1980 game from Real Life Games from Oklahoma City, Oklahoma is really just a football gambling game. You use real life football games and then bet on which team will win and cover the spread. You are playing with play money. The game tells you to add up your total wins and loses and then either laugh or cry. Game comes with a supply of play money and a weekly score sheet to mark down how you are doing.

name: Mickey Mantle: Roger Maris Official Home Run Derby Game
description: The baseball game is played by throwing Styrofoam balls at prongs contained within the target areas. Object was to have balls stick to the board in the HOME RUN area. The game comes with 3 Styrofoam balls and a small instruction sheet.

name: Ein Song für Tom
description:
Appears to be a companion card game to Freche Mädchen - Liebe, Jungs & Mädchenträume, also by Kosmos for the same gender and age group, based on the Sassy Girls, Sassy Books series. http://www.frechemaedchen.de/
The “Song for Tom” is set in the world of showbiz and music competitions. The players all have a crush on bitter-sweet Tom. Each player tries to form "girl groups" to win the contest first with a foursome, then a trio, and finally as a duo of musician cards. The first to complete a group receives a lucky stone as a reward. It takes three stones to win but heart-breaker Tom can appear at anytime to change the line-up.

name: Official Mickey Mantle Baseball Action Game
description: From Key Man; The box depicts a great picture of Mickey Mantle ready to swing the bat. The plastic toy is Approximately 7" long. Batter swings, and hits ball off standing tee when plunger is pushed.

name: Süße Jungs & Abenteuer
description:
Freche Mädchen - Süße Jungs & Abenteuer: another in the
Freche Mädchen Freche Bücher or Sassy Girls, Sassy Books-related game series by Komos. This one is story-telling teen party game about their first teacher or the first boy with whom they were in love. Afterwards the player investigates the cover stories of the others.

name: Jim Prentice Electric Whiz Raceway Game
description: Jim Prentice Electric Whiz Raceway Game. Another Electric Game from Jim Prentice. This time the push button electronic connections determine which cars move on their trip around the track trying to win the race.

name: Jolly Roger Pirate Game
description: Players spin a spinner to move their ship around a series of islands, racing to be the first to reach the home base.

name: Zippy Zepps
description: The game box shows a long Zeppelin air ship named ZZ1 and has the subtitle "Air Game". The two part board shows three cities inside large circles, Berlin, Paris and New York from left to right. Connecting the cities are curved, color paths, demarcated into spaces by crossing lines. The zeppelin pieces are made of metal. There are also cards showing zeppelins. The game was made to tie-in with the then new Transatlantic dirigible service

name: Sprung aus den Wolken
description: Based on a German television series of the same name around the time. Players were travelers parachuting into various adventurous locales such as making an accuracy jump, saving another skydiver by bringing him a parachute in freefall, firefighting as smoke jumpers, a demo jump before air force officers, incidentially saving one of them from drowning and finally saving some lost children.

name: A Game of Insights: For Men Only
description: This is a psychological-themed party game for men intended to have competitors explore their feelings, opinions, and awareness on variety of topics and personality areas. The game uses themes drawing from both Eastern and Western traditions of philosophy, etc. The game includes: 78 cards with illustrations, Playing board, Insights Into Action pad, and Guide to Keywords.

name: Auf und Ab!
description:
"Up and Down" was originally published around 1920 by J.W.Spear & Sons. In 2006 Kosmos reprinted the game, including reproductions of the detailed, painted metal playing figures that were in the original game.

The game itself is a simple roll-and-move style game with squares on a circus background.

name: Galaxy Xpress
description:
Galaxy Xpress is a fun to play abstract card game for age 8+. Player, as the galaxy tour guide, will fly a luxury cruiser and take his tour to three designated planets for sightseeing. If the time is allowed, he will be more than happy to take the tour to sightseeing the natural phenomenon that occurs only once in every one millennium. During the trip, player may take the shortcut through space portal but be most beware of the Xnergy waste and the evil pirate. At the end of the game, the player with the most victory point wins.

Ages 8 and up

Player: 2 to 6

Time: 30 minutes

Contents (98 cards):
12 Planets
4 Events: 1 phenomenon, 2 portals and 1 pirate.
66 Xnergy in 6 colors
6 Tour Schedules
6 Luxury Cruisers
3 Phenomenon Tour Receipts
1 Comet. Starting player card

Creating the Galaxy:
In the middle of the table, randomly place 12 planet cards in a circular clock formation; 1 planet at every hour position. The circular formation is the ‘galaxy’. Then place four event cards next to 12, 3, 6 and 9 o’clock planets; phenomenon next to 12, pirate next to 6, and two portals next to 3 and 9. Event cards must be placed outside of the galaxy.

Goal of the Game:
When one player arrives home after a successful round trip, game continues until the round ends, and player with highest victory points wins.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Pirates, Space Exploration, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: Green Goblin Game of Fractions
description: This is an educational children's game intended to teach them fractions. Players compete to correctly identify fractions and fraction calculations while avoiding the "Green Goblin." Game includes a variety of cards with fractions and partial fractions, pie charts, and a green goblin.

name: Ant Ranch
description:
(Taken from website)

Little Billy got an Ant Ranch for his birthday and sent away for entirely too many ants. You lead one of the unfortunate colonies trying to survive in your new plastic home. To win, you must battle the other ant colonies and survive the many perils, from handing responsibility of the ant ranch over to little brother Johnny (who loves playing with a magnifying glass!), to game's end, when Billy's mom gets fed up with the whole ordeal and throws everything in the trash. Whoever has the most ants when this occurs wins the game!

During your turn, you lay tiles to build the tunnel system your colony thrives in, or play special cards to harvest food and water so you can multiply faster than your opponents. Roll the action-packed aphid die and see what your outcome will be! 2-4 players can play Ant Ranch in 2-3 hours.
categories: Animals, Exploration, Farming, Fighting, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: The Republic
description:
Welcome to Rome, circa 510BC. Following generations of tyrannical monarchy, the fledgling republic of Rome has become a political battleground for a few old and powerful families, each now vying for control and influence. As the city grows so do familial ambitions.

Change is inevitable and the Republic will soon fall, only to be replaced by an empire the likes of which the world has never seen... but a great empire needs an emperor of great conceit and wiles. With the rules, alliances, and strategies ever changing, it might not be who you think.

The Republic is a game of political intrigue and city building for three to six players. Although tile placement and economics are important considerations, the true focus of the game is on the politics. Each round, players are required to vote on laws that drastically alter the way the game is played, often affecting players in radically different ways. The winner of the game is usually the first player to collect a set amount of Imperium, a resource which can be earned through well-planned construction or lawmaking.
categories: Ancient, Bluffing, City Building, Economic, Negotiation, Political, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Commodity Speculation, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Dare Ya!
description:
From the manufacturer:

Ok girls, you have been posting cool truths and dares to the Girl Tech website and now we have created the ultimate truth or dare game for you! Just spin to play and watch the cool lights display your next move, whether it is a Give, Take, Truth, Dare or Double Dare. And guess what, now you can record your very own double dares - you can make them as silly, gross or daring as you want! The Truth Detector let's you test your friends truthfulness. Collect a chip from each category to win the game!

* The ultimate Truth or Dare game
* Record four double dares of your own
* Truth Detector
* 500 Truth or Dare cards

Ages 8 and up
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Electronic, Party Game

name: Easy Come Easy Go
description:
Each player starts the game with 50,000 cash and pawns are placed on the start. Players then travel around the board (1 trip around equals 1 year) and attempts to collect CD's, Blue Star, Gold Mine, Oil Well, Real Estate, Mutual Fund cards in order to amass Bonus cards.

The first player to collect 5 Bonus cards wins the game.

name: Bicycle Moto Cross Challenge Action Game
description:
"Cross Challenge" is unique. It will teach you HOW to actually race at any BMX track.

This game is designed for two, three, or four players and it never plays the same way twice. The competition is identical to racing in a real BMX moto. "Cross Challenge" is truly a game of skill, but, like any sport, luck also plays a part. Choose the command card you think will gain you the best position on the board/track and then experience true BMS racing excitement known as "Berm Warfare" (In Bicycle Motocross (BMX) bicycle racing and mountain biking (MTB), a berm refers to a banked turn made from dirt with a relatively tight radius)
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Variable Phase Order

name: The Five Wise Birds
description: Five colorful birds from the island of Woozoo are sitting on a fence. Each player gets 6 shots per turn to knock them down. When a bird is hit, it flips over and a score is shown. The first player to 250 wins.

name: South Sea Adventures
description: Players dodge sharks and other dangers while trying to make their fortune in the South Seas.

name: Nittany Lion Trivia
description:
Contents: 1 playing board, one die, 250 question and answer cards, 25 directional cards, 4 player pawns and 16 scoring rings.

Players must correctly answer questions in each of the four categories when landing on the appropriate square. The player who answers all the categories first must then proceed to the Alumni house and answer one more question. The final question category is to be determined by the other players involved in the game. An exact roll is required before landing on the Alumni House. If the question is answered correctly the game ends.

name: Crimson Skies Privateers
description:
Card game for 2+ players.
Each player controls a squadron of Privateers.
The object of the game is to successfully lead your pilots on missions vs pirate gangs, enemy militias, and commercial zeppelins.

VICTORY Conditions
The player with the most VP (Victory Points) at the end of the game wins.
The game ends when a player goes to draw a card and there are no cards left in the deck.
VP are gained by completing missions.

Players share a common deck. That deck contains 6 types of cards: H = Pilots, P = Planes, W = Weapons, M=Maneuvers,
D = Damage, V = Missions

Game also uses two six sided dice
Counters are used to mark damage to the planes.


Each player is dealt 7 cards.
Roll high on 1D6 to see who goes first.

On ones turn the player goes through 6 phases;
Luck Phase
Recruit Phase
Mission Phase
Defender Phase
Action Phase
End Phase

Completing misions scores points Whoever at the end of the game has completed the most missions or who has destroyed aircraft who are attempting to complete a mission is the winner.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Collectible Components, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Piccolo Park
description:
A Medley of 4 Music Games

Using cards, a spinner, a 3D gameboard and a cassette tape, children play 4 progressively harder games to learn about the orchestra. Pawns depict children playing various instruments, and games consist of activities like a race to see whose orchestra will be the first on stage. The cassette has a story on one side, with side two being sounds of instrument families - you must identify the strings, brasses, woodwinds and percussions. Games are aimed at children Ages 7 - 10
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Memory, Point to Point Movement

name: Barbed Wire Bullets & Bayonets: Fast Play World War I Rules
description: Fast play WW I skirmish rules. Ground scale is 1" = ten feet. Units are generally platoons; larger games involving many platoons may be done. Under ten pages of rules, plus several pages of charts. Information for tanks and artillery is included.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I

name: Bazooka Bait
description:
Fast play WW II rules scaled to actions from company to task force sized. General organizational information provided from platoons to battalions. Written from 15mm-25/28mm scale, but convertible to 5/6 mm if desired.

Less than seven pages of rules, plus some charts with numerous weapons and AFV values differentiated.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: A Journey round the World
description: This early and simple game was made by a company in Bavaria for English-speaking countries.

name: Parasite!
description:
A simple set of aliens-vs-humans skirmish combat rules inspired by films such as "Aliens." Three pages of rules plus diagram of an installations for initial scenario.

Rules for alien encounters, firing, "mortal combat" (melee), wounds, noncombatants, aliens' ability to use captured weapons.

name: Cavalier & Roundhead
description:
Fast-play English Civil War miniatures rules, scaled for 15 - 28mm figures with provision for measurement conversion to 5, 6 or 10mm scales.

Seven pages of rules, two pages of charts. Three types of infantry, three types of cavalry, light and heavy guns differentiated along with five possible troop qualities from Rabble to Arrogant.
categories: Fighting, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Landsknecht & Reiter
description:
Battalion/Regiment scale miniature Renaissance-era wargame, designed for fast play. Eight pages of rules, two pages of charts.

Scaled for 15-28mm miniatures with provision for 5, 6 or 10mm with measurement conversion. Four types of infantry, four types of cavalry, light and heavy guns represented.

name: Super Force Seven
description:
Super Force Seven (SF7) is a Tactical RPG / Miniatures Adventure Wargame allowing for battles between super powered characters of all kinds. The game can be played as a typical tactical miniatures game, but really shines when the options for added depth are used, allowing it to be played more like a light-RPG or a campaign/story driven tactical miniatures game.

Game play is fast paced and simple, and the well thought out design system allows you to easily build your favorite characters from comic books, television, the movies or from your own imagination and lets you pit these characters against each other in a variety of scenarios. These scenarios can range from a simple brawl in the streets to a battle of wits between two masterminds, or anything else you can think of, making this much more than just another game of superhero combat.

As of November 2008, no further information on this game is available, and the homepage is no longer registered. This game may be pure vapor.

name: Kiddi-Golf
description: Kiddi Golf is a 9 hole tabletop miniature golf course in a box. 9 Wooden holes, each featuring different obstacles normally made out of metal. Game has small wooden clubs which are used to try and play each of those holes in as few shots as possible.

name: Xaga: Das Stadtspiel
description:
XAGA- Das Stadtspiel is a creative boardgame. The game begins with a city that wants more color from ideas and strategies. Variety is desired, because instead of quantity the citizens are concerned with the quality of the city. On the city-plan, the players alter buildings, plants and so on, and attempt to bring in inhabitants and guests. However the building alone are not sufficient. A clever and imaginative advertisement is fundamental to winning the game.

In the constant role-change between investor and inhabitant the players together create their own place of fantasy and strategy. Communication is very important! The end the election for the "Citizen of Honor" decides the win. To win the title, one does not only need the votes, but also the "most buildings", the "most beautiful house", the "most disturbing neighbor" and several other categories.
publishers: Landjugendverlag GmbH, Netzwerk-Arbeitsgemeinschaft zur Förderung einer gemeinwesen-orientierten Sozialstruktur Leipzig Süd-Ost e.V.

name: The Gugnunc Game
description: This British WWI era game features the cartoon characters Pip, Squeak & Wilfred who appeared in the Daily Mirror. The board references WWI and players are encouraged to read the Daily Mirror daily to catch the latest adventures of these characters.

name: Pip-Pip!
description: Ahead of its time, this game features a modular board. The players create a track and then race their cars around it.
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Cinemania
description:
In Cinemania you are a movie producer who competes against the other players to release 5 movies of several different genres (Science Fiction, Comedy, Horror, Adventure, and so on), trying to get the best Box Office for each release.
Each movie needs several requisites to be produced, and these are met by the correct playing of various kind of cards (Actor/Actresses, Director, Effect -like Cinematography, Soundtrack, Special Effects, so on - and special cards). You may also play bonus and malus cards to favour your movies and damage the competing productions.
There are also Event cards and the race to the Oscars. Winner is determined over various scores (Best movie in each genre, Oscars won, Total Income, Objective cards, and so on)

The game contains:

261 full color cards for the various decks needed for play
1 individual playing board for each player
Other playing aids


To get the printed DTP version you may ask to pumaye@virgilio.it

Print and play versions are available at wargamedownloads.com and arima.it.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Orville the Octopus
description: Take a dive for sunken treasure and then try to escape the clutches of ORVILLE THE OCTOPUS. The game was made by the Eberhard Faber Company in 1962. Orville is an 8 inch wide metal Octopus with flasher eyes. He balances on a center post in his seascape background. Danny Diver a metallic deep sea diver with a magnet embedded in his feet is suspended on a rubber string connected to a rubber ball. Treasure pieces in the form of gold balls, coins and anchors are scattered on the sea floor. The object is to pick up as much plunder as you can but if you get too close to Orville he spins around and, with a sickening metallic ping sound, he grabs Danny.

name: Bug-House
description: A card game Ages 5 - 12. The first player to build his bug-house wins the game. Game comes with cards, plus enough plastic lots, Chimneys, Hammers, Saws, Trowels, and cardboard walls for 4 players.

name: Starship: The Game of Space Contact
description:
Starship is a fairly elaborate tactical simulation of a contact between two starships, each of which has an mission that is unknown to the other ship.

One player's ship is designated as the "intruder" and the other is the "intercepter" (sic). At the beginning of the game, each player secretly chooses a mission. The possible missions vary depending on the player's role, intruder or intercepter.

The missions include reconnaissance, space exploration, piracy, raid, and patrol (under either a "cold war" status or active hostilities). Each mission provides conditions for a "strategic victory" (such as capturing the other vessel, making peaceful contact, etc.) and orders which, if violated, will prevent the player from gaining a "command victory" (e.g., a player might be ordered to not fire first). Victory points are given for strategic, command, and tactical victories (the latter being based on ship damage), and these are compared to see who won (if anyone, as a possible outcome is that neither player wins).

The game takes place in three-dimensional space, but the hex map is only used to show the relative positions of the ships. Markers placed on the map show a ship's vertical distance above or below the plane. A small map can be used because at the start of each turn the map is effectively rotated to put the Z-axis at the center along the line between the ships.

Players write down and execute their movement and firing orders simultaneously. The main concern in battle is preventing one's systems from overheating, which can occur due to acceleration/deceleration as well as combat.

While the game's envelope gives the publication year as 1976, all the components say 1975. It seems possible the envelope was added to the game after the first copies were produced.
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Three Dimensional Movement, Variable Set-up

name: Starship & Empire
description:
Starship & Empire is a strategic space conflict game with a tactical combat resolution system.

The strategic map consists of 1-4 sectors, each of which is a 10x10 grid with each space having 10 height indicators, thus making each sector a 10x10x10 cube. Star systems are located in various spots on these maps and serve various functions depending on the scenario chosen.

Players write down movement orders for their fleets and execute them simultaneously. When fleets encounter each other, combat is resolved on a large hex map, with players again writing orders, which now include weapons fire as well as movement.

Ships are rated for energy (usage of which must be tracked), rest mass, crew and computer ability, and cargo capacity.

A number of different scenarios are provided, some of which require conquering the other player's systems and some of which have other objectives, such as a pirate vs. merchant scenario.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Paper-and-Pencil, Player Elimination, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Resource to Move, Simultaneous Action Selection, Three Dimensional Movement

name: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp
description: The Life and Legend of Wyatt Earp, the new Western game of adventure for 2 to 4 players is based on the career of the historic U.S. Marshal (as seen on the popular TV program). It's a game of strategy and luck which youngsters Ages 7 - 12 will find absorbing get-together fun. Pursuing outlaws and bandits, capturing them on a "fast draw" and bringing them prison offers the exciting competitive play recommended by child psychologists.
categories: American West, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: "Fun-Full" Thrift Game
description:
The "Fun-Full" Thrift Game is designed to teach good saving principles. It consists of fifteen pairs of cards and one odd card. The cards display text that promotes the value of saving money.
The cards are all dealt to the players. Play consists of drawing a card from the player on the right to match cards in the acting players hands. The player with the odd card left at the end of the game is the loser.

name: See It and Sign It American Sign Language game
description:
From the publisher:

The SEE IT and SIGN IT Game by Bill & Bud, Inc. is an easy-to-follow game that teaches ASL, (American Sign Language,) the fun way! It's 6 games in one, plus a DVD with live action demonstrations. Each of the included 60 word cards shows how to sign a different word, and the Secret Decoder Lenses reveals the hidden word on the back of each card. The game includes 10 two-sided game boards that allow players to with either just 30 words first or all 60 words. Six different games can be played with the cards and game boards. Winner of Dr. Toy Award for ten best socially responsible products.

name: Domiphun
description: Brilliantly designed game presents 3 ways to play. Traditional dominoes, build your own dominoes where players create their tiles each turn, and a 2 dimensional version where players can build up as they go. Includes 56 squares and 16 connector joints.

name: Top-Gun: lotnicza gra wojenna
description: Top-Gun is a game about Jet Air-Combat between NATO/Warsaw Pact Fighters. Game contains a sheet of counters that have to be cut out, a map with squares (instead of hexes) and several data sheets about specific aircraft. Also included are about 10 small pages of rules and 3 dice.

name: Double Event
description:
A horse riding game for up to six players based on 3 Day eventing, Dressage & Cross Country.

The Dressage phase of the game is played with 2 dice - one denoting how many squares the competitor should move & the other the results of that move.

The Dressage & Cross Country phases in Double Event can be played as independent games or the scores combined for a Double Event.

From the creators of International Jump Off.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Tenacety
description:
Tenacety is an extremely entertaining card game suitable for the whole family. It is played on a peg board & utilizes only the 10's, Jacks, Queens, Kings & Aces of a pack of cards - hence the name Ten-ace-ty !

The game ends when one player has managed to remove all 5 of his pegs from the pegboard having won tricks containing those cards he had originally pegged.

Great family card game, simple to learn & play !

Contents

1 x Playing board
20 x Playing cards (10's, Jacks, Queens, Kings & Aces)
20 x Pegs in 4 colours
Rules on reverse of box

name: Crackernomics
description:
This is an educational Ages 8 and up game designed to teach business concepts like: global markets, return on investment, fixed-cost ratios, etc. as well as teaching skills like math, geography, negotiation, trading and communication.
Each player assumes the role of Will Trader, an enterprising duck who aspires to build his Cracker Mills all over the world. Players compete by developing businesses, making investments, and other similar actions while circling the gameboard.

name: Pyramid Scheme: Legend of the Pharaohs
description: This is an abstract strategy game which utilizes a theme of ancient Egypt. Pyramid Scheme: Legend of the Pharaohs can be played by 2 or 3 alternating players or teams of players. Each begins the game with a Base Pyramid comprised of 9 pieces (8 Soldiers and 1 Guardian). Each player's objective is to capture the playing pieces and ultimately, raid and capture the Treasure Chamber within the Base Pyramid of the opponents.

name: Xemorpheum
description:
From the publisher:
