Xemorpheum (pronounced Zemorpheum) was specifically designed to teach Third World business concepts to students and business people. The game models a Third World Business environment in an ancient coliseum setting in a far off country called Richmania."

Xemorpheum is played by two to seven players who compete against each other by rolling dice, moving around a coliseum track, drawing cards and paying crossing fees to other players or to the treasury. Players increase their chance of winning by amassing cash, building factories and training arenas, and assembling armies. To win, one player must avoid sudden death bankruptcy and gather more wealth and power than other players while surviving the myriad of hazards, traps and pitfalls inherent in the game's unique playing environment."

name: Disney's 102 Dalmatians Spot Me
description: Loosely themed on the Walt Disney Movie "102 Dalmations," this is a children's game where the players compete to be the first to get rid of their "spots" by placing them on Oddball the dog. Rolling the oversized plastic dice tells how many spots to affix dog-side. If you roll Cruella on the dice, however, then Oddball or another player gives up some spots to you. Ages 4 and up.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Round the Coast
description:
Subtitled: A Race round Britain. Amusing, Thrilling, and Instructive
This is a very simple race game designed to help people learn the geography of coastal England, Scotland, and Ireland. Think of it as Snakes and Ladders in a circle. Players roll, move, and could hit an obstacle or movement bonus depending on their move.

name: Bullets & Ballots: A Learning Game on Central America
description:
This game is designed to give its players first-hand experience with the problems confronting the countries of Central America and with difficult U.S. policy choices in the region. Between 20 and 40 players (this is obviously a classroom game) participate in a simulation of real-world political struggles and conflicts that will raise fundamental issues about Central America and the role of the US in the region.

The game consists of four 15-minute periods of activity followed by a debriefing and policy discussion. Players are divided into five teams: the Guatemalan Government, the Army/Wealthy Class, the Guerrillas, the Peasants/Workers, and the US Government. An initial 15-minute Strategy Session within each team is followed by three 15-minute months of an electoral campaign involving discussions and negotiations among the teams.

Each team presents a brief Position Statement to start the action. Over the course of the campaign, each team may use means ranging from moral persuasion to military force in pursuit of its goals. The Army/Wealthy Class and the Guerrillas may opt to launch offensives. The Army can take over at any time, and they also have the option to "silence" members of any of the other Guatemalan teams. At the end, the team in power has the option of holding an election. All Guatemalans except silenced members and guerrillas are eligible to vote. Peasants/Workers have two votes; others have one. Guerrillas may vote by joining the Peasants.
publishers: Roosevelt Center for American Policy Studies

name: Atom Smash
description: Command the forces of the atomic world as you battle the strength of your opponent's elements and compounds. Use the properties of chemical reactions to build strategies and defeat your foe.

name: Das Sandmännchen-Spiel
description:
This German game is for Ages 4 and up. The players must move around the board trying to finish the tasks they need to do before going to bed.
predecessor of: 'Das Gute-Nacht-Spiel' http://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/110492/das-gute-nacht-spi...
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Nursery Rhymes Mix-Ups
description: Each card has one word from a well-known nursery rhyme. The object is to collect sets of three cards that complete one phrase from a nursery rhyme, e.g., "Little Miss Muffett, "Jack and Jill," "Hickory Dickory Dock," etc. The first player to complete three sets of three wins.

name: Sandtrap Golf
description:
Sandtrap Golf is a new fun interactive game.

The game has 54 golf ball playing cards in a handy round tin that easily stores in your bag.

The cards have all the shots in the game including hole in ones, double eagles, birdies, bogies, snowmen, lost balls and of course, mulligans .

The object of the game is to turn over your playing cards first, with the lowest score while forcing your opponents to keep as many face down cards as possible.

The rules are simple and easy to learn.
Best played with 2 to 4 players.

Play 9 or 18 holes anytime, anywhere with anyone.

name: The Favorite
description:
Subtitled: The New Mechanical Race Game
This is a children's version of the many mechanical horse racing games popular for the last 200 years. This one was manufactured in England by Glevum Games. The game involves pulling the horses in a jerky action to propel them forward. The horses are mounted on flat metal stand that are attached by metal clips to the table. Instructions are printed in the lid.

Because it's a children's version, it doesn't include the wagering common in most games of this type.

name: Fanchise
description:
Players divide themselves into two teams. Each team begins with $500,000, 5000 fans, and a set of playing pieces. They decide which team will be the home team and the game begins. The standard rules of baseball apply.

Both teams ante $50,000 every inning. The ante increases by $25,000 every three innings. The team that scores more runs in the inning will win this pot. The pot rolls over if both teams score an equal number of runs.

Before the result of an at bat is rolled, the defensive team may move its playing pieces on the gameboard to indicate its defensive position. The offensive player rolls the icosikaidihedron, a 22-sided die, to determine the result of the at bat. If a base runner is in the first, second or ninth batting position then the offensive player may try for a stolen base. The game gives the offensive player a fifty-fifty chance of success for a stolen base.

Certain events will allow either team to move its token along the Franchise gameboard. Fans are won and lost here.

The game is over when the baseball game is complete. All fans won by the teams are worth $10 each. The team with more money has won.

name: Lucky Star Gumball Game
description: This game is made up of a large dome ( 10" diameter) shaped like a Gumball Machine. First you fill the outer part of dome with gum balls, then you insert a penny - which puts one of the gumballs into play. You then use all the skill you can to maneuver the gumball to the center hole- if you get it there.. it delivers the gum ball down the chute to you! The TV commercial jingle that was featured in the advertising for this game said : "You pay, you play, you chew away, and save pennies everyday".

name: Tom Dick & Harry
description: A very cheap version but with the same idea as Jaques’ Ascot. The game consists of a box that houses five card horses and riders: Tom, Dick and Harry – Gert and Daisy as well. The horses are attached to a spindle by cord that winds around the spindle when turned. The horses are set up on the table, the handle turned, and the horses approach the winning post. The speed of the horses depends on the way the cord winds, giving the chance of a different winner each time. The game components are all cardboard or cord

name: El Morocco
description: El Morocco is based on the movie Casablanca. The object of the game is to be the first player to accumulate $500,000. You can make money to win in many different ways, but the best way is to gamble in one of the four different casinos. You can also get money by scheming and intrigue. Outwit blackmailers, thieves and spies. But beware of ending up on Devil’s Island.

name: Fact Finder Fun
description:
Fact Finder Fun (Pinball Game)

Cards are slotted into plastic tray front. Pinballs are loaded inside . Pull the trigger releasing a ball and now look where it is falling and insert the pencil (we have added an alternative as pencil was missing)into the correct answer hole. If you get it right the ball will fall into scoring tray if not it will fall into the discard tray at back.

Take turns
Does anyone know where I can purchase one of these games today I used to love this game as a child ??
publishers: Editrice Giochi, John Sands Pty Ltd, Milton Bradley, Nathan, World Games Company

name: Showjumping
description:
TO START THE GAME
Showjumping game is kept as close to showjumping rules as possible.

All players start with No Points. Penalty points are given for every fault the player acquires when proceeding around the circuit.

To start the game it will require a player to take score of the penalty points against each player on a sheet of paper. Put down the name of the player and every time the players' horse acquires a fault, put down the penalty points given against the player. All players will throw the dice. the player with the lowest roll will start the game.

PENALTY POINTS
Are given against the player as follows:
a. Knock-downs - 4 points against
b. Refusals - 2 points plus the player moves three spaces backwards.
There are SPECIAL HALTS, BONUS POINTS

TO FINISH
All players must roll the correct number to finish.
The player with the least number of penalty points will be the winner.

name: Ivan the Great: The Rise of Muscovy 1462-1505
description:
HISTORY: Ivan III the Great came to the throne of Muscovy as its Grand Prince on the death of his father Vasily (Basil) II in 1462. Through his cunning diplomacy and well-timed military actions he was responsible over the next 43 years for expanding the state of Muscovy enormously, conquering, annexing, or marrying into the lands of Rostov, Yaroslavl, Ryazan, Novgorod, Vyatka, Tver, and a substantial piece of Lithuania, while forming sturdy alliances with Pskov, the Crimean Tatars, Kazan, and Denmark, and at the same time having to deal with religious controversies and the periodic treacheries of various boyars and even of his own family. His son Vasily III and grandson Ivan IV (the Terrible) extended his remarkable gains even further. Essentially, Ivan single-handedly created what we now know as the Russian nation.

During most of his reign, his most powerful rival was Casimir IV, Grand Prince of Lithuania, although, despite much peripheral conflict, Muscovy and Lithuania did not go to all-out war until 1500, some eight years after Casimir’s death.

OBJECT OF THE GAME: In brief, Muscovy is trying to gain control of or subdue as many countries as possible before the big war with Lithuania, while maintaining high levels on the Ivan's Prestige, Russian Orthodox Church, and Victory Point charts. Some of these countries will become full allies, others will just be reduced so as not to cause serious trouble in Ivan’s rear later on. Once the war with Lithuania begins, Muscovy will try to take over as much territory from Lithuania as he can. (Military success may possibly make up for any shortfalls in the three charts.) The Lithuanian player is simply trying to throw as many monkey wrenches as he can into Muscovy’s plans by keeping up pressure on various fronts, military and geographical (the map) as well as political (the charts).

There is a 22-turn campaign game, and there are five shorter scenarios.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Point to Point Movement

name: DEMO
description:
Two educational games in one package. The games are aimed for junior and senior high schools and aim to raise pupils' awareness on how politics and various authorities function.

DEMO-logia is a trivia game, with topics ranging from local politics to EU. Points are awarded for correct answers.

DEMO-idea makes the players choose ideologies and answer questions from the viewpoint of that ideology. Points are awarded after debating whether the answer was in line with the chosen ideals.

The game is published by The Association of Finnish Local and Regional Authorities (Kuntaliitto) while the game idea, design and development come from Skrivarstugan AB, and manufactured at Nelostuote Oy. Available in Finnish and Swedish language versions.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement, Voting

name: Trolley
description:
The rules give three games that can be played with this deck: "Trolley," "Transfer," and "Matchem."

"Trolley" involves trick-taking to accumulate point-scoring sets.

"Transfer" is a game of passing cards to opponents until one player has a hand consisting of six identical cards.

"Matchem" not surprisingly, is matching cards in hand with face-up cards on the table.

The deck consists of ten each of "Car," "Conductor," "Motorman," "Passenger," "Fare," and "Transfer" cards, for a total of 60 cards.

Note that Shackman and Merrimack issued reproductions (for both the games Trolley and Trains) that were made in Hong Kong and have a post 1963 zip code.
publishers: B. Shackman & Co., Inc., Snyder Bros.

name: Game of Cinderella
description: A very simple children's game, simply role and move with an exact roll needed to win and become the princess. If the shoe fits, wear it.

name: Over the Garden Wall
description: Goal is to grow plants (with plant cards), there also are past cards. The game includes cardboard insert "garden" playing area and a direction sheet.

name: Say It On Me
description:
The party game for people who like to laugh & giggle !

Have some hands on conversation with your friends !

Convey secret words by finger writing clues on your partners body !

Contents

1 x Scorepad

1 x Die

52 x Cards

1 x Timer

1 x Shroud of secrecy

1 x Rules
categories: Action / Dexterity, Party Game, Word Game

name: Market Mania
description:
Board game that lets you play the market for big profit. Build you're investments cautiously or trade you're way to quick gains. Watch you're cash levels, you don't want to go bankrupt!

Be prepared to face some serious ups and downs on you're way to prosperity. The most sensible strategy may win but so might the craziest.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Radio Guidage
description: Each player controls a car that's a car. Players try to guide their cars on the track using the radio station 'Radio Route' that transmits information about weather and track conditions using three different wavelengths. Then there still is the police helicopter that could stop one of the player's cars. The goal of the game is to reach the finish by using the best Radio Guidage.

name: Golf! The Fairways
description: Game of Golf that uses a "golf bag": a confined plastic shooter with two spaces: one for Driver and putter and the second one for fairway shots. The game is played on a giant mapboard that illustrate an 18 holes course complete with hazards and greens all divided onto spaces and dots. You use the shooter to try and obtain the result of a shot you want and you move your golf ball around the course.

name: Hillbillies Hoedown Game
description: Player's spin a spinner and move along a track. Along the way they collect "Hoedown Coupons". Player who collect the most coupons at the end wins.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Rainbow Game
description: A children's game where the players spin a spinner and be the first to collect the gold off of their player card. Ages 4 - 8 listed on the box.

name: Groot Superhelden Bordspel Boek
description:
This is a collector's item of Marvel Comics with 6 games, an electronic dice and colored fiches. Press the button and the numbers will light up.
Board: 60x40 cm

The book has 6 games:

- Spiderman
- De X-mannen
- Wolverine
- Fantastic Four
- De Vergelders
- The Incredible Hulk
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Game of '76
description: Trick taking partnership game for 2,4 or 6 players. Half the deck are "American" cards with either Eagle or Liberty Bell symbols. The half are "English" with either a Lion or a Crown symbol. The highest cards are the King George and George Washington cards.

name: Alphabet Game
description:
The game uses color coded letter tiles, each letter is a different color.

In the game play all players try and add letter parts to the table that help form a valid word.

The first player to get rid of all their tiles wins.

There are also several other variations of the Alphabet game, from spelling words out to types of spelling "relays".
publishers: F. P. Schmitthenner, Lakeshore Learning Materials

name: Avilude
description:
"Avilude: or game of birds"

Players attempt to collect sets of Birds from the deck of 64 cards. The deck contains 64 cards, divided in 8 groups. Each group contains 4 bird cards showing pictures of birds and 4 corresponding description cards. Several game variations are presented in the 8 page rules booklet.

The 8 groups include: wading, pigeon tribe, honey eaters, web-footed, birds of prey, running birds, and singing birds.
publishers: McLoughlin Brothers, Noyes & Snow, West & Lee Game Company

name: Game of Baa Baa Black Sheep
description:
In this Sheep themed game that is similar to the card game Casino, players attempt to collect pairs of matching cards.

Each card, in addition to the illustration on it, has a letter that shows which cards they form pairs with.

name: Belmont Park Horse Racing Game
description: Dice based horse racing game that features pari-mutual style betting pools. Any number of players may play. Dice are rolled and the horses are moved up one space for each time that their number appears on the dice. A Colored multiplier die is rolled with the regular die and each horse whose number appears on the white dice is moved ahead as many places as appears on the colored die.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Big Apple
description: Players spin a large spinner all collect the points shown. When a player has collected 100 points they get an tile with a piece of the apple on it. The first player to complete an apple wins. A pure luck game.

name: Talk and Take
description:
A 2 player game where players move pieces across a game board by following instructions on cards.

Game includes instructions, a checkered board, 32 wooden playing pieces, and 65 instruction cards.

name: Bahn-Radrennen
description: A cute Eastern German track cycling game. It features a 60 field track, six riders, two wooden dice, and the rules to play 6 different races: Sprint, Elimination, Pursuit, a 10 lap race, point race & the 6 days race.

name: Radfahrerspiel
description: Radfahrerspiel is a cycling bases race game produced in East Germany in 1955. It has simple roll & moves mechanics and the goal is to reach the finish first by completing a track as soon as possible. On that track the players also have to pass a railway crossover. Three cars have to be moved, too, and can be used to block other players.

name: Baraka!
description:
From the rules:

"These rules were made to give players a simple set of rules for quick-play conventions games, giving a general feel for the period. The French campaigns in Algeria, Morocco and the Sahara were hard-fought affairs and lasted many decades. Reflecting that reality, these are no “form square and bash the natives” kind of rules: the peoples of North Africa had a warrior tradition going back to the time of the Romans. The Arabs, Berbers, and Tuareg were fierce warriors to be reckoned with and respected for their skill and courage. These rules are meant to capture some of that spirit."

name: Glossotechnia
description:
Glossotechnia is a card game in which the players collaboratively create a new language, and attempt to translate certain challenge sentences into this game-language. It combines competitive and cooperative elements, and can be used in teaching certain concepts in linguistics.

http://conlangs.berkeley.edu/glossotechnia_rules.html

name: Lost in the Woods
description: A simple and extremely rare roll-and-move children's game in which the point is to get out of the woods. The cover features a girl in a red riding hood.

name: Maze Mania
description:
This game is much like Run Yourself Ragged/Snafu. This one requires batteries.

Instructions- Place a silver ball into the area in the upper left marked 'start'. Turn the auto timer clockwise to the start position and off you go.
A - Go around twirling posts
B - Through the first orange gate
C - Onto the topsy turvy steps, to the top, then down the other side
D - Through the next gate
E - Fing you way through the 'blind alley'
F - And through the treacherous tunnel
G - Open the last pair of closed gates
H - Under the arch
I - Into the 'whirling well' and out the end of the maze

name: Tour Golf
description:
From the instructions:

"The purpose of this game is for enjoyment, self-improvement, and fundamental education of golfing rules and regulations. TOUR GOLF(TM) is designed to be played as you would normally play a game of golf. The winner is the player who has the lowest total strokes at the completion of 18 holes of golf."

The game includes the following:
2 white d6 with pips
1 white sand wedge d6 numbered 1,2,2,3,3,4
1 green putting d6 numbered 1,2,2,2,2,3
4 golf tees for use as pawns
1 22"x28" board
1 pad containing rules and scorecards

The game box offers to let you "play the famous golf courses you've always dreamed of playing--in your home!" and promises that "other golf courses will be available in the future."

name: Die Friedensfahrt
description: Die Friedensfahrt (aka "Course de la Paix") was the most important cycling race behind the iron curtain. It started in 1948 (and is still running: in 2006 it was the 58th edition, though the importance of the race is much lesser, and it is not run by national teams anymore). Of course, the race needed a companion board game! The game can be played with a maximum of 6 players and features twelve cards with portraits of the winners of the first 12 editions of the race and the name of the 12 stages. First card features two riders since the first edition of the Friedensfahrt was split in two legs, so there were two winners. The board shows a track from Prague via Warszawa to Berlin. He who scores best over all the stages wins the game.

name: Tour Feminin
description: French cycling game appeared at the end of the '80s. What makes it special is that it is about female cycling. It's played with 2 dice, tactic cards, mountain cards, sprint cards and rouleur cards. Each players controls 2 cyclists. The player who scores best in the overall classification wins the Tour Féminin.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Round the World
description:
This is a beautiful old spin-and-move racing game from Milton Bradley that was first published in 1873, clearly to latch on to the fame of Jules Verne's novel Around the World in 80 Days, published in the same year. Unlike the voyage of Phineas Fogg, the game's track is strictly by sea.

Both the game equipment and rules are more complex than usual for a Victorian spin-and-move. The key difference is that winning does not mean who completing the 93-space spiral track the fastest, but doing so in the fewest days. In addition to spaces that move players forward and back, many of them apply time penalties. Each player has a card that tracks the number of days taken - one per pip on the five-space teetotum and one more for each penalty day. With absolutely perfect spins, it is possible to complete the journey in just 76 days, but this is highly unlikely!

Each player card has one metal arrow on dial that counts up to 50 days, and another on a smaller quarter-circle dial that tracks multiples of 50 to a pessimistic maximum of 450. On the back of each card is a "Record Tablet" with a space for the days taken for each stage from New York to: Equator, Rio de Janeiro, Cape Horn, Equator, San Francisco, Sandwich Islands, Hong Kong, Anjer, Mauritius, Cape of Good Hope, St. Helena, Equator and back to New York. The 1873 edition includes a global map showing the voyage track that is formed into a sleeve wrapped around the player cards.

name: Historical Amusement
description:
The cardgame consists of a booklet with 100 questions and answers, 36 cards showing monarchs and 100 small cards with answers.
Any number of persons may play at this game in the following manner: a President must be appointed, who is to see if the questions are correctly answered: the president distributes about six or eight counters to each player, the remainder to be left in the box, which will serve for a pool. He then deals the answers round, an equal number to each player; after this is done, he shuffles the pack of Heads, and placing the whole pack face downwards on the table, desires one of the players to take the uppermost and read aloud the name of the king, when he was born, died, etc. The president then asks the question from this little book, connected with the card turned up and whoever plays the proper answer, receives one counter from the pool; but if the answer is wrong, one counter must be paid to the pool. The next player then takes a Head and the same rule must be observed till all of them are read. When a player has forfeited all his counters, his remaining cards must be given to the player on his right hand. Should the pool become empty, each player must contribute one counter.

The game is decided in two ways, either by all but one player having forfeited their counters, or by all the heads having been turned up, in which case the remaining players are to reckon their counters, and he who has the greatest number wins the game. The winner takes the contents of the pool, and claims the office of president in the next game.

name: Game of the Gamut
description: THE GAME OF THE GAMUT a Musical Gift for the Young - By John Betts, 115 Strand, London (his address 1845 - 1874) - The game consists of a wooden box with sliding lid containing thirty-six playing cards each showing a music book with chord on it and trumpet with number to top. One player calls out a number and the person holding the card - replies with the word spelled out by bass and treble notes - A good way of teaching children to read music - counters are won or lost depending on the outcome. The game is dated by the Jigsaws advertised inside the lid which seem to have been produced c1845 (ref Linda Hannas) as Betts himself dated very few items.

name: Spin-oli
description:
From the patent description:
"A multiple player word forming game is disclosed. The game uses a board, a cup and a plurality of cards. The cards are randomly transferred to and from the players. The players use the cards to form words. In the best mode, a game board defines a flat surface bounded by a peripheral wall upon which the cup freely travels about. A player begins a turn by spinning the cup, which eventually lands upon a card transfer space. The card transfer space dictates whether the player either draws or passes cards. The player transfers cards either from the deck or to a discard pile or to or from another player during a turn. Then the player attempts to spell a word by selecting cards in his hand and laying them face-up in front of him. Opponents may challenge the player's word. Any player who transfers all of his cards during a set becomes empty-handed and may not challenge words. The number of points earned by each player is dependent upon their performance both in forming words and in manipulating the number of cards in their hand. Preferably, a chance card multiplies the number of points a player can get. The set ending player's total score is doubled if the player ended the set with the chance card. Other player's scores are multiplied by zero if they held the chance card when an opponent ended the set."

In English, players use a cup shaped spinner that will move around the 5x5 board to determine card movement between the players. Players have to build words from their available cards and score points displayed on the cards.

name: Critérium Record
description: Simple role & move cycling games published in Belgium in the 1950's. The 43x34cm. board shows a track with some obstacles on several squares. The first to reach the finish with his pawn wins.

name: Mit Knorr Peterli auf zur Tour de Suisse
description: Promotional cycling game released in the '50s by Knorr about the Tour of Switzerland.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Murder Mystery Party: Murder in Transylvania
description:
Who killed Sonya Right?

Welcome to Castle Gladjorhere, home of the world’s one and only Transvampire with a soul! Visitors from all walks of life have come to witness the thrills and chills of this genuine Transylvanian house of horror, all of which will be revealed by the resident tour guide Sonya Right. But shortly after dinner Sonya is found in her room with two small puncture wounds in her neck. Host your own party to find out who sucked the life out of her!

The suspects :
COUNT GLADJORHERE – Tranvestite Vampire (he’ll bite and excite!)
SHEILA SUCKLE – Countess Gladjorhere (she drinks every last drop!)
HUMP ZEALOT – The Count’s manservant (he’s always on the job!)
ELLIE GANTT – International catwalk model (she’s purr-fect!)
MR FRANKNBEANZ – The Count’s chef (don’t ask for his secret ingredients!)
BRIDE OF FRANKNBEANZ – His wife (she’s always in stitches!)
PROFESSOR GRAF ENBERG – Academic (his theories always hit the spot!)
HEIDI SEEK – Local journalist (she’s always exposing things!)

Contents :
DVD with 4 scenes, background music CD, invitations, host instructions, character profiles for the 8 suspects, costume suggestions, menu suggestions, clues, name tages, solution to the murder.

name: You Name It!
description:
From the box:

You Name It! the thrilling new board game that's the life of the party from Hollywood, California to Moose Jaw, Saskatchewan. The fun springs from the players' inventiveness in concocting their own imaginative clues. There's no limit to the number of players or the amount of fun that can be had playing this exciting game.

You Name It! is a team game where players take turns guessing and calling out clues to identities of famous people in five categories: History, Screen, Music, Arts & Literature, and Sports. Teams take sixty second turns guessing as many names as they can. The names are both up-to-the minute and old as time itself. Clues may include descriptions of the person, their accomplishments who they married, who they killed, etc. - or a syllable by syllable breakdown of the name itself.

If you're looking for an exciting fun-filled evening with a group of friends: You Name It!, we've got it!

name: Game of the Spider's Web
description: Simple children's roll-and-move game. Think Snakes and Ladders only spiraling outward trying to avoid the spiders while escaping the web.

name: Reconquista
description: Reconquista is a wargame recounting the fighting in Spain circa 1050-1450. Players build up Armies and conquer provinces on a map of the Iberian Peninsula from each other. Players have standard unit counter sets. The game uses an Event deck and Battle Deck. Battles are resolved using a combination of dice work and card play. Raiding rules and events give a feel for the period.

name: Vuelta Ciclista: el Juego con Kelme
description:
Beautiful Spanish game released at the end of the '90s and endorsed by the Kelme cycling team. The game has three different levels of play, including one in which you manage your team buying riders according to your budget.

The game has three gorgeous boards in which you can play the Vuelta, Giro or Tour. Each of these races consists of three stages plus a time trial. (Except for the basic level, in which you use dice, the time trial consists of Trivial Pursuit-like questions.)

Each team consists of three cyclists (a leader, a climber and a rouleur) and this game has everything a cycling game should have (mountains, intermediate sprints, drawing from other riders; this one also has falls, punctures, exhaustions... even an antidoping test).

name: Velodromo
description: Rare Italian track cycling game published in the 1930's. The game included eight over sized cardboard cyclists and a board with an oval track on it.

name: Vélo-Flash
description:
French vintage cycling game published in the '50s. It is about 2 famous classic cycling races: Paris-Roubaix and Paris-Tours. The game consists of two parts. The first part is played on the green part of the board, and it is a dice game. The sprint of the race is played on the velodrome (blue) part of the board and uses the aleatory record.

An aleatory record (also known as "multitrack record", "magic record" or "puzzle record") is one that has some separate tracks cut in exact step with each other, so that upon lowering the needle the track is selected at random. On the game's record, the beginning of the narration is the same in all tracks, and just the result of the sprint changes. Each side has 10 different tracks with every cyclist having its chance to win, naturally. Every time you play the record you get a different result, so you'd better listen carefully who won the race!

name: Land's End to John O'Groats
description:
Vintage simple British cycling game released in the mid to late 30's and named after the longest possible trajectory in Great Britain. The game is a race from the bottom of England to the top of the mainland of Scotland with progress made by the roll of a dice. Players have to abide by the instructions on the board which may aid or hinder progress.

The game is based on the Lands End to John O'Groats cycling competition which is not strictly a race but a time trial competition. The cyclist pictured on the game box is Sir Hubert Opperman (known as Oppy), considered as one of Australia greatest sporting heros in the 1920's and 30's. In 1934 is set a new record from Lands End to John O'Groats cutting more than 4 hours of the previous time.

At least 2 versions of the game box exist with a smaller rectangular box and a larger more square box. Both versions have the same game board layout and rules and a photo of Hubert Opperman on the game box, although the photos differ.

name: Tour de Duck
description: Themed Cycling game (Donald Duck theme) released by a company from Berlin in 1998. Basically it's a simple roll & move game with card board riders.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing, Sports

name: The Fraggle Trap Game
description:
The Fraggle Trap Game is based on the characters from Fraggle Rock, a children's television series from the 1980's. The series was created by Jim Henson, primarily featuring a cast of Muppet creatures called Fraggles.
Fraggles are always hungry - the object of the game is to feed your Fraggles with as many radishes as possible by collecting them from the Gorg's radish patch & bringing them to your corner.

An entirely different game from MB's 'Fraggle Rock'.

Fantastic memories !!!

Dance your cares away,
Worry's for another day.
Let the music play,
Down at Fraggle Rock !

Work your cares away,
Dancing's for another day.
Let the Fraggles play,
We're Gobo, Mokey, Wembley, Boober, Red.

Dance your cares away,
Worry's for another day.
Let the music play,
Down at Fraggle Rock !
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Bachelorette Party Game
description:
From the publisher: "It’s the bride’s last chance to play before the fateful day and there’s no better way to kick off her special party than The Bachelorette Party Game, the ultimate party game for wild women only. But beware! This game contains some very personal questions that are guaranteed to reveal everything you never wanted to know about your best girlfriends… and yourself."

Players roll and move around a board and answer personal questions which are very adult in nature. Includes specially shaped game board, Game booklet with over 150 questions, pawns, die, and 54 "Beefcake" cards.

name: The Game of Psych-Out
description: The Game of Psych-Out is a personality/psychological themed party game. Players answer a series of questions designed to evoke revealing information about their personalities and then try to guess which other players provided the answers to the questions.

name: Gimme A Ruling
description:
Gimme A Ruling is a golf-themed sports trivia/question and answer game that focuses on the rules of golf. The game contains 550 questions that present actual on-the-course situations and challenges the players to provide the correct ruling. (The situations, questions and rulings presented on the game cards are taken directly from the book, Decisions on the Rules of Golf, as published by the USGA together with the Royal and Ancient of St. Andrews, Scotland.) The winner of the game is the player with the lowest score after 18 holes/questions.

Game includes: 550 question/answer cards, 3 20-sided dice: 1 Category, 1 Birdie, 1 Bogey, 2 official score pads, and 2 golf pencils

name: Presidents I Card Game
description:
60-card deck featuring the outstanding achievements and brief biographical history of each President of the United States from Washington to Pierce.

The object of the game is to obtain complete books (set of 4 presidents) by calling for cards from other players. When a player gets a complete book of 4, he lays it aside; when all the cards have been gathered into books, the game is over and the player with the most books wins.

name: The Sociable Telephone
description: A game designed to teach proper social interaction, players connected by a "phone" pose questions that are answered by phrases on the game cards.

name: What's His Name?
description: An early trivia game, each card has questions about three men who share the first letter of their last names. For instance one card has questions on Shakespeare, Stanley, and Scott. Typical question: R-A famous Dutch artist born 1607, died 1669. Answer: Rembrandt. (You knew that, right?)

name: Chamber
description:
A game done by Ravensburger as a merchandising game for the Handelskammer Hamburg. Ages 12 and up
Consists of
1 board
200 cards
200 stocks
315 playing money
1 die
some wooden game pieces
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Stock Holding

name: Concentra Spiel
description:
This game war released approx. in the mid 1960s by Verlag Hoppenstedt from Darmstadt/Germany as a merchandising game for the Dresder Bank AG. The name Concentra is the name of a big German investment fund and the game leads players to learn about investing and divesting with stocks.

Up to 8 players move around the board three times. The player with the most money wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. In the first round, if a player gets on a green space, he gets the corresponding bond. At the roll of a 6 he gets a Concentra-Fund unit. In the second and third round, a player who gets on a green space has to pay the owner of the corresponding bond and a dividend for the Concentra-Fund. At the end of the game the dividend is divided among the fund owners.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Hand of Fate Fortune Telling Game
description: A simple trivia game with three kinds of questions: identify the picture, put a series of related historic events in chronological order, and true or false. The "hand of fate" is the spinner that points to a question on the board. The game does not actually seem to have any relation to fortune telling.

name: Operations Room
description: A very easy game about the Battle of Britain, included in the central pages of "The Battle of Britain Project Book" printed for the Royal Air Force Museum in the 50th anniversary of the event. On a squared map representing Northern France, the Channel and Southern England, the German player moves 10 bombers and 15 fighters against the 25 fighters of the RAF. Aim of the German is to destroy all the 11 British airfields and then do a successful raid against London.
categories: Book, Educational, Wargame, World War II

name: New Game of Familiar Quotations from Popular Authors
description: Similar to the game Authors, each card features 5 quotations from a single author. Quotations are read until someone guesses the author correctly.

name: Gems of Art
description: This game features many pieces of great art, which can be used to play 5 different games. In reality, it's like playing authors with art.

name: Yankee Doodle: A Game of American History
description: Typical roll-and-move Q&A game, questions range from the Boston Tea Party of 1773 to the World's Columbian Exposition aka The White City in 1893.

name: BattleBox: American Civil War
description:
Like all the Battle Box series, the American Civil War is an entry level game designed to bridge the gap between board gaming and miniature gaming for the young general in training.

The game comes with a game board, 20 detailed playing figures, dice, one page rules, and turn track/marker. It is a straight forward game with simple mechanics that allow quick and amusing play anywhere anytime.
categories: Abstract Strategy, American Civil War, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Phase Order

name: The New Pilgrim's Progress
description: Based on the book by John Bunyan, players move through life dodging sins and other dangers, like the Castle of Giant Despair, while trying to make it across the River of Death to the Celestial City.

name: Peter Peter Pumpkin Eater
description: A very simple roll-and-move children's game in which the the object is to move through a maze to the pumpkin.

name: Jack the Giant Killer
description: Looks almost the same as McLoughlin Brothers' Little Red Riding Hood that came out the same year. A roll-and-move game in which Jack must overcome 7 obstacles to win.

name: Little Red Riding Hood
description: Little Red Riding Hood dodges the wolf as she makes her way through the forest.

name: Little Goldenlocks and the Three Bears: A Pleasing Game
description: A simple roll-and-move children's game, with chances for advancement and pitfalls like Snakes & Ladders.

name: King of Cash
description:
The King of Cash is the first player to buy the "big six" assets: house, car, boat, furniture, audio visual equipment and clothing.

To generate the money to buy the "big six", players buy, run and sell companies. If another player lands on your company, they pay you for purchases.

There are 12 different industries with three companies in each industry. The more companies you own, the more money you make. Build factory outlets and coin maximum cash.

Try your luck and win cash by playing "rawlette", "play & win" and "dice & win".

The game's playing cards, "gatvol" ("fed-up") and "lekker" ("nice"), provide players the opportunity to lose or earn money based on typical South African occurrences.

name: Our Town Sparkles / Social Responsibility Game
description:
These are a couple of games, made in Singapore, which come together in the same box. The objectives of these two games are to inculcate good social behaviors and habits.

The eponymous Our Town Sparkles is a simple roll and move boardgame. The first player to get to the end of the track by exact count wins. The Social Responsibility Game has a circular track (in the sense that you go round and round the track) and players follow instructions on the board where their pieces land. There are Social Responsibility Quotient (SRQ) cards worth up to 20 SRQ points. Players can also earn and lose money depending on their social behavior. There are red penalty cards, drawn when a player lands on a 'Penalty Square', and green cards that a player picks up after landing on a 'Good Social Habit Square'. The game ends when a player runs out of money, or there are no more SRQ point cards. The player with the most SRQ points wins. A curious feature of the game is the role of Social Responsibility Judege (SRJ) - the SRJ administers all penalties, rewards or awards.

Graphics and illustrations by Rolling Art Pte Ltd.
The year of publication is based on a discount coupon (for Popular Bookstore) that came with the game and was valid only till October 2005.

A version of this game, called Tampines Our Pride, combining the Social Responsibility Game and Tampines Our Pride Game (a roll-and-move game, like the Our Town Sparkles Game) was created for the Tampines Town Council. The differences are in the roll-and-move game (different track and events) and the Social Responsibility Game has some slightly different artwork - for example, there's a picture of the Tampines Changkat Community Club on the board. The board itself is made from cardboard and not as thick as the mounted board used in Our Town Sparkles.

name: Target for Today
description:
From the Manufacturer:

It’s 1943, and the only way for the Allies to carry the war to the Germans is from the air. But strategic bombing is an experiment; can they succeed where no one else has, or will the Luftwaffe’s air defenses cause the USAAF to fail, as every other bombing campaign to date has?

This decision-rich, tense Print N’ Play game puts you in charge of either the US bombing campaign or the aerial defense of the Reich. Not only do you have to select and achieve your military objectives; you also must maintain enough support for your campaign to keep resources flowing to you. Will you support ground offensives? Build currently available aircraft or invest in technology? Order your fighters to stick close to the bombers or sweep the sky for interceptors? Attack immediately with what’s in the air, or combine your fighter groups? Defend each target as it’s attacked or wait and launch a huge strike against one raid? The decisions are all yours.

This is a different game than Target for Today

name: Bulls and Bears: The Great Wall St. Game
description: Players make bets on whether stocks and commodities will rise or fall. Each turn a spinner determines the results, so it's a game that is almost 100% luck.

name: Scooby-Doo! Monster Mystery Game
description:
Produced for McDonald's for giveaway in Happy Meals. It comes with a board, playing pieces, and a unique die roller.

Each player takes turns moving across the board. There are 10 'monster discs' (out of 12) on spaces on the board. Each of these has a hidden message that you must 'decode' by looking at it through the red moon. Once you've landed on it, you must follow the instructions on it.

The object is to collect as many of these as possible. They also contain a hidden amount of points. First one to the end also earns bonus points. The game ends when all players have reached the end.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Role Playing, Set Collection

name: Discover Iowa
description:
From the box (rules printed on bottom of box lid)

"Object of the game-To be the first player to tour the state of Iowa and cross the finish line. He therefore is named the winner."

This is a simple roll and move game featuring a map of the state of Iowa. There are two decks of 16 cards with basic information on Iowa which must be played when pawns land on various spaces.

The game was published by Hesse Limited, of Sioux City Iowa in 1979. Hesse Limited was owned by Hessco Limited.

name: Psalms
description: This is a religious themed game that challenges players to match scripture text from the Bible to their corresponding verse references or verse topics. Players track their matches on bingo-like scorecards and compete to see who can mostly quickly make rows of matches.

name: The Amazing Adventures of Doctor Dolittle 3D Game
description: This is a spin and move game for children themed on the classic Doctor Dolittle movie starring Rex Harrison. Players compete to be the first to navigate the board and accomplish certain objectives, including getting on and off Star Island and finding the Giant Pink Sea Snail. The gameboard. Players move by calling out an animal's name, spinning the spinner, and then reading how far the animal "said" to move. Players also can accumulate "adventure" cards which can help them with movement on the board.

name: Shabbos is Coming!
description: This is a children's game published in Hebrew and English which has a religious theme focusing on preparation for Shabbos or Shabbat, which in Judaism is the Sabbath day (day of rest). The game is similar to a chutes and ladders style game, with players moving up ladders and down slides to move from the bottom to the top of the board. The board uses religious imagery to connect this journey to appropriate preparation for the Sabbath.

name: Roosevelt at San Juan
description: Children's trivia game designed to teach the facts of the Spanish-American war and Teddy Roosevelt's thoughts on it. Sample questions: Where did the Rough Riders land in Cuba? What should New York thank Roosevelt for?

name: Game of the Little Volunteer
description: Children's game in which players start as a little drummer boy and rise to the rank of Commander-in-Chief. Grisly images of bloodshed, apparently not troubling to parents of the times cover the gameboard.

name: Game of Napoleon: The Little Corporal
description: Players move around a board which teaches the life story of Napoleon, starting with his birth in Corsica through his exile on St. Helena. I suppose the goal is to NOT finish first.

name: Colonial Empires
description: Card game simulation of European Colonization and expansion circa 1600-1850. 10 different Nations to Choose from, each with its own special ability. 10 Colonial Regions to discover and exploit. Develop Home Industries. Wage war at home and in foreign lands. Amass the largest Fortune to win. Simple card play.
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Economic, Print & Play

name: "Swish" Basketball Game
description: Comes with a spinner, and a punch out basketball. The board is 13 1/2 by 10 1/2 inches and depicts basketball players from a red jerseyed team and a blue jerseyed team. Instructions are on the back of the board. Family sports game published sometime in the 1950s by Whitman.

name: Bumpback
description: In Bumpback your goal is to move all of your pawns from the start space around the board to the finish space before your opponent. The game can be played with anywhere from 2 to 8 pawns per player. If you wish to play a shorter game you may choose fewer pawns to start with. If you wish to play a longer game you can start with more pawns. Players take turns rolling and moving their pawns around the board. The game includes a Bumpback die that can be rolled when you land on a space that is occupied by another player. The Bumpback die sends pawns back to their start position. Each space has six dots on it and the number rolled on the Bumpback die applies to any pawn resting on that numbered dot. The game can get very exciting with 4 players and 32 pawns on the board.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Medieval
description:
Western Europe, middle of the VIII century. The players take on the role of the growing monastic orders of the time, and their mission is to be first in building a certain number of abbeys across the board. Round after round, the senior abbots of each order rely on the benefits derived from those in power to make their abbeys the most influential political, spiritual or production centers, or all three, as those hardy monks were at the same time those who prayed, those who fought and those who worked.

Game elements:

1 Board (Showing a map of Western Europe divided in 7 regions)
5 Senior Abbot figures
6 Power cards (King, Baron, Hermit, Abbot, Bishop and Townsman)
6 Brother cards (Herbolarius, Cook, Secretary, Blacksmith, Goldsmith, Copyist)
10 Action markers (2 in each of the players’ colors)
36 Power tokens (12 of each: Spiritual, Political, and Material)
36 Foundation markers (featuring two or three power symbols)
50 Abbeys (10 in each of the players’ colors)
84 Buildings (14 of each: Chancellery, Blacksmith shop, Scriptorium, Basilica, Wheat, Wine Cellar.)
102 Good tokens (17 of each: Books, Reliquaries; Letters, Shields; Wine Bottles, loaves of Bread)
50 coins (30 x $5, 20 x $1)
1 Pope figure
mechanics: Action Points, Commodity Speculation, Variable Player Powers

name: Home Base Ball Game
description: Simple children's baseball game from the turn of the last century. Mechanical bat swings at a small pitched ball with 7 tin fielders which may "field" the ball.

name: Game of Golf
description: A simple children's roll and move game in which the goal is to complete six holes of golf. Good rolls make the ball land in the fairway and make for a quick game. Poor rolls send the player into the rough, making the path to each hole longer.

name: Excursion to Coney Island
description: Similar to the Peter Coddle games, players read about an trip to Coney Island filled with adventure, with players inserting funny phrases either at random or after they've been dealt and players shout them out when appropriate, or perhaps it's funnier when the words are inappropriate.

name: Game of City Life or the Boys of New York
description: Very simple game in which players draw cards and play into or take from a community pool. The real point of the cards is to show the various types of people living in NYC, which was then as it is now, the largest and grandest city in the Union. Cards vary from the positive to the very negative.

name: Game of Race Around the World
description: Simple roll and move game meant to teach geography along with counting. A simple numbered track is printed on a map of the world. Players spin to move, hoping to miss hazard spaces.

name: Game of Trip Round the World
description: A simple roll and move children's game designed to teach some geography as players spin their way around the globe, hoping to avoid hazard spaces.

name: Question Mark
description:
The cut to the chase trivia game that can be played in trains, planes, automobiles or at home at the braai (barbecue), or even around the pool.

The first player/team to correctly answer 20 questions is the winner.

So grab your pad & pencil and colour your way to victory.

Question Mark is all about pure knowledge!

name: Peter Coddle Tells of His Trip to Chicago
description: Follow up to several Peter Coddle visits New York games from the same period. Players fill out the story of Peter's travels by filling in the funny phrases they have drawn from the pile.

name: WirRheinländer
description:
Explore the fascinating history of the German Rheinland with this trivia game. You don' have to be an eager beaver to win this game - you need skill and luck to be the first to reach the goal with the pawn in your colour.
However, each colour may be moved by everyone - and there are some traps along the way, so watch out....
When reaching special fields a card is drawn. There are two kinds of cards - Knowledge Cards that require you to answer a question concerning the Rheinland and Action Cards that mix up the outcome of the game...
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Barsaman
description: Barsaman is a backgammon like game on a circular board. Using three dice each player tries to bear off his pieces using standard, double and triple moves. The dice determine in which ring on the board you are allowed to play. Along the way the opponent's pieces can be blocked or captured. Captured pieces help you finish the game early. Player with the most pieces borne off wins.

name: Lucy's Race for Fame Trivia game
description:
Billed as the trivia game about the TV Show, "I Love Lucy" that was created by fans of the show for other fans of the show, this game features over 1,000 trivia questions.

The gameboard depicts a stylized map of New York City with memorable locations highlighted from episodes of the show. Players compete to answer question correctly to move around the city and be the first to win a television contract with Studio 10 Television Center

name: Glenn Baker's Rock Academy
description: This is a music trivia board game from Glenn Baker, who is famous for music knowledge in Australia. The game features 4,000 music trivia questions covering a period of five decades.

name: Our Great Game
description:
Our Great Game is a board game which simulates the game of Australian Rules Football.

The game was probably first published in the 1920s by the National Game Company. Several versions exist. Two versions are produced on a thick backing either 36cm x 36cm or 48 x 31cm. Common to all versions is the wording 'Our Great Game' on the inside board. The box or board covers have various titles, including 'The National Football game', 'Our Great Game' or 'The Game of Football'. All but one version has the playing field angled across the board. Later copies were printed on thin card, boxed with the logo (but not on the board), including those published by Westley games.

As with the real form of the sport scores are kept for two teams (Yellow and Red team in the game) and 4 quarters are played with the duration decided by the players. The scores are 6 points for a goal (through the tall posts) and 1 point for a behind (number 31 in the game). Play starts by the sum of two dice. A disc (ball) is placed at that players feet that corresponds to the number. (i.e If 6 and 2 are rolled, player 8 Red team has the ball) If the player is in the defensive zone (closer half of their opponents goal) the next roll of the dice must be subtracted (i.e If player 8 (Red Team) rolls a 1 the next player to receive the ball is 8 - 1 = 7. If the red team is still in possession they keep rolling the dice but if the number turns it over to the yellow team then its their roll of the dice. When the player is forward of their center line, then they are deemed to be in attack. In this case instead of subtracting the dice roll they must add. (i.e Player 7 (Red Team) is forward of center so they roll say a 3 - the next player to receive the ball is 10 (7 + 3). Movement and scoring is done in this way. If a behind is scored the ball is placed on player 29 of the opposing team to kick out. The highest score after 4 quarters is the winner.

name: Soldiers of the Dragon
description:
From the original Avalanche Press 2007 newsletter announcement:

Soldiers of the Dragon: Rob Markham takes Avalanche Press' popular Soldier system to the Chinese civil war that raged from 936 to 951 AD. Two to five players lead Chinese kingdoms trying to unify all of the Middle Kingdom. Units represent armies of infantry, cavalry or elephants, and fleets of warships. One map, 120 decadently thick tiles, 88 over-sized playing pieces.

name: Lilli muistipeli
description: Lilli muistipeli is a simple children's memory game. The theme is from the TV show "Fifi and the Flowertots" ("Lilli ja kukkaisystävät" in Finnish). Each player gets a player board and tries to collect the series of six pictures on her board. The game is played as a usual memory game.
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Game of Fox Hunting
description: Similar to many horse racing games, instead players move around the board chasing a fox. The board is three-dimensional, with paper buildings and trees.

name: Safety First
description: Think of it as the origin of "Frogger." Players cross streets and get around town while dodging cars and buses.

name: Go Goddess Girl! Tween Talk
description:
Go Goddess Girl Tween Talk empowers girls to share their feelings, to say what's on their minds and in their heart. From the publisher: "The goal of the game is easy and fun you answer questions all about tween life,( the stuff you love to talk about anyway), and build your own Go Goddess Girl bracelet. but stay cool, there are no right or wrong answers."

Includes: 210 purple power beads, Goddess Girl guide, 7 decks of cards, Tray with spinner, Game rules, Elastic thread

name: Rock and Roll Word Game
description: This word game uses plastic dice with letters and scores,with some faces of the dice having a musical note on them. The game is similar to a "Scribbage" type game, where players attempt to make words and phrases from the letters that are rolled--this game uses a variant with a punning musical theme.

name: Big Bubba's Redneck Trivia Game
description:
This is a party-style trivia game with questions themed on the "redneck" culture of the southern U.S.

From the publisher: "Get your friends and family together. It’s time to challenge them to an evening of fun, learning and reminiscing. Bubba has been bear hunting in Canada and is on his way to Darlington for the race. By answering right and betting smart, you can beat Bubba and your friends at this most unique and entertaining board game. Over 20 categories, 400 questions, authentic shotgun shell game pieces, 50 go-fishing cards, Bubba bucks for betting , and the funniest game board anywhere."

name: Superman: Search for Superman's Deadliest Enemies
description: A spin and move game which has players competing to locate and then beat some of Superman's most famous opponents.

name: Spritz & Tooor
description: He shoots, he scores! Squirt and Goal from Haba® is the ultimate in water soccer! Use the Penguin and Frog to squirt water onto the soccer ball to score goals - what fun! Perfect for the pool! Includes a ring "field" with two goals, ball and squirters. For ages 4 and above
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Sports

name: Shenandoah Management Games for Supervisors
description:
This business game published by McGraw Hill puts a single player or two teams of players in charge of the "lifelike" Shenandoah Guitar Company. There are nine separate games included that are designed to teach management skills. After these lessons, you should be able to "apply, analyze, synthesize, and evaluate your learning experience" and be ready to run a real company. The nine games included are:

1. Supervisory Performance Challenge
2. Extending the Yield
3. Energy Patrol
4. Handling the Grievance
5. Solving the Variance Problem
6. Managing Your In Basket
7. Mapping the Mandolin
8. Bridging the Quality Gap
9. Facing the Music
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The Vault
description: This game is based on the British television game show, "The Vault." Players compete to correctly guess/identify the combination to the vault in order to be the winner, including through answering a series of trivia questions.

name: Stringfellows: The Board Game
description:
You & your friends have been invited for a night out with Peter Stringfellow. The race is on to look your best. There are 2 sets of cards - 1 with trivia questions you must answer and the other with items you must collect to ensure you look your best for your big night out!
The 1st game involves getting yourself ready to go out - visits to the hairdressers, beauty salon and clothes shops. Where you go for your preparations decides how good you will look for your night out - obviously you would rather go to a designer hairdresser than the "Pudding Basin" salon - likewise "last weeks socks" are not as desirable as "straight off the catwalk"!
You travel around the board trying to pamper an primp yourself for your big night out. This game ends and is won by the person who achieves the highest value of collected items.
The second game takes place inside Peter Stringfellows' Club. The object is to try and get next to your favourite star who is in the nightclub. But be warned - there are many pitfalls! You need to work your way past the stars, personal assistants and bodyguards or minders and your knowledge of celebrity trivia, drinks, dancing and music will be put to the test!
The game ends when all the celebrity counters have been collected off the board - the person with the most celebrities around them is the winner!

This is a game intended for adults (suggested age is 18 and over)

name: Game of Yachting
description: A small roll-and-move (or in this case spin) game in which advantageous spins cut the size of the sailing course.

name: The Wild West Game
description: Simple roll-and-move game featuring scenes from the American West.
publishers: McLoughlin Brothers, R. Bliss Manufacturing Company

name: Host Your Own Quiz Night: Trivia Team Challenge
description: Fairly straightforward trivia game designed to be played with two teams of players and one person acting as the "host" of the game. Trivia questions are separated into various categories from which players choose.

name: Descarado
description:
The particularity about this A Question of Scruples based game is that the questions are based on moral dilemmas involving the characters of the T.V. show Descarado

Content:


300 questions
12 Yes/No cards
Rules
categories: Bluffing, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Comet: Crete 1941
description: This is a game for two players (representing German and Allied forces) and is played out on the island of Crete, in the Eastern Mediterranean, in May 1941. German parachute and glider troops began an assault to seize control of three airfields along the North coast at 0600 on 20 May 1941; they were to be followed by airborne and seaborne reinforcements. COMET - Crete 1941 focuses on the action around two of the German objectives – Maleme airfield and Souda (COMET was the German codeword for the western assault). The German player’s aim is to obtain a foothold so that follow-on forces can land and take permanent control of the objectives. The aim of the Allied player is to prevent the German reinforcements from landing and subsequently to defeat the assault forces. The game is played in alternate turns each player being able to move playing pieces and make attacks against their opponent in succession.

name: The Battle of Midway: Four Fatal Hours
description:
This is a solitaire simulation of the four fatal hours of June 4th 1942 that would decide the outcome of the Battle of Midway. It is set over 8 half hour turns between 07:00 which was the approximate time of the first American attack, and 11:00 which was the approximate time of the first Japanese counter strike at the American carriers. You represent Admiral Nagumo in command of Carrier Divisions one and two. The orders you were given before setting sail were two-fold, firstly strike the Midway Atoll so as to allow for a follow-up invasion, and secondly, strike any American carriers which sail out to challenge you.

Your goal throughout this game is to carry out these orders and to keep your carriers afloat. Victory points will be awarded according to the level of success you achieve in meeting these goals.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: The Citadel of Prokhorovka (Kursk 1943)
description:
The Citadel of Prokhorovka is a board game simulating the conflict around the small Russian town of
Prokhorovka, which was fought on Monday 12 July 1943 between German and Soviet forces. The battle
plan was part of Operation Citadel, Hitler’s attempt to eliminate the large Kursk bulge at the Eastern Front,
consolidate his defence line by about 80 miles and deprive the Soviets of any serious capacity to attack for
the rest of 1943. The fighting mainly took place among the armoured formations of the two sides, but the
participation of infantry, artillery and air force was also important and is reflected in the game.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Top of the Goalposts
description:
Top of the Goalposts is a DTP card game that simulates a soccer game between two generic teams. You play with a 50 cards deck that you have to end for two times (one for each half of the game). Each card is rated for Attack, Defense, Shot and Goal-Save and most of the cards have also a special action on them. Player with the ball must try to move ball from Midfield to Shot area, while the other must try to get the ball back and possibly start a rapid counterattack. There are rules for substitution and several special events.
Easy (Ages 7/8 and up), but fun and very fast and competitive.

Available for print & play through wargamedownloads.com in English version
Italian version, called "Incrocio dei pali" available for print & play through
arima.it

name: Niloe
description: This is a card game published by the Cincinnati Game Company for many years as Niloe "Individual and Progressive Niloe," and/or "The Game of 'Niloe'". The cards consists of topic cards and letter cards, and players compete to identify words fitting the topic that begin with the specified letter.

name: Purple Ronnie's Twister
description: This is a themed version of Twister using the stick-figure character Purple Ronnieand his frat-boy type humor. The usual twister circles have been replaced with illustrations of such things as beer, vomit, and flatulence.

name: Seesaw
description:
Seesaw is a game in the Wooden Balance Game series by Daiso, the Japanese 100-yen shop chain.

The game is played on a piece of wood with a flat upper surface but curved base - the seesaw. The flat surface has the two end areas marked off and each player has to take turns placing different kinds of wooden pieces in their respective areas, depending on the colour rolled on the special die. The pieces come in three colours, yellow cubes, blue cuboids (about twice the length of the yellow cube) and red cuboids (about four times the length of the yellow cubes).
The wooden die has round spots in these three colours (repeated once on the six sides).
The idea is to be able to place your designated piece without toppling whatever has already been placed on the seesaw.
The twist is that the pieces all have two surfaces that are slightly convex.

name: Banana Tower
description:
Banana Tower is a game in the Wooden Balance Game series by Daiso, the Japanese 100-yen shop chain.

The game consists of pieces of wood painted bright yellow and having a biconvex, lens-shaped cross section. There are eight larger pieces and five smaller pieces. Players try to build as tall a tower as they can, balancing the pieces one atop another on their convex surfaces.

name: Apple Tree
description:
Apple Tree is a game in the Wooden Balance Game series by Daiso, the Japanese 100-yen shop chain.

Players take turns placing leaves and apples on a tree, trying not to upset the whole structure. The main pieces is a naturally coloured piece of wood with a trunk and branches. The leaves are green wedges of wood and the apples are red cuboids.
In the process of playing the game, a pretty apple tree is created.

name: Moon Dish
description:
Moon Dish is a game in the Wooden Balance Game series by Daiso, the Japanese 100-yen shop chain.

The eponymous Moon Dish is a hemispherical block of wood on which players take turns to place thin wooden dowels (with circular cross-sections) without upsetting the whole structure. The game comes with thirty dowels.

name: LDS Sequence
description:
A variant of Sequence, made for an LDS (Latter Day Saint) audience. The game uses a single 60 card, 4 suit deck.

The four suits are: Peace, War, Famine, and Plenty. Each card features one of the 15 books of the Book of Mormon, the '1' cards featuring the first book (1 Nephi) and the '15' cards featuring the last book (Moroni).

name: Nuclear Attack
description:
Nuclear Attack is a game that presents in an abstract form the nuclear warfare between equal superpowers. The idea is to make an succesful attack that destroys the central command of the opponent. Once the central command is destroyed the nation is annihilated.

The pieces of the game represent the nuclear explosions i.e. the 'mushrooms'. The board consists of cities and flight routes between the cities.

name: The Abductinators
description:
From the rulebook:

The players play the parts of alien Abductinators, sneaking through Grandma’s house late at night, trying to abduct the people there. The game uses pawns on a board to represent the aliens and humans in the house. The players choose their aliens’ actions by selecting action cards from their hands.

The humans act randomly: they get their actions dealt to them, no choice involved.

Gameplay is fast-paced and a bit silly. Sound effects, sloganeering and talking smack are all in the spirit.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: MasterMinds and Monkey-Shines
description:
"Designed for Adults, Enjoyed by Children"

Three ways to play:

Game I - The Master Bluff (Ultimate Party or Parlor Game)

First player to reach 50 points wins. Bluffmaster selects 3 cards, chooses one. Reads the question aloud and answer aloud (from provided answers or makes one up). One answer on the card is correct. Opponents score points by correctly agreeing or disagreeing.

Game II - Black Jack (Twenty-one Points Makes You a Winner)
Roll a die to determine number of points scored or lost in a turn. Answer trivia questions. First to 21 wins.

Game III - Strike-Out (Groups and Groups of Fun)
For two large groups of players. Each team lines up and face off (Family Feud style). Players are eliminated with 3 incorrect answers. Last one standing wins.

Equipment is a generous collection of question cards with multiple choice answers, an answer key, several agree and several disagree cards, die.

name: Eight Hours of Le Mans
description:
Subtitled: A Convention Tournament Game. This reworking of the Avalon Hill classic Le Mans, is staged only at conventions, including Gen Con, and special weekend events. The track is over 12' long and 6' wide. Players wear numbered vests that match their cars and the cars are moved around the track as players choose their gear, speed, whether or not to risk corners, and manage their tires. To a certain extent, players are also able to manage their cars' condition as they choose whether to drive conservatively, competitively, or press. Pressing will increase a car's speed, while also increasing the chance of mechanical problems cropping up in the car.

Games last 5 - 24 hours, that's no joke, players schedule 24 hour games. In "short" five-hour games, players race independently. In 8-hour games, players drive in 2-man teams, and while "driving" players are not afforded food, drink, or bathroom breaks! In the 24-hour version of the game, cars are driven by 2 or 3-man teams with players driving longer shifts, which allows time for sleeping.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: V-game
description:
This is an anti-Nazi game from the 1940's which was produced by underground opposition forces in Belgium during the Second World War.

Players use a crude spring to launch wooden pieces onto a board with four sections of different point values. The two outer rings included the names of German cities. The third ring had cartoon images of top Nazi officials such as propaganda minister Joseph Goebbel. The inner ring - with the highest score of 100 points - showed Adolf Hitler.

The box for the game shows a picture of Hitler riding atop a German V-1 rocket and wearing a British royal crown.
(excerpts from CBC news coverage)

name: Navigator
description: A game of sail racing, players race around buoys while avoiding obstacles. This is a very early game of hand management, as players pull and play cards from their hand of four trying to set up successful runs around the board. Also of historical note, the game includes rules for a solitaire game and two alternative sets of rules using the same components.

name: Jeu des Petites annonces de France-Soir
description:
Literally "Play of the small advertisements of France-evening"



Description from A Gamut of GamesSid Sackson mentions this game on p12 of A Gamut of Games. He writes that it "… has a delightful gallic flavor. Players move around a board showing a map of Paris. They acquire children by landing on the proper spaces. The children are educated by landing on other spaces, after which they are sent out to work. The winner is the first player who is able, by using the earnings of his children, to buy a bank."

name: Claymores
description: Rules for combat using bladed weapons. All known blades are listed or will match one listed. This is single figure combat. Most players can handle 4 figures at one time. Great for tournaments.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Skirmishers
description:
From Publisher's site

Rules for single figure combat 1780 to 1880. Especially the ACW and Indian Wars. Various weapons are available to choose from. There are rules for a block army version. Fantasy figures for this period are available, especially or the Nappy wars. Army lists are included.
categories: American Civil War, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Urbs & Civitas
description: Urbs & Civitas introduces the fundamental concepts of street addressing in the urban context all the while demonstrating the importance of its derived benefits: revenue generation, crime reduction, increased commerce & tourism, improved public health & safety, and good governance. Integrating street addressing as the foundational tool in the urban management process, Urbs & Civitas then progresses by assigning much importance to continued infrastructure development. Game play emphasizes strong player interaction and management skills by balancing revenue generation versus maintenance costs and promotes the advantages of street addressing through ongoing civic improvement.
categories: City Building, Economic, Educational, Negotiation, Political, Transportation
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Chit-Pull System, Cooperative Game, Tile Placement

name: Ivor the Engine: Branch Lines
description: Children's boardgame featuring the star of the Welsh cartoon classic, Ivor the Engine, created by Oliver Postgate. The first person to reach the engine shed wins. Some squares have access to Branch Lines that make you jump ahead or fall behind.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trains
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Ivor the Engine: The Flower Game
description:
Children's boardgame featuring the stars of the Welsh cartoon classic, Ivor the Engine, created by Oliver Postgate. Pick up three flowers for the flower show and return home to win.

Players may travel around the board in any direction they choose except backward. Land on a flower square to pick up a flower, land on a rectangle to pick up a card, or land on a circle to pick up a penny. Pennies can either modify a roll of the dice or 3 may be used to buy a flower.

Scans of the colourful components featuring elements of Ivor's adventures are available at:
http://www.smallfilms.co.uk/ivor/games.htm
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Herbs
description:
Space aliens captured and cloned a janitor named Herb to play a new game...

Herbs is a fun and simple strategy game where players make their moves simultaneously. It's like a simulated arcade game, which makes players rely more on good thinking than quick reflexes. Success in the game will depend on carefully devising your plans while leaving plenty of room for the unexpected.

Object
Each player will control two Herbs attempting to simply score the most points using 200 Action Points. Points will be scored by eliminating stones or by forming certain scoring patterns with the stones. Destroying an opponent's Herb also scores points.

name: The Two Pipers
description:
