extracted from the Game Cabinet listing for the rules for this game:

This is a strategy game with simple rules. The complexity of play could be compared to that of checkers.

The game requires a standard checker board and eighteen markers for the game. A set of markers for one player consists of a PIPER and eight creatures. You'll need two sets, one for each player, in different colors. The creatures' markers are two-sided. One side of the marker shows the creature asleep, and the other shows it attacking. Not surprisingly, these creatures are referred to as "SLEEPERS" and "ATTACKERS" depending on which side is up.

The Object
Be the first to move your PIPER across the swamp or to eliminate your opponent's PIPER.

Winning the Game
If a player manages to get his or her PIPER across the swamp to the land where the opponent started, that player wins the game.

A player also wins if he or she eliminates the PIPER belonging to the opponent.

For purposes of winning, it is assumed that both PIPERS could stand on one of the land squares at the same time. In other words, a player can't prevent a win by planting his PIPER on the land and refusing to move it!

name: Statements
description:
The Enron Game.

This game is a simulation of Enron and other corporate malfeasance type situations. Players can either roll dice to (honestly) make profits or state a profit level - but at the cost of "audit points" which increase the risk that an audit may reveal the malfeasance.

Full rules and description at: http://www.luchacabra.com/?p=36
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation

name: Brown Water Navies
description:
The first chapter is the game. It covers all aspects of naval warfare during the American Civil War. Ramming, mines,
subs are also covered. The game is historical with one slight twist. It was written for what the ships were designed to do, not what they actually did. In this light two very powerful and equal fleets set sail. The players are the difference that decides the outcome.

The other chapters provide historical data to enrich the game. The original game has grown to be a one stop info source for the vessels of the ACW. For those without ship models.
110 different ships are provided on the cards on the CD. 90 vessels are drawn in black and white in Chapter 7. It also contains ACW photos of many of the ships. The game is design for all scales. Only four rules are different for the larger models, mainly distances.
categories: American Civil War, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Planecrash
description:
Planecrash is a game played with Magic: The Gathering cards, though it has almost nothing to do with that game. Players select a deck of cards of various colors (color determined based on M:TG rules), shuffle it, then play from the shuffled deck. The place a card on one of three piles based on color relationships, with the chance to capture a pile or create a particular combination of colors on top of the three piles. Creating the correct combination, or collecting the most cards, results in a win.

Full rules at: http://www.luchacabra.com/?p=30

name: Plastic Glory
description:
Plastic Glory is, essentially, a simple miniatures rules system -- except it isn't for miniatures. You're fighting with plastic toy soldiers, they're marching across the tabletop, climbing over books, ducking around a Cheetos bag, etc. They move in inches, real inches -- not scale to something. They have capabilities based on the posture of the plastic figure -- standing, crouching, or prone.

Full rules at: http://www.luchacabra.com/?p=41
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Hesitation
description:
The board comprises five linked holes and each of two players has two counters. In quick-fire fashion, each player is allowed to move one of their counters to the vacant hole along the available grid lines - if they can't, they've lost - no jumping allowed.

The puzzle can actually be folded over to provide a pocket-size block (containing the 4 pegs) for travel / storage.

name: Tallimestari
description: A game loosely based on Monopoly. The players are trying to acquire the best horses for their stables.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Insel der Piraten
description:
As a pirate, it is your objective to capture enemy or neutral vessels and islands, thus obtaining gold to outfit or improve your own ship. The ultimate goal is to conquer the "Island of Pirates", which gives this game its name.

To achieve the goal, the players can explore the seas surrounding the fabled island, always having at least one watchful eye of the look out at the opponents.

At the beginning, every ship is outfitted with five cannons of a given firepower. Both numbers can be increased using upgrades. However, not only the equipment is deciding a battle, the proficiency and luck of the crew manning the guns is important, too. This is represented by the dice rolls being made in combat.

Contains:
- 1 map, the board
- 7 leaves of gaming money
- 1 die
- 16 figurines
- 1 rulebook
- 20 combat resolution sheets

name: The Lone Ranger Game
description: Lone Ranger, Tonto and Taka help you race to the fort.
categories: American West, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: Mighty Max Super Battle Card Game
description:
A version of the card game "war" (flip cards, high number captures, if there's a tie ante more cards into the pile and re-flip) themed on the Mighty Max toy line (and cartoon, and video game...) from the mid-1990's. The 53-card deck has values from one to twelve, with only one twelve, two elevens, and five of every other number.

From the back of the box: "The Deadly Doom Zone Dwellers are back and you and Mighty Max must capture them all to win. Be ready at all times in this fast action card game where battles escalate into Super Battles -- instantly. The stakes get higher and higher as you add cards to the battlefield. Then the highest card takes everything and you begin again til one player conquers the others, by taking all the cards and becomes the winner!"

name: Prime Times
description:
Prime Times - The Game of Film and TV Impressions

The object of the game is to recreate and relive the funniest and most memorable lines from film and TV. This game is for two or more players Ages 8 and up

The game comes with cards and instructions. You pick a category and then play act using props, your voice or simply your movements and facial expressions while other players try to guess what or who you are.

name: Times of the World
description:
from the box:

Times Of The World from Edge is a fun, fascinating and informative game about interesting people, important places and historical events. Colorful game cards with maps from various regions of the world, simple directions and challenging questions invite all age levels to play. Recommended Ages 7 and up. 2 or more players or teams

name: Time Squares
description:
The Picture Board Game of the Century Home Rock Entertainment Inc 2000

Ages 10 and up for 1 to 4 players

A unique picture board game of strategy and luck

Each player has their own board on which they must bring order to many of the memorable events, people, places, and things that helped shape the century

Contains rules, 4 individual 10" by 20" game boards, 168 time cards, 7 free time cards, 4 time blocks

This game has the seal of the Papanicolaou Corps for Cancer Research Inc. on it's cover so was probably used as a donation incentive.

name: Chosen: The Game
description:
From the publisher's website:

Chosen is a Bible-based trading card game for kids, adults and families. Chosen is fun to play and an educational Bible game. Collect your favorite Bible characters' cards, read their stories and play against your friends to see whether you are a Chosen player!

Chosen has three different rule levels so that beginners and casual players can quickly and easily learn how to play this Bible game, while more advanced players can challenge themselves with the advanced rules. The design of the Chosen cards and rules allows players to use the same cards in an easy to play beginners Bible game, when using beginner rules, or in an intellectually challenging adventure Bible game when using expert rules. Collect and trade cards with friends to build a strong deck and to collect your favorite Bible characters.

name: Nyomoz a család
description: A Hungarian clone of Cluedo.
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Three Intermediate Math Games
description:
Dinosaur Division:
Be the big winner in this Stone Age race! Answer questions by matching dividens and divisors through 9's. Watch out for the low-flying pterodactyls

Prehistoric Times:
Race a dinosaur through a prehistoric obstacle course! Dodge tar pits, volcanoes, and saber-toothed tigers. As you play you will sharpen your multiplication skills through 9's

Ballpark Figures:
Step up to the pat and hit a home run! Round numbers to the nearest tens, hundreds, and thousands. Spin the spinner to get on base and score points. Everyone can win!

name: Muniopoly
description: Monopoly-ish board game loosely based on the investment strategies of the Rochester Fund of New York. Play as either a fund manager or a politician. Buy municipal bonds, build, and collect tax-free income.
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: All About Broome County
description: Travel around Broome County, New York in this roll-and-move family game. Comes with a six part game board, instructions, dice, 11 game pieces, money, 48 "surprise" cards, 120 travel cards, 60 coupons, and 12 shopping lists.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Ump-Rite
description:
Ump-Rite is not a statistical replay.

One player rolls two six-sided dice. The dice are read as a two digit number with the lower number being the first digit.

One player checks for a result on the page which relates to the current on base situation. However, a player can challenge the result by looking in a second book of tables called the Blue Book.

name: Yo Yogi Game
description:
From the manufacturer:

Prowl Jellystone Mall with Yogi and friends in search of hot bargains on cool stuff! Grab a tape deck, a skateboard, a guitar, or a pizza, but save your money—you'll need one product from each store to win the game. Flip over the spinner and play the Yo Yogi Secret Bonus Game! For 2 or more players. Ages 4 - 8
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Our National Life
description:
And educational game for "Occupation, Study Hour and Home Play" with cards on various parts of American history such as the Civil War and National Expansion. The game plays like "Go Fish" with each player asking other players for pairs of cards and creating sets based on various themes.

According to the designer:

“The pack contains 56 cards, in which seven historical divisions are treated, as follows: Territorial Expansion, Commerce and Industry, Education and Religion, Invention, Transportation, Finance, and War. Each of these division treats of two or more subjects, events or movements, two cards being given to each subject event or movement.”

The editor of the series declared that “The games are in no sense a substitute for other work, or anything extra, but a re-enforcement of the regular assignments along most interesting lines.”

name: Flank
description:
From the package:
"The object of FLANK is to capture your opponent's pieces by putting two of your own pieces on directly opposite sides of one of his pieces, or flanking. To do this takes at least two moves, one to attack from one side and one to flank from the other. Watch out that your opponent doesn't Flank you first!"

An abstract strategy game featuring a roll-up board and nine go-stones in two colors; black and white. Packaged in a cardboard tube. Described as "A game of skill for two players, Ages 8 and up."

name: Great Old Ones
description:
Card game based on the Cthulhu Mythos. Reduce your opponent to zero Sanity points. Collectible card game type mechanics. Extensive card List. Multiple Sample Decks. Easy Deck Construction Rules. Fast play for your Cthulhu Fix. A free copy of the rules is available at:
http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/GOO.html

name: The Game of Triangles
description:
In The Game of Triangles, tiles are played so the numbers on each side match the numbers on any adjoining tiles.

Players begin their turn by declaring what number they will play on. They continue to place the triangular tiles until they have no remaining tiles with that number that can be placed. Tiles are then drawn to bring the total back up to 5. Scoring is based on the numbers on the placed tile, with multipliers for placements involving two or three adjoining sides.

name: Colorado Trivia
description: A trivia game based on Colorado. Categories include 'Personalities', 'History', 'On the Rocks', and more.

name: Animal Journeys
description: Animal Journey - A rescue Adventure Game-travel the world with animal heroes and help save endangered animals. Animal Journey is a memory Adventure game that helps children develop matching skills, learn animal habitats and names, develop social skills, by following the rules and taking turns. No reading or numbers involved. For 2-4 players, Ages 5 and up

name: The Little Colonel
description: Board game based on the Little Colonel series of books and the movie starring Shirley Temple. Comes with 4 playing pieces, board, 8 figures with metal stands, dice, a shaker for the dice, and instructions printed on the inside of the box.

name: The Nurses Game
description: Simple roll and move game from IDEAL. The Nurses asks you to follow the hectic careers of nurses Liz Thorpe and Gail Lucas. This game comes from the television show of the same name that was on during the 1960's which featured Shirl Conway as Liz Thorpe and Zina Bethune as Gail Lucas.

name: Rex Morgan M.D.
description: Rex Morgan MD Game is from the Sunday Funnies Series of games put out by Ideal in 1972. The game is for 2 to 4 players Ages 7 to 14. Object is to roll the dice and then "Race around to emergencies with America's favorite doctor".

name: America: Kate Smith's Own Game
description:
Kate Smith, the famous singer and radio star from the 1940's (she also sang "God Bless America" at Philadelphia Flyer Hockey Games during the 1970's), is on the cover of this war-time game that reeks of patriotism. It was produced by Toy Creations Inc. of New York, and a signed dedication inside the box lid promised to donate all royalties to charity.

The game comes with 144 thick cardboard tiles: 48 states divided into four color-coded regions; 48 state capitols; 30 primary industries; 10 "favorite sons"; and 8 American flags (wild cards). There are four cardboard racks for holding each player's tiles (neatly designed to create red-and-white stripes when laid sideways in the box next to the blue-starred covered rules).

The tiles are shuffled face down on the table between the players. Each player draws a hand of 12 tiles to start. Each in turn then draws a tile and then discards a tile (the same or another). As in mah-jong, the player must announce the discard. The next player may pick up either the discard or a blind tile, but any player may claim the discard if it completes a partial set. He must reveal enough tiles to prove the set (e.g. two other states of the same color), thus revealing part of his strategy, but play then passes to the seizing player's left, with any in between missing their turns.

There are eight potential scoring combinations. The easiest, scoring 5, is a hand with three states in each of the four regions. The most difficult, scoring 30, requires three states each with their capitols, one of their industries and a favorite son. (Since some industries have only a single tile, and only 10 states have favorite sons, this can be very difficult indeed.) However, the 8 American flag tiles can be used as wild cards.

If a player needs information (such as a state's favorite son or industry), he may ask questions out loud, and pays 5 into a bonus pot for each question. As soon as a player completes a winning hand, he calls "America" and collects the value of the hand from each player as well as anything in the bonus pot. Cardboard discs in four colors are supplied, with their values to be assigned by the players.

name: Teen Magazine: The Game
description: The box cover for this game claims that this is a game that is all about guys, real life, celebs, beauty and style. The object of the game is to create your own magazine cover by using the teen cards that you acquire while going around the board. Game is suitable for girls Ages 8 and 14

name: Captain Kangaroo: Parade Around the Treasure House Game
description: Captain Kangaroo's Parade Around the Treasure House Game from Transogram was produced in 1969. It is a very simple roll and move game for 2 to 4 players.

name: The Improved Game of Fish Pond
description:
McLoughlin Brothers Improved Game of Fish Pond from 1890. The game has stacks of cardboard fish plus wood poles and metal hooks. Object of the game was to catch as many fish as possible. Each fish had as different value.

One edition of the game came in a large wooden box measuring 18 1/2" x 12 1/2" x 3". Components included The Fish Pond (box insert with slots to hold the fish upright), six fishing poles, and fifty-four fish ("numbered in multiples of 3, as - 3, 6, 9, 12, etc." and marked with the name of the fish.)

Another edition of the game came in a box measuring approximately 17 1/2" x 4 1/4". This edition had only two fishing poles and fewer fish.

name: Game of Parlor Baseball
description: McLoughlin Game of Parlor Baseball from 1897. Actually Spin the Spinners type game. Features two spinners and nine yellow and nine blue game pieces. The very limited information for this game was gathered from Morphy Auctions.

name: Iowa State Fairopoly
description:
Iowa State Fairopoloy board game is a spinoff the popular Monopoly game, produced by an advertising firm in Newton, IA in 2004. It celebrated the 150 Year Anniversary (sesquicentennial) of The Iowa State Fair.
It has the same basic game play as Monopoly; dice rolling, buying properties, trading, buying houses, paying rent, etc. It features tokens in the shapes of a cow, a Ferris wheel and a horse. Players landing on Brad and Harry's cheese curds concession can buy it for $90.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Reality
description: This is a reality type game that has a playing board somewhat like a Monopoly board. The game is for Ages 7 and up. Game comes with cards that are used to determine what you do next.

name: The Original Baseball Playing Card Game
description:
A card game played using the regular rules of baseball. Players draw 5 cards at a time and take turns playing cards that either aid in scoring or in making outs. Hands are replenished when cards are played.

Contents:

Baseball diamond map sheet
Custom deck of cards with scoring (red) or black (outs) that are played according to the game situation.
Laminated scoreboard
Black crayon
Erasing cloth
Score pad for tracking results
8 plastic baseball players (4 red & 4 blue)
Instruction sheet

name: Wherry: The Elizabethan Thames River Game
description:
(from the rulebook explanation)

Wherry is a game of Watermanship on the Shakespearean Thames. In the merry but sometimes threatening ambiance of 16th century Elizabethan London, players of this game will re-enact the working lifestyle of a Thames Waterman (Wherryman). They will pick up passengers in their Wherries, from the various Landing Stairs situated along the riverbank and while rowing them to their destination, they will have to deal with the prevailing conditions of the tide, weather and other river hazards. They must also try to avoid colliding with other Wherries or with the Royal Barge and must give careful thought to the many chances and choices they will have during their voyaging up and down the river Thames.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Flintstones Memory Game
description:
From the manufacturer:

Little ones will enjoy the Flintstones Stone Age Memory Game! You don't need to be a prehistoric scientist to build your own Stone Age Television, Rock Guitar, or Baby Carriage. Each of the 12 inventions in the game is split into 4 cards. Collect them all and you can keep the invention. Play with your friends to see who can collect the most inventions, or use the special rules to play by yourself. For 1 or more players. Ages 4 - 8.
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Prehistoric

name: The Detective Kit Game
description:
From the manufacturer:

Calling all Junior Detectives!! Using real detective gadgets, solve a new mystery every time you play The Detective Kit Game. Create a clue card and decode secret code words. Write, and reveal, hidden messages with an invisible ink pen. Search the Ski Shop, Zoo and Aquarium for clues that will verify your hunches. Follow the footprints on the trail and use your magnifying glass to compare matching thumb prints. Collect the correct clues, and then race back to the Detective's office to win the game! For 2 to 4 Players. Ages 8 and up.

name: More Phun Spelling
description: Phonics based word game for Ages 6 and up.

name: Home Tweet Home Game
description: Role and Move game based on the Looney Tunes Characters Sylvester and Tweety.

name: The Alaskan Gold Rush
description:
From the Box (all spellings and grammar are identical to the box text):

The Alaskan Gold Rush

A Game of High Adventure

Is the rousing new board game that combines the excitement of poker with the incredible adventures of the Alaskan Frontier.

In the 1890's thousands of greenhorns flooded the Port of Skagway looking for riches beyond their wildest dreams. However, charging bull moose, ferocious Grizzly bear, raging rivers, ice flows and frost bite (sic) await all those who quest for gold. Only the most experienced gold-panners emerged from the wilderness unscathed with gold in their pockets. These SOURDOUGHS were the toughest of the tough, and would literally risk an entire year's earnings on the flip of a card in a poker hand.

Would you be willing to bet everything you have on a bluff, or will you play it safe. This is a game of strategy, luck and skill, where the game dramatically changes with the personality of the players.

The easy to play game includes:

1 Board of Alaska (the game track is superimposed on a satellite picture)
1 Deck of standard playing cards
100 Silver and Gold coins (Poker Chips)
100 $1 Dollar Bills
6 Playing pieces
1 Die (d6)
27 Adventure cards (15 gold, 12 silver)
6 I.O.U. Cards (4 gold, 2 silver)
Rules

The game begins as a simple roll-and-move mechanic with various spaces giving rewards or penalties. There are also spaces that can trigger a round of poker between the players - winner take all monies bet. The players must accumulate wealth enough to buy transportation to the gold fields and then find the motherlode (Big Vein). Once there, a final hand of poker is played and the person at the mine must have $500,000 remaining after the hand.

The components are of high quality and it presents an interesting twist on a mundane night of poker.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Wine Tour: The Napa Valley Game
description:
From the Instruction book:

Object: Tour the Napa Valley wine country starting from San Francisco, collecting wine point cards by visiting wineries along the way. In addition, Case Cards are collected from the burgundy-colored wineries at the ends of the side roads, and a bumper sticker is collected upon landing directly on Calistoga. The first person to return to San Francisco with 500 points (or a pre-determined number), at least two case cards (which are worth points and are included in the total) and a Calistoga bumper sticker, wins the game.

Equipment:

4 Decks of city cards
1 die
4 Wooden player tokens (in the shape of wine bottles)
1 deck of case cards
Bumper Stickers
Wine Point cards
Balloon spinner

The games looks as if it were produced to advertise the wineries of the Napa Valley. Over half of the instruction booklet is filled with the names and addresses of wineries that supported the game. Not much decision making here, even the intersections on the pathways have instructions on which way the tokens must move. The components are of a nice quality and even comes with a cloth bag to hold the wine bottle pawns.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Bottle Dice
description: The playing board consists of 22 colored circle spots, 1 'Start' spot, and 1 'Finish' spot. These areas are connected by arrows which show players where they may move to. Then each player shakes the bottle containing 4 colored plastic balls which is tilted until one of the balls rolls out. The color revealed indicates the allowed position on the game board a player may move. Movement is required, but only if possible. The first one to get from the Start position to the Finish circle, wins.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Capture the Mob
description:
Players take on the roles of FBI agents trying to capture mobsters, getting them off the street and into the federal penitentiary.

Agents roll the dice and move around the board. If they land on a mobster space, the mobster card is transferred to their penitentiary. In addition, if the mobster had not been previously captured, you claim the reward money listed on the mobster card. You can also nab mobsters by playing Capture cards from your hand. Play continues until all mobsters have been jailed. The agent with the most mobsters in the pen wins.

Contains:
1 game board
2 dice
1 deck of 36 cards
6 player packets
6 agent playing pawns
36 mobster cards
18 capture cards
6 cards numbered 1 through 6
Treasury chips in three denominations.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement

name: Tipsy Dipsy
description: Dexterity game in which the 2 players try and tip the board to roll the bugs towards the other player.

name: First Learning Games: Things that go
description: 23 learning games for young children. Featuring characters from Walt Disney cartoons in cars, trucks, balloons and other "things that move".

name: Fantastic Voyage Game
description:
Roll and Move children's outer space game for 2,3, or 4 players. Dated 1968 and numbered #4931, this game is in nice condition. This game is based on the 1966 movie "Fantastic Voyage", starring Steven Boyd and Raquel Welch.
Based on the cartoon series loosely based on concept of the movie.

name: Clock-A-Game
description:
Trivia game with a wind up clock that displays the questions and answers from a "player piano" type roll.

Features 3 categories. US Presidents, Countries of the World and Domesticated Animals.

name: Jr. League Magnetic Baseball
description: Dexterity Baseball game featuring a magnetic baseball and played on a metal board. The game features a lever activated pitcher and batter.

name: Director's Choice
description:
From the game box:
"Watch the full Length movie (optional), re-direct 16 scenes from the movie and answer 900 movie trivia questions."

This version uses the movie: A Star Is Born
Staring: Frederic March, Janet Gaynor and Adolphe Menjou

Basically this is a roll and move game with the object of moving your "actor" from the "dressing room" to the "stage" by answering trivia question specific to the movie "A Star is Born" and also generic Hollywood trivia

Box Components include:
Gameboard
Tokens and dice
Trivia Cards
VHS cassette tape w/ full length movie

name: Ruthless
description:
The Ruthless board played with two decks of cards and 16 marbles in four different colors.

Designed for Seattle-area senior citizens, the Ludo-like game is played with cards.

name: Princess Quest
description: The princess will wed the brave adventurer who is first to win three specific treasures (randomly selected among twelve treasures). This card and dice game is unusual for also having a map of the kingdom and cardboard chits for adventurers and monsters. It is something like Ravensburger's "Enchanted Forest" crossed with a Japanese card and dice game--players must travel the kingdom and memorize the location of the different treasures, all the while fighting monsters and messing with the other players.

name: Dalmania
description: Dalmania is a game for Dalmatian lovers. This is a simple spin-and-move game. The players move on the board and have various paths to pick from on the way to the goal.

name: Spooky Math Games
description:
Packaged in the form of a thin, staple bound book with 5 dice, Spooky Math Games is a collection of 13 games, each with a strong mathematical slant, and each with a kid-friendly 'spooky' theme. Many of the games require additional components, be it a deck of cards, counters, a hand drawn board, or a combination of all the above.

A common mechanic used in many of the games has players roll a number of dice and then perform addition, subtraction, multiplication and division on the results in order to reach a target number.

The included dice are black with white pips, with a square of bones runs along the perimeter of the faces. 4 of the dice have a standard configuration, while the fifth depicts a cartoon skull in place of the '6', and has additional meaning in some of the games.

The games presented in the book are:


Spider Legs
Pirate's Watch
Picking Through The Pumpkin Patch
Ghoul's Place
Haunted House
Ghost's Grave
Sitting on the Picket Fence
Broomsticks Up!
The Devil's Arithmetic
Skeletons in Your Closet
Witches' Brew
Lucky 13
Stomping Through The Graveyard


Sequel:

Spooky Scary Math Games

name: Themaword
description:
Themaword is a word game: random letters are placed on the gaming table, the players draw a category card and must find a word in the corresponding category, containing only letters found on the gaming table.

Categories include: domestic animals, verbs, colors, food, vegetables, ...

name: Face to Face with Dice
description:
Subtitled: 5000 years of dice and dicing
This 192-page book covers the entire history of dice in many cultures. It summarizes the many dice that have been found in sites of antiquity around the world. The history then moves into various efforts to outlaw or tax gambling with dice. There's also a chapter on dice cheating and another on modern dice. The book is peppered with interesting stories and legends that revolve around dice. If you ever wondered why many bone dice are hollow, it's explained. If you want to know where the best museum exhibits of dice are, it's also covered. The origins and evolution of many dice games are covered as well.

The book is heavily illustrated with drawings and photographs.

The copy I read was a complimentary copy published under the auspices of Dice & Games Ltd and translated from the original Dutch.

name: Dragon War: Long Life Set
description:
This set offers 5 life extender cards and 5 life counters. The cards allow players to play with more life and go all the way up to 75 points for marathon games where many expansions are being used at once.

Expansion to Dragon War
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Dragon Wars: Pregame Character Enhancement Charts
description:
This set expands the original Dragon War game and allows players to add special abilities to their characters for use in the game. Each character has different special abilities they can gain, and they vary from game to game.

Expansion to Dragon War
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Excel Saga Boardgame!
description: Excel Saga Boardgame! is a simple roll-and-move game included with the US DVD release of the anime series Excel Saga (Volume 5). Players choose between six characters represented by included circular punch-out tokens. Players then roll dice to advance along the board's path in typical roll-and-move fashion. There are numerous spaces with special instructions, such as playing rock-paper-scissors to advance, rolling a certain number, or singing the series' theme song.

name: His Coming
description:
From the box:
"His Coming - More than just a game!"

This is simply a roll-and-move and question answering game with a heavy Christian theme.
Game comes complete with board, instructions, pawns, cards and a bible.

Ages 8 and up

name: Couple Up!
description:
From the box:
"A hooker of a party game... fun and laughs for the entire family! Similar to the party game Twister but you couple yourself up with hooks! Ages 8 to adult."

Players use elastic bands around arms and legs to pass hooks from one player to another.

name: Taitavat lentäjät
description: The name of the game translates into English as Skillful Flyers and it's about birds. Actually there are three different games in the box that are all playable with the same set of components. The games are of different difficulty levels and it's intended that as the child grows the game(s) can grow together with him. The goal of all the three games is to collect a specified set of 15 different animals.

name: Scott's Baseball Card Game
description:
Front of Box:

"The Exciting new game invented especially for bubblegum card collectors.

"Experience the fun of card collecting and trading, card auctions, flipping contests, attic finds and much, much more.

A game the whole family can enjoy. May be played by 2 to 6 players."

Back of Box:

"Now you can have the fun of putting together your own collection of Tobacco Cards, Goudeys, Bowmans, Rookie Cards of your favorite super stars and other rare cards. Build your collection through trading, card auctions and flipping contests. Each card is worth points. You win the game by collecting cards totaling 1,500 points. you get a starter collection of star cards, common cards and collector's money but then it's up to you. However, beware of drawing those special cards. They're full of surprises! Just when you are about to win you may have to give up your best star card.

"An easy-to-play game for baseball card collectors of all ages.

"A great family game that can be played by from 2 to 6 collectors.

"An exciting and fast moving game of skill, luck and fun for beginning and advanced collectors. New collectors will pick up hobby terminology and learn to recognize names of rare cards. Seasoned collectors will find that the game recreates real life card collecting experiences.

"Here is what players have to say: 'Scott's Baseball Card Game is different every time it is played'...'If you like baseball card collecting, you'll love this game'...'There has never been a game like it.'"

Address on back of box is Scott's Baseball Cards, P.O. Box 12424, Salem, OR 97309
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Aero-ball
description:
Aero-Ball - It's loads of fun!"

The object here is to take turns tossing a marble. Depending on where it lands gives you the score, and you move your marker along the game board to see who reaches the finish line first

name: Play Football
description:
This is a really cool looking spin-and-move football game with the added twist of "you call the play" that influences the outcome of the spin.

Simple components include:
box w/ instruction inside lid
2 player chits
football field w/ attached spinner

The art deco look to the game really sets it a part.

name: Brief 'n' Brisk Major League Baseball
description:
Fast-Action Games created many "quick-play" sports simulations where the outcome of a contest could be decided with just one or two dice rolls. These games made it easy to play an entire series of games in a matter of just a few minutes.

This game covers professional baseball (Major League). Like all of the team sports games in this line, a few simple numbers, devised from team statistics, enable the player to recreate an entire season in a short period of time.

name: Heroes Incorporated: Crime Wave
description:
Crime Wave is the latest expansion for Heroes Incorporated. The Super Villains turn the tables on the Heroes in an attempt to overrun Megalopolis! New Heroes join the fight, but is it too late to save the city?

Contents:


2 new Heroes with brand new powers
4 new Super Villains
20 new Research Cards, including new cards which allow you to draw and play more cards without using Action Markers
8 Event Cards, which alter the balance of power each round
Game pieces for a 5th player


This expansion is slated for a 2009 release.

name: 6 Maths Board Games
description:
In the box are 6 distinct math-orientated board games. They teach such concepts as addition, subtraction, place value, counting 1 to 100, colour and shape, and time.

The board games are specifically designed for year 1 and 2.

Included within are:
Addition Adder
Colour Shape Sheriff (which is a Candyland Variant)
Time Travel
and 3 others.

name: Turf Coot
description: Vintage horse racing game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Little Benny: The Eager Beaver Game
description: Appears to be a typical children's roll and move type game. Benny and his beaver family try not to get eaten by wolves or killed by humans. (from Alvin's Vintage Board Games)

name: Streamlined Train Game
description:
Inspired by the 1936 tour of the Million Dollar Rexall train. The 12-car train, the longest in the World at that time, visited every state in the US and many points in Canada in 8 months, covering over 30,000 miles.

This is a spin-and-move children's race game billed as "Exciting, Amusing And educational". The race starts and ends in Boston, Mass.

name: Scappo
description: The Pixie War between the men of Hopville and the men of Skipville. Board features a yellow and blue checkerboard with pictures of Pixies on many of the boxes. It includes 12 red and 12 black markers and a die.

name: Robbing the Miller
description:
The object of the game is to steal grain from the other player's miller. Whoever steals the most grain wins.

The board has a red and black track along the outside of the board.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Baby Barn Yard
description: This game involves spinning a spinner and collecting cards for various animals until someone has all of the cards.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Onino
description:
This Gabriel-Nealey Co. game is played with smooth 7/8" plastic chips on a 15x15 grid. The published game board has squares that are about 15/16" each side. The object of the game is to be the first to get 5 chips in a row, horizontally, vertically, or diagonally. It is the same game as Go-Moku.

While the edges of the game board are decorated with various configurations of chips, these are basic patterns from which the game may be won. Gabriel-Nealey Co. also published the 60-page booklet "Onino Basic Plays" by Henmar Ruskin, copyright 1942.

name: Popeye's Game
description: Popeye's Game is a tiddly-winks variation, where the object is to propel your tiddly-wink through a hoop featuring Popeye characters or items.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: A Motor Ride
description:
This roll-and-move game features a winding yellow track on top of a green (grassy) background. It's "a jolly game for 2, 3, or 4 players." From the Powerhouse Museum "The game is significant because it uses scenarios familiar to Australian country motorists during the first half of the twentieth century, when Australian roads were largely poor, gravel sections and steep hills made conditions treacherous, and cars were unreliable. The poor road conditions sometimes saw cars needing major repairs to axles and springs. Another very Australian obstacle on the road was a flock of sheep. The game reflects the poor state of the roads and the uncertainty of arriving at your destination without some mishap occurring. The aim of the game is to progress from the petrol station at the 'start' and travel to the gate marked 'home' via 100 squares numbered 1 to 100. Players move from the start to finish as quickly as possible by taking it in turns to throw the dice. Along the way various motoring obstacles, calamities, and misadventures including punctures, collisions, wrong turns, road blocks, flocks of sheep, bridges under repair, gravel on the road, broken springs, steep hills and axle trouble must be negotiated. These all require the player to miss throws or return to the start.

There is several versions of this game and several board sizes produced. The earliest version was registered in 1910 and most likely continued till the late 1930s or early 1940s. In the first version the designer cryptically placed the date of publishing in the number plate of the car closest to home.

name: Game of Authors: Cribbage
description: This old game is by the same publishers as some other 'Authors' games from the 1800s, but is a variation that is a departure from previous games by that title.

name: Senior Savvy Brainstormers
description: This is pseudo-trivia game where the players brainstorm and score based on their brainstorms. The trivia is targeted at folks who were born prior to 1960.

name: The Game of Chicken
description: The Game of Chicken has the look of a game of bingo, with chips, rows of items where the chips could be placed, and a die.

name: kicker Fussball-Quiz 2
description:
kicker Fußball-Quiz 2 is a trivia card game about soccer and adds new cards for kicker Fußball-Quiz 1. 80 Cards with 4 questions and answers each, by leading soccer journalists. The game includes: 80 cards, 4 red and yellow cards, the rules.

Ages 10 and up. Released: Essen 2007. Box size: 6x10x3 cm.

name: kicker Fussball-Quiz 1
description:
kicker Fußball-Quiz is a trivia card game about soccer. 80 Cards with 4 questions and answers each, by leading soccer journalists. The game includes: 80 cards, 4 red and yellow cards, the rules.

Ages 10 and up. Released: Essen 2007. Boxsize: 6x10x3 cm.

name: Multo Arithmetic Game
description:
From the game box:
"For group drill in teaching 100 combinations in multiplication."

This is just an educational bingo-type game designed to teach multiplication.

name: The American Marksman
description:
From the game box:
"The Only Harmless Target Game"

This is simply a turn of the century Target practice set that they marketed as a "game" interestingly enough.

It comes with:
Metal swivel target
gun
ammunition
instructions

name: GoGo Dragon
description:
From the publisher's website:
Fill in the short sentences!

3 games in 1! Play Bingo or Loto, Memory and Domino. Fill in the short sentences and win!

In French (Spanish) or English.
Ages 3 and up
1-4 players
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Memory, Word Game

name: He Shoots... He Scores Football DVD Quiz
description:
Each question on the DVD shows either a Video clip, photograph or trivia question based on the beautiful game's greatest goals, gaffs, free kicks, fouls & classic moments in football history ....... it's a game for all seasons.

The winner is the first player to triumph at the interactive penalty shoot out, strike the ball past the keeper to the back of the net.

He shoots....He scores....Get in !

Contents

1 x Playing board

1 x Interactive DVD

4 x Footballer playing pieces

1 x Trophy

1 x Die

25 x Red cards

25 x Star player cards

1 x Instructions leaflet

name: Decision in Normandy
description:
International Game Series game from Multi-Man Publishing. It was removed from the MMP's pre-order list in July 2008.

Scaled at mostly regimental level, 4 kilometers a hex and with 4 days per turn, Decision in Normandy covers the period from the D-Day landings until the successful breakout from Normandy in late July of 1944. Using a highly interactive game turn sequence with multiple movement and combat phases and reserve use, a firepower based CRT, and the use of situational morale states, Decision in Normandy offers a unique look at this very famous moment in World War Two.

It is all here – armor effects, breakthroughs, desperate defenses, naval gunfire, air power, artillery support, extensive England to beachhead subroutines, and more. All in a seamless game system that still focuses on playability and elegance.

Decision in Normandy was originally published in 1981 by Epoch games of Japan.

Sequence of Play

German Player Turn:

Weather
1st Movement Phase
1st Combat Phase
1st Reorganization Phase
Reaction Phase
2nd Movement Phase
2nd Combat Phase
2nd Reorganization Phase


Allied Player Turn: The Allied Player Turn is similar to the German Player Turn, but replaces the Weather phase with Naval Gunfire and Air Attacks.

Components:
2 x 34 by 20 inch maps
880 Counters
28 page rulebook
2 player aides

Solitaire rating: Excellent
Complexity: Meduim
Playing time: 10-12 hours for the 12 turn campaign game.
Scenarios: 3

Designer: Ginichiro Suzuki
Developer: Adam Starkweather
Graphic Artist: Niko Eskubi

name: CAR-TAB Auto License-plate game
description: Simple travel/car bingo-like game.

name: A Flight Round the World
description: Players move around the world in an effort to visit important sites first. The board shows the world with places like Athens and Paris in framed pictures. Components include 6 metal travelers (pawns).

name: G.I. Joe Navy Frogman Game
description: Very simple spin and move "kids" game from Hasbro.

name: A Journey By Air
description: A roll & move game focused on the airplane. The pawns are metal planes.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, Travel
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: A Motor Tour
description: This is a simple children's game in which the pawns are metal automobiles. It's a simple race on a board showing the countryside. Cars of the 1900's, open air and driven by a large handle running down the vehicles center.

name: Barrola
description: Players manipulate colored barrels along pivoting ramps using a sort of pastry wheel. At the end of the ramp they are dropped into a tray (the box bottom) with holes, different scores associated with each hole.

name: Bicycle Race
description: A simple roll and move game produced for both the British and German markets.

name: Gliding
description: Roll & move game in which players score points for performing aerobatics in their gliders.

name: Glida
description: A very simple shuffleboard game. Players use egg-shaped pieces. The board has two sides, a simple version in which there are 19 scoring holes of varying values. The flip-side has a miniature golf feel, in that a clown must be dodged in order to get to the scoring holes.

name: Fighting the Fire
description: Classic Spears roll and move game with an inward spiraling board. The pawns are metal firemen.

name: Rocket Bowling
description:
Rocket Bowling is a vintage tin action toy.

For one or more players.
Play time is approx. 15-20 Mins. or more depending on how many players you have.

Set includes: one tin bowling lane (29.75"L X 6.25"W), 10 real wooden pins, two black marbles, and, one tin bowler figure.

You start the game by setting up the bowler on the end of the lane. His arm is pulled back behind a lever and the ball (marble) is placed on a stand in front of the bowlers right arm. Place the ten wooden pins on the ten markers. Now you aim and pull the trigger to release the bowlers arm and hopefully you've got yourself a strike! You score the game exactly the same as you would a real game.

name: Cuebridge
description: Children's game in which small cue sticks are used to hit balls slightly bigger than a normal marble. The idea is to hit the balls so they rest directly underneath the arches of a bridge.

name: Rodeo Kart
description:
A well-equipped game with a seldom used scenario: Kart Racing !

Before starting the game the players agree how many times they want to round the racecourse.

Each one starts with a different kart and tries to outwit the opponent upon grading up his race gear, either by card play or by investing money. The money has to be earned during the race.

You can do this by reaching different spaces on the racecourse or by playing one of the 50 action-cards at the right time, on top of throwing the right number on the die.

These cards allow weird actions, such as throwing a hay bale (come with the game- although in plastic...)in front of another cart or hauling it in with a lasso! For certain situations you can even earn a gold medal.

Winner is the player with the most points for the best kart, the most money, the most rounds in the lead, the best actions, for holding the gold medal etc.

There is also a variant to play as an elimination race, the last one staying upright is the winner !
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ich heiße LORA
description:
This light filler from Rudi Hoffmann is somewhat different in several ways.
It uses the closed box as part of the game. As a rules sheet or booklet would hinder play the rules are printed on top of the box lid.

Game consists of 6 coloured player mats, each depicting the outer lines of a parrot. The parrot has to be puzzled of 6 different parts.

To claim these parts (also in 6 colours), you have to close the box and to rattle it back and forth, up and down. When you open it, you see a hole in an insert cardboard mask, also depicting a parrot. Below this mask is a two-sided ramp with a plateau in the middle, where you notice a circle.

If you find one or more parrot-puzzle-piece(s) touching the circle, you can take them to complete the parrot on your mat.
Pieces you already claimed before are put back in the box.

The completed parrot is worth different points, regarding how much different colours it contains (the more the better).

name: Quiz Ladder
description:
A quiz game where you are climbing a ladder to be first to the top, get 12 right & you've won (similar to 'Who wants to be a Millionaire') but your opponents will hamper you & the nearer you get to the top the further the fall !

Can you remember which Swiss company makes the milky bar, what colour is B&Q's logo or what SAS stands for ?

Contents

600 x Question cards with 3600 questions

1 x Ladder Scorecard

1 x Rules sheet

name: Preferences
description:
Preferences is a fast-moving, light hearted party game of likes & dislikes in which everybody has to guess everybody else's preferences in a wide range of topics & categories.

A game to play time & time again !

Contents

90 x Preference cards

30 x Bonus cards

6 x Sets of voting cards

6 x Pencils

1 x Sand timer

1 x Preferences pad

1 x Scorecard

1 x Rules sheet
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Memory, Team-Based Game

name: Gruesome Games
description:
Challenge your friends to a Gruesome Games play-off & you'll be an awesome ancient expert in no time.

Knuckle down to a game of chuckstones with the rotten Romans, try some awfully old blindfold games, get sneaky with the Egyptian snake game or go head-to-head with the groovy Greeks in their coin-flipping contest.

Ancient games & some still played in their countries of origin.

Play games & learn ancient history at the same time !

Contents

1 x Double-sided coin

5 x Knucklebones

6 x Blue counters

6 x Red counters

1 x Blindfold

1 Rules leaflet
categories: Action / Dexterity, Ancient, Educational, Horror, Math

name: Rugrats Bump & Bust Out
description: In this game, you play as Rugrats characters trying to bust out of the play pen by riding the dog, Spike. You have to avoid obstacles like scattered toys and Angelica to escape successfully.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Door County: Season to Season, Shore to Shore – A Property Trading Game
description: Door County - Season to Season, Shore to Shore, A Property Trading Game is a Monopoly type game that uses Wisconsin's Door County as a setting. Play is exactly like Monopoly with the traditional locations substituted with Door County landmarks like Dairy View, County Store,Door County YMCA and Little Sweden. Playing pieces include a Lighthouse, Cookie the Cow, Train, Cherry Pie, Yacht and Anchor.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Nimble Numbers
description: Nimble Numbers is a partnership Tic-tac-Toe variant that uses rotating disks. Additionally, besides just trying to get 3 in a row, you attempt to collect combinations of numbers to improve your scoring.

name: Get in the Scrap
description:
This game has a very unique theme: collecting scrap metal for the war effort.

The board features four scrap collection centers, four iron foundries, and paths among them.

name: Top Pacheeza
description:
This game's board has a maze of colored squares. Players are attempting to go from one part of the board to another. The theme of the game is related to Native Americans.

On the box the game is Top Pacheeza, but on the board the game is Top Pacheesa.

name: Hullabaloo: The Game of Observation
description:
Hullabaloo the Game of Observation

Players wager on winning three rounds of observation activities using pictures of cluttered junk. In Eyespy the players look for items that the Game Boss has chosen. The first player to find each of the three objects wins double his wager. In Scrutiny the players look at a picture card for a minute and then answer questions that the Game Boss asks about the picture. In Detection the Game boss picks out an item and writes several clues for the other players to use to determine that object.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Memory, Pattern Recognition, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Peopling
description:
Be the first player to populate the central goal line with your pawns. How you accomplish this can differ depending on the rule variant used. Examples include:

King of the Hill: Roll the dice and move one pawn either the number of spaces shown on one die, or the total of the two dice. Keep rolling and moving until a six is showing on either die, or doubles other than ones are rolled.

King of Battle: Roll the dice. Not only are you attempting to get your men to the goal line, but you are also shooting at them in an attempt to hinder their progress. Wounded pawns are removed from the board, but can be re-introduced later.

Virtually Golfing: Each track is a hole, and are played sequentially. Roll the dice, and move your pawn the lower of the two numbers towards the goal. Roll double ones and you hole out. Any other doubles mean a swing and a miss. Par is 5 for each hole, and the lowest score after all holes are played wins.

Game includes 12 pawns (6 of each color), two dice, rules, and a game board. The rules and game board can also be downloaded and printed from the http://game.peopling.net/ website, and played using your own pawns and dice.

name: Toy Town Railroad Game
description: This is a simple roll and move game from Parker Brothers. The box says that the game contains Rail Road Tickets, Pullman Tickets, and Toy Money.

name: The 3 Little Pigs
description:
This is a spin-and-move game about the three little pigs. On the box cover, the wolf is bigger than the pigs' brick house.

"Based on the movie sensation!"
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Rainbow Riders
description:
The first player to get their Rainbow Rider over the Rainbow & into the Pot of Gold wins the game. To do this, your Rainbow Rider must be on the fifth piece of the Rainbow of any colour & then you must roll that same colour again, thus reaching the Pot of Gold. (But don't stop playing ! Finish building the entire Rainbow by rolling the die until all of the Rainbow sections have been placed on the game board !)

Another beautifully produced game from Ravensburger !

Contents

1 x Game board

25 x Coloured Rainbow pieces

4 x Rainbow riders

1 x Coloured die

1 x Instructions leaflet
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Tchic-tchac
description: Tchic-tchac is a game for children 4 and up made of a board with 4 x 4 pegs. To start, you randomly place the 16 cubes (4 of each of the 4 colors) on the pegs and you draw one of the several cards where a 4 x 4 pattern is drawn. Your goal is to reach this pattern with a minimum number of swaps ideally in less time than your opponent.

name: Overload
description:
The object of this game is to transport your trucks and containers from the start to an unloading bay avoiding as many penalties as possible.

Some of the loads are overweight and being caught with an overweight load means going back to the start.

There are squares to avoid (breakdowns, punctures and out of fuel) as well as some safety squares (truck parks), but the game is, in essence, a a race to get your loads from the start to the finish before anybody else.

One player plays the Police and cannot win the game - his goal is to hinder the other players as much as possible. (This is probably best played by a parent or Games Master. Alternatively, the Police car can be moved by mutual agreement, which makes the game playable by 2 to 6 players.)
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Verenigde Indische Compagnieen (VIC)
description:
A Dutch family game from the early postwar days (estimated).

On a very large and beautifully illustrated game board players round the globe with their ships in order to try to acquire commodities to make the most profit.
The commodities come in large amounts (51 sets of 4), such making the numbers up to 204.
The more you collect from one set, the larger your profit.
There are special rules for handling the hazards, entering a port, encountering an opponents ship, selling your commodities etc.

Voyage is done by 6 thick cardboard ships, payment is made with an uncountable amount of thin cardboard gold coins in different values.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Fami Train
description:
A French family game from the late 60ies/early 70ies.

Game consists of a large gameboard depicting a railroad track, 12 cardboard locomotives in 6 colours, a load of cardboard wagons, movement and hazard cards, 6 player mats, two dice and a load of commodity cards.

Aim of the game is to be the first to add 5 wagons to your locomotive and to fill these wagons with given commodities (passengers, postal freight, dishes etc.)

Certain rules allow to exchange in excess acquired commodities with other ones or to buy a wagon for these.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Kirsch Royal
description:
In times before the Fackler-Games this must be the most expensive game edition.
It was a personal dream of the author to become true, 1000 were intended to be made.

The game consists of: 1 three-dimensional wooden board, measuring approx. 1 yard square, 62 cherries in 3 colours (1 inch diameter) 62 leaves in 3 colours, 15 bonus-cherries, 42 point-allowance-pawns and 4 coloured birds on trees as playing pawns, all made of wood too.

Name of the game means "Royal Cherry".

After setting up the game with the beautiful components mentioned above players start to move their birds in the centre field measuring 7 x 6 squares, containing the point-allowance-pawns depicting leaves and cherries in alternate appearance.
The number depicted is the maximum you can harvest from a certain tree (cherries or leaves).
After your move the bird sits in the hole left by the pawn. Next time your move has to start from there, such restricting your further moves.
Aim of the game is to go for the bonus cherries counting points at the end.
You can earn them being the LAST one harvesting a tree or by being the one with the most cherries and leaves harvested from a certain tree.
As the trees have three different sizes, there are different amounts of bonus cherries to gain.

This is not a game for children, you have to twist your brain for the best moves !

name: Skag the Yuppie
description: A simple, humorous wargame depicting a neighborhood defending itself against a horde of yuppies bent on moving in. Movement and combat are die-based, and involve both conventional weapons and "Bad Taste" weapons such as belches and loud shirts.

name: Person-alysis
description:
One of the most exciting, ever-changing human attributes is the MIND. The way you think—the way your family, friends, and neighbors think—why you think one way one time and another way at another. Because your mind is YOU, the game PERSON-ALYSIS was created.

PERSON-ALYSIS is a revealing psychological game for adults based on the latest psycho-scientific testing techniques. It consists primarily of specially prepared inkblots and can be played by 4 or more adults.

Contents:
· Twenty cards with 40 specially-designed inkblots
· A specially-designed inkblot holder
· "Interpretation" sheets
· Scoring pad
· Booklet on interpretations and their meanings

name: Crushed Metal
description: A mini-game included with with the WorldWorks Games cardstock model set "Platform Commander: Red Sector". It is a diceless Mech combat game that uses the customisable Mecha and scenery included in the set. There are Basic and Advanced rules versions.
categories: Fighting, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Spell It
description:
Vintage spelling game. Also includes games for arithmetic.

This game features a board with the alphabet written around the edges of a circle in the center of the board. The board is 17.5 x 17.5 inches.

name: Oflameron card game
description:
Unusual version of card game “Oflameron”, in which cards are used for creating a playing field, on which blocks (markers) of players are moved. For playing, you should download images of cards, print the required number of cards and buy or make a usual small playing cube. Any number of players can participate in the game.
You might have participated in such games, in which you move blocks along an artful road depending on the number of points shown on a playing cube thrown. You might have participated in card games. A card version of this game “Oflameron” resembles somehow both games – You should move your blocks (markers) along a road made of playing cards, depending on the number of points shown on a small playing cube thrown. During the game, you will have to estimate income and losses after each step and plan your strategy for achieving the maximal success.
A card game created according to the principle “print-n-play”. All materials (cards, game rules, description) are presented in an electronic form, they are to be printed and then you can start playing. It is convenient – you need not buy anything for starting this game. Any number of players may participate in the game. All is defined by the number of cards and the size of a playing field. A score is kept during the game. All materials are included in a http://card.shmeleff.com/ ZIP archive.

name: Mail Coach Game
description:
"Get the mail through"

This is a spin-and-move game about delivering mail in the old west. It has 4 wood counters and a spinner. The board features art about the American Old West and round colored circles for a movement track.

name: Arabian Game
description: Arabian Game is a game played on a board using regular checkers. The board features red circles with black paths between them. The black paths form three squares with a common center (each larger than the next). 'Arabian Checkers' is written in the center.

name: Meteor Game
description: This game from the 1920s is played with marbles on a hexagon that is five spaces wide on each side. The box cover features a picture of two girls playing the game at a table with a boy sitting on the table looking on.

name: Lightning Express
description:
A family game from the pre-war times (estimated).

Players move their pawns round the railroad track according to the throw of two dice.
The board is part of the game box basement.
The track is colour-coded, so every time you land on a given colour you have to put a passenger chip (from your starting amount) into the station of the corresponding colour.
To add some decision making you can choose if you want to do this on your own colour or not.
Every time 10 passengers have amassed on a station, the complete board (all stations) is swept by the owner.

After a pre-game agreed number of sweeps the game ends and the winner is the player with the most passengers in hand.

A little added spice are some red lights (wooden chips), which are placed in front of a train when the player throws a 2, 3 or 12.
It can only be removed by throwing a 7, 11 or double.
As long as the red light is on, the train thus blocked cannot move nor can the owner sweep the board should his station contain 10 passengers.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Gipfel
description:
(Summit)

Introductory text of the game book (in many languages):

Cooperative behavior and mutual assistance

A group of ramblers is preparing for a mountain-climbing expedition to the summit. In the mountains each is dependant on the help of the others. No one person alone should attempt such a climb. A mountain stream may only be crossed with the help of a second player. On a steep rock-face it is even more difficult. The group members have to rope themselves together, so mutual assistance is also necessary. Shortly before the summit, they are threatened by a belt of rain.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Tom Mix's Game: Wildcat
description: Tom Mix was a "Silent Movie" Cowboy Star from the early days of the movies. He made movies from 1910 to 1935 and of the more than 330 films made all but 9 were Silent Films. This is basically a rummy game with some pictures of western themes.
categories: American West, Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Space Colony Cheeses
description:
From the rules:

You are in charge of colonizing a newly discovered world, Bos III. Your task is to build a thriving, profitable dairy colony. You must choose when, where and how to expand. You'll have to balance the need for money-making modules against the need for energy production. If you can afford it, you may want to expand into other dairy products, increase your storage capacity, or just harass the competition with endless lawsuits. The choices, and the responsibility, are yours.

Space Colony Cheeses is a light-hearted, non-violent game for 2-4 players. The game includes a map, score sheets and game counters; all you provide is one or two six-sided dice.
categories: City Building, Humor, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: To A Pulp
description:
Fast-playing, simple pulp-gaming rules that use free downloadable paper counters and four kinds of map sets (included). 2+ players.

From the rules:

Pulp gaming, in which each player controls a character or faction from a 1930's pulp thriller, is growing in popularity. Such games combine the visual appeal of miniatures gaming with aspects of role-playing games, allowing the players to control the actions of tough private eyes, seemingly-helpless dames, brave explorers, and all the rest.

The rules are made for simplicity and fast play. The game is meant for use with miniatures, but you can download a set of paper minis for free. All you have to provide is a few six-sided (d6) and ten-sided (d10) dice. The game is meant for two or more players, but it can be used for solo gaming as well.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Dragon War: X-Pack
description: This expansion to Dragon War collects 14 full-color art gallery cards and 98 game cards (seven for each gallery card) to add more options for the players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Multimo
description:
This is a game for two players or two teams. Each party has a grid of 8 by 10 in which they have to construct a crossing word. Both players get the same letters. They place these letters on their own grid in trying to make the most points as possible. Once a letter has been placed it shouldn't be moved anymore.
The player (or team) who gains the most points wins the game.

name: Hex-O-Gram
description:
Hex-o-gram is similar to Tri-Ominos, except much more colorful.
There are 48 pieces, each with three arrowhead-shaped colored panes.
45 of the pieces have unique combinations of 5 colors. Three pieces
are all white "wildcards".

Each player has a "hand" of tiles, and scores by emptying his hand,
or by forming hexagonal patterns in the playing area.

name: Give Us A Job
description:
Give Us A Job is a roll and move game where players are trying to get a job, keep it, and then gather enough money to be able to buy five luxury items and have £100,000 in cash.

There are chance cards and players collect a salary every time they pass their home square.

The items required to win the game are: a helicopter, a house, a yacht, a sports car and a swimming pool (whether they have a house to go with it or not). Sadly, these are represented by cards rather than models.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: MéliMélo
description: MéliMélo is a game for children 3 and up. 10 cards with the bottom half on an insect are dealt to the players, and the cards with the matching halves make the draw pile. Cards are drawn one by one and players try to assemble the insects, which have names that rime, like (in french) Mireille l'abeille.

name: Puzzlito
description: Puzzlito is a circular jigsaw puzzle describing the activities of the day of Pompon the bear. Players try to find the pieces and place them in order. It's an educational game to teach children 3 and up the notion of time.

name: Bingo des images
description: Bingo des images (french title) is a game for children 5 to 12 . Each player gets a board with a 5 x 6 grid. The top 5 square contain the letter of the word BINGO, and each of the others contain one of 6 images. There is one die with the letters of BINGO and one with the 6 images. Dices are rolled and players place tokens on the matching letter/images on their board. The first player with a line of 5 tokens (horizonal, vertical or diagonal) wins.

name: Spider-Man 3 Wall Crawl Race Game
description: This is a movie tie-in children's game. One player plays Venom, the other plays Spider Man. Each player is armed with a Spider-Man like webshooter that shoots a laser beam instead of webs. You aim the lazer beam at a dector attached to your character. If you aim the beam correctly, you character will begin to climb. First character to the top wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: It's News to Me!
description:
From Back of Box:

With "It's News to Me!" the race is on to the editor's office in a new "unbored" game that has players pretending to be reporters on assignment. "It's News to Me!" sparks student imagination and interest in today's world. The game challenges students to complete tasks that incorporate every aspect of the Newspaper.

The ACTIVITY BOOK covers:
- What is a newspaper?
- Newspaper Terms
- Classroom Ideas
- The Front Page
- Headlines
- What makes it news?
- Where does the news come from?
- Editorials
- Editorial Cartoons
- Advertising in the newspaper
- This 'N That

These exercises introduce students to styles of writing, design, personalities in the news and world events. The activities include drawing conclusions, comparing points of view and decision making. Suitable for Grades 4 and higher.
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Simulation, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: Komm wir rechnen
description: Komm Wir Rechnen, or Come We Learn to Count, is an education game in which children learn mathmatics by placing equations onto the correct answer on a grid of numbers. When all the tiles are placed, they are turned over to reveal images, which, if all the answers are correct, will form a complete picture.

name: Little Chicks
description: Simple roll & move children's game in which the pawns are baby chicks.

name: Forever Families
description: Forever Families is an LDS game that is designed to teach the methods of researching family history for work in Mormon Temples. Players move around the board attempting to match "Archive Records" with "Ancestor Cards." The first player who is able to take seven "Cleared Names" to the temple is the winner.
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Blitz-Flug um die Erde
description:
A roll-and-move game with some unusual aspects.

Before gameplay you have to fix two metal arcs into the gameboard so that they cross at the centre of the board.

Then you begin starting in Berlin to travel along the routes with a car, trying to reach the next airport first.
On the way you have to answer trivia questions of the regions and cities you touch, which can hinder or accelerate your voyage.
At the airports you change transport and start to move via airplane along the metal arcs. If planes pass each other, one uses the upside and the other the downside of the arc.
The next airport you change back to car.

Winner is the player to arrive back first in Berlin.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Pass auf, kleine Maus!
description:
The playing board shows 12*16 tiles. Most of them show a piece of cheese, or sometimes a cat. On 6 tiles there is an image of six different sweets (cake, ice cream, ...). At last there is one starttile.
There are also 18 cardboard pieces with 3 times the 6 different sweets.
The last part of the game is a cardboard square with in the middle of it a hole. This is the mousecard.
The first player moves the hole of the mousecard accross the starttile. The first of the 18 sweets is revealed. Now the player moves the mousecard accross the board in the direction of the same sweet as shown on the board. At every tile passed he verifies the nature of the tile. If it is a piece of chees then he continues. But if the cat appears the turn goes to the next player. When at last the tile with the same sweet appears the player on turn receives the sweet.
Now the next sweet is revealed and the game continues.
The player winning 4 sweets wins the game.

name: The Dogs
description:
A greyhound racing and betting game.

It consists of 46 cards:

6 cards showing traps
8x greyhound No.1
8x No.2
7x No.3
6x No.4
5x No.5
5x No.6
1x disqualified


Game itself is fairly simple: The traps are laid out one above the other, bets are placed on them.
The stack is shuffled well, and one card after another is turned up slowly and laid out along its trap card. Winner is the dog which has 5 turned up cards along its trap.
As there are different number of cards for each dog the odds are fixed accordingly, so that you can make the most money with dogs no.5 and 6.
If the "Disqualified" card turns up it is laid above the trap cards: If a dog has 5 cards counting for it this one is disqualified; winner is the next in line.

name: GoraKhpoR
description:
Gorakhpor is a two dimensional game of strategy using a draughts-like set up but requiring the mind set of a chess player. To win, you must be the first to form a straight and continuous line linking four points on the board.

The word 'gorakhpor' means "Go to a waiting room!"

When the game is played according to the 3 quickly and easily learnt rules, families, friends and strangers are brought comfortably together.

name: Makahit
description:
There are many handmade components with the game, but also many professional produced, such as the game board or the play money.

Each player moves his token around the board, to his choice by the throw on one die or two dice.
There are switches where to decide which way to follow.
Moving along players discover stars and songs and combine them to make a hit ("MAKAHIT").
With these they challenge for a place in the top ten in order to make money.
The money enables a player to buy gold discs, and the first to buy 5 gold discs is the winner of the game.

In the time intended to be released, the game could have been a hit. But as the author mentions in the professional produced rules: "Owing to legal difficulties it is not possible to print the actual names of stars and songs on the cards."
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Draw It Outloud
description:
"Helping children and families express concerns and feelings of grief"

A therapeutic tool for professionals, a game used by family therapists and bereavment councilors to help kids in the grieving process after the death of a loved one.

name: Natural History Lotto
description: An early children's version of lotto or bingo in which the tiles drawn feature a variety of colorful animals.

name: Mind Your Manners
description:
Mind Your Manners

(from the front of the box) -
This fun and informative board game will help you to stop wrestling with artichokes and start putting your best fork forward...for children, teenagers and adults.

Includes a special section on business etiquette for adults.

(and from the back of the box) -
From "which fork to use" to "how to make proper introductions," MIND YOUR MANNERS is the first board game of protocol and etiquette.

What a fun way for children, teens, adults and those on the corporate climb to be more at ease in social and business situations with table and telephone manners, restaurant etiqueete, greetings and introductions, international protocol and much more!!!

name: The Chat-Up Board Game
description:
This chat-up game for all the family is just what sweet talkers everywhere have been waiting for !

Anytime, anyplace, anywhere you can test those classic gems on the opposite sex - in the wine bar, the supermarket, the launderette, the fitness club, at the night club or even at the beach - smooth in there to win the game.

You'll have everything going for you if you've got the right posing stuff but beware those put downs, you may never be the same again !

Check out your compatibility, learn a few fancy lines & find out just who is the sweetest talker in town ..... !

Contents

1 x playing board

1 x Pack of Chat-up lines & Decision cards

1 x Pack of Posing stuff, Responses & Compatibility check cards

6 x Pawns

1 x Die

30 x Counters (five of six colours)

1 x Rules Leaflet
categories: Collectible Components, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Snipkick
description: A table top version of soccer. Finding a copy intact would be an accomplishment, as not even the the Spears history has a decent picture of it. One reason children's games are so collectible is that they are rarely found in good condition.

name: Playing for the Cup
description: This abstraction of a soccer game has players manipulating a ball counter across a board using dice rolls. The game includes 6 chits representing players on the field that may block the ball. Also included is a dual wheel for keeping score.

name: On the Dirt Track
description:
One of Spears' many roll-and-move children's race games. In this one the players are motorcyclists in a dirt track race. The pawns are motorcycles.
Special events are triggered when players land on special colored squares.

Players race to be the first back to the starting line. The first one back wins.

Rules on inside board cover.

name: Spark
description:
